To whom shall we go is a question to ask when one is at a crossroads! When things are not falling in place after you‚Äôve tried and done all that is necessary, and yet.

 

The realities of life can put you as it were in a tight corner such that you become frustrated. In a situation where reason has failed, human help is not forthcoming, desperation has set in and you are at your wit‚Äôs end.

 

Here is where Peter‚Äôs response comes in handy! Turn to Jesus!

 

Many a time this simple three-word sentence is not understood in practical terms! What does it mean to ‚Äúturn to Jesus‚Äù  in practice?  
 

It means going to Him through prayers, meditating on His Word, and reflecting, all done in the quiet and alone. Cry, weep, etc., if you can; these will come automatically as the heart is overburdened with grief!  
 

Jesus is our only hope in times of trial! Remain calm and gentle no matter how long it takes; the storms will come to pass! Just anchor firmly in Christ.

 

Let the words of the popular hymn ‚ÄúWill your anchor hold‚Äù  encourage you ;

 

‚ÄúWe have an anchor that keeps the soul
Stedfast and sure while the billows roll,
Fastened to the Rock which cannot move,
 Grounded firm and deep in the Savior‚Äôs love‚Äù.

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: Give No Ear: A Practical Advice
text:
Give No Ear: A Practical Advice

Ecclesiastes 7
KJV
20 For there is not a just man upon earth, that doeth good, and sinneth not.
21+ Also take no heed unto all words that are spoken; lest thou hear thy servant curse thee:

 

The writer of these words, Solomon to me was a pragmatist and it is this that draws me closer to him! He tells it as it is and calls a spade a spade.

How I wish I could leave behind my diaries to be read by all just like he has done with his titled Ecclesiastics! I‚Äôve been working on mine for many years now! Hmmm! Eny√® easy!

 

From the two verses above he confirms what is true but often inadmissible by many. There is no perfect man on earth, we are all ‚Äú striving‚Äù and ‚Äúlearning‚Äù to be! Each one is at one stage higher or lower than the other! This is a fact of life!

 

Ecclesiastes 7:20 
NIV
[20] Indeed, there is no one on earth who is righteous, no one who does what is right and never sins.

 

You‚Äôve heard it said, ‚ÄúWhatever you do people will talk about you !‚Äù Have you asked why? This happens because those who are at your level of maturity understand and appreciate you whereas those below will condemn and speak evil of you! It is as simple as this

 

It is so because their level of understanding, knowledge and experience is lower than yours. If they wear the shoes you wore, stand where you stood, hear what you heard, and see what you saw and know what you knew ; they‚Äôll appreciate and make informed comments.

 

But quite often this is not the case  It is for this reason that Solomon advised; 

Ecclesiastes 7:21 
NIV
[21] *Do not pay attention to every word people say*, or you may hear your servant cursing you---

 

It is not ‚Äúevery word, ‚Äú they say which is relevant some may others may not. Take the relevant and throw the irrelevant into the trash basket! In other words, do not take them to heart.

 

This calls for discernment, the ability to discern what is and what is not, and here lies the difficulty! 

To the immature and unwise everything said ( words) is relevant. So he ends up hearing his servant cursing him which makes him go mad!

 

If only we could apply the ‚ÄúSolomonic‚Äù formula and advice to tell the relevant from the irrelevant it would help us know who to listen to or not. It is not everything said by everybody that matters. 
Some things said by some matters.

 

If you want to know where this approach is more pronounced and applicable then it is the political arena. Whatever a ruling government says or does the opposition will say the contrary. Some of the ‚Äú contrary ‚Äú statements, suggestions etc will make sense others non-sense!

 

Beloved do not give ear to everything said about you, you know yourself better than they do. Listen to some, ignore others. Move on with your life, always remember people‚Äôs level of maturity informs what they see and what they say!

 

You owe no one an explanation except God! He will judge you according to what He knows about you He will not call any to tell Him anything about you.

 

2 Corinthians 5
KJV
10+ For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the things done in his body, according to that he hath done, whether it be good or bad.

 

Romans 14
KJV
10+ But why dost thou judge thy brother? or why dost thou set at nought thy brother? for we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.

 

My take.

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: Live, So As Not To Regret
text:
Live, So As Not To Regret
 

Matthew 8
KJV
12+ But the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

 

This is a very strange statement made by the Lord, which should serve as a warning to every believer. That the ‚Äú children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness‚Äù is an undeniable truth that should not be taken for granted.

 

We who believe and have been baptized into Christ are the children of the kingdom He is referring to;   there is no guarantee that we shall be spared if we live reckless unrepentant lives.

This truth runs through many verses just that many are not observant.

Read this, 


Mark 16
KJV
16+ He that believeth and is baptized *shall be saved*; but he that believeth not shall be damned.

 

‚ÄúShall be saved‚Äù is not the same as ‚Äúis saved ‚Äú. He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved is not the same as ‚Äú he that believeth and is baptized is saved‚Äù.

 

Paul also echoed the same when he said 
 

Romans 10
KJV
13+ For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.

The possibility of one losing his salvation is forcefully affirmed by Paul, 

 

Read it; 
 

1 Corinthians 10
KJV
12+ Wherefore let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he fall.

 

The Apostle John added to this when he said; 
 

2 John 1:8 
NIV
[8] Watch out that you do not lose what we have worked for, but that you may be rewarded fully.


So you see, live so as not to regret in the end, the expression ‚Äú weeping and gnashing Of teeth ‚Äú is summed up in one word; regret‚Äù.

 

Beloved, let us walk wisely paying attention and giving heed to the warnings, pieces of advice, guidances etc;  that are spoken or written which we hear or read daily.

 

Nothing is more painful than to be disappointed in Heaven, which is possible when your name is not found  in the Book of Life. Please note, not a local church attendance or membership register!

 

This document is not admissible in heaven; it is necessary and valuable here for local membership administrative purposes! When the last member dies, that register is closed and will be left here. You may have your name in it but not in that which is in Heaven Please note the difference.

 

 Read it ; 
 

Revelation 20:12, 15
NIV
And I saw the dead, great and small, standing before the throne, and books were opened. Another book was opened, which is the book of life. The dead were judged according to what they had done as recorded in the books.

[15] Anyone whose name was not found written in the Book of Life was thrown into the lake of fire

.

Maranatha!

 

John Franklin Tamakloe.

title: Honour: What Does It Mean?
text:
Honour: What Does It Mean?

Proverbs 30

KJV

17 The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.

 

Proverbs 23

KJV

22+ Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

 

Every man or woman has two indispensable personalities: a father and a mother, persons he/she can not ignore or despise. 

 

Why is this so? It is so because his/her life depends on how he/she treats them. Divine ordinances support this statement as stated below ; 

 

Exodus 20

KJV

12+ Honour thy father and thy mother: that thy days may be long upon the land which the Lord thy God giveth thee.

 

Ephesians 6

KJV

Ephesians 6

KJV

1+ Children, obey your parents in the Lord: for this is right.

 

2+ Honour thy father and mother; (which is the first commandment with promise;)

 

3 That it may be well with thee, and thou mayest live long on the earth.

 

The operative word is ‚Äú honour‚Äù, what does it mean ‚Äú to honour?‚Äù  Why is this important? 

 

To honour is simply to acknowledge, respect and submit to someone regardless of social, economic, etc status. 

 

What most don‚Äôt know is that the above-mentioned (acknowledgement, respect, submission) are the prerequisites for establishing and maintaining a good relationship!. 

 

If we acknowledge, respect and submit to each other we shall have good relationships among and between us; which will result in peace, happiness and goodwill! We shall always be at peace with ourselves. 

 

If in doubt, take time to observe the type of relationship or bond  between any two persons you know, ie wife /husband; friends, colleagues at work, school etc 

 

If it is strong it is characterised by these three; if it is weak it is because either one or two of these ( or all ) are missing 

 

A relationship or bond is stronger where these are practised, acknowledgement, respect and submission to one another. 

 

So, this is what it means to honour! To have and to maintain a good relationship with anyone ( father, mother, friend etc) we must acknowledge, respect and submit to one another. 

 

This is why Paul admonished believers to submit to each other 

 

Ephesians 5

KJV

21+ Submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.

 

Philippians 2

KJV

3+ Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.

(Acknowledgement, respect, submission is implied!) 

 

Where these three are missing here is what it leads to ;

Galatians 5

KJV

26+ Let us not be desirous of vain glory, provoking one another, envying one another.

 

A word to the wise. 

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: My Visit To The Cemetery: Matters Arising!
text:
The Certainty Of God‚Äôs Word: My Visit To The Cemetery

Genesis 3

KJV

19+ In the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread, till thou return unto the ground; for out of it wast thou taken: for dust thou art, and unto dust shalt thou return.

 

Recently I visited a cemetery and after performing the burial activity, I waited for a while to take a closer look at the individual graves scattered about. Of interest to me are the dates written on them. A few graves caught my attention these were graves with old dates. 

 

The dates written on these tombs indicate that those buried underneath the slabs have been there for over a hundred years! Amazing sight to see. 

 

I stood still and asked what the conditions of the bodies buried under the concrete slabs were. It is likely their flesh is turned to earth and so also may their bones be. 

 

While I walked away the truth that hit me hard in the face is what God said ‚Äú‚Äù For dust thou art, and unto dust shalt thou return.‚Äù We came from the earth and shall return to it. 

 

Beloved, everything came from the earth and shall return to the same ! You name it, whatever we have was taken from the earth ! As an example , the Food we eat was from the earth after we eat and ease ourselves they go back to the earth.

 

Precious items such as necklaces, earrings, clothing, automobiles etc are all products from materials buried in the earth. We dug them up in their natural forms, refined them and turned them into what we need. They shall all return to the earth with time!

 

 All these confirm what Paul said;  

1 Timothy 6

KJV

7+ For we brought nothing into this world, and it is certain we can carry nothing out.

 

Nothing we have belongs to us, they belong to the earth, and the earth belongs to God. So everything shall return to the earth and through that to God who created it. This is what is meant when we say God owns everything. 

 

We are therefore ‚Äútenants‚Äù of the earth, everything is on rent. When our tenancy expires so goes everything!  

 

Here is what my visit to the cemetery reminded me of, which I share with you! Dust I am and unto dust I shall return. Everything I have shall return to the earth; and so will yours be.  The next time you visit a cemetery take time to walk around and read the dates on tombs. 

 

So let us be wise regarding how we use whatever we  have, knowing that one day we shall give them back to the Owner. Enjoy them though.

 

Y√® b√® w√ª enti y√®≈Ñ ‚Äî-? Hmmmm ey√® asemoo! 

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: A Tragedy: An Evil Under The Sun
text:
A Tragedy: An Evil Under The Sun.

Job 19:14-16

NIV

[14] My relatives have gone away; my closest friends have forgotten me. [15] My guests and my female servants count me a foreigner; they look on me as on a stranger.

 

[16] I summon my servant, but he does not answer, though I beg him with my own mouth.

 

A sorrowful incident was screened on a social media handle that I watched which resonated with the above words! It has to do with neglect. 

 

A man who once commanded admiration and respect in his youthful and adult working life was reduced to a nobody in his old age. In his heyday, he had many who waited on him. His office and home were like a beehive! 

 

Suddenly things changed when he left office and went into retirement, All his friends deserted him, even his family especially those he cared for were nowhere near him. 

 

His calls and cries were not heard by any of them. He was left to struggle on his own It was these that brought to my mind these scriptures; 

Job 19:14 

NIV

[14] My relatives have gone away; my closest friends have forgotten me.

 

Even his servants who waited on him when he was active looked at him like a stranger. They hear his call but will attend to him as and when they feel like. He is no longer of use to them. Yes! 

 

Job 19:15 

NIV

[15] My guests and my female servants count me a foreigner; they look on me as on a stranger.

 

This is a sad reflection of who we are and how we treat people we once adored but when they age they become despicable to us. No wonder the proverb writer said;

Proverbs 19:6 

NIV

[6] Many curry favor with a ruler, and everyone is the friend of one who gives gifts.

 

Ours is a society/culture of ‚Äú use and dump ‚Äú. You are of benefit to us so long as we can get something from you. 

 

Yes, even today that is called ‚Äú Father‚Äôs Day‚Äù How many of the men who have helped you have you said a word of appreciation to? 

 

How much will it cost you to text a simple well-wishing message? Nothing. But you‚Äôve not done it because they no longer feature in your mind! 

 

Years ago when they were of benefit to you, you were the first to send them messages! Not today. Yes, you ‚Äúused and dumped them‚Äù. They once brought joy and happiness to your life. What a tragedy. 

 

Read it again; 

Job 19

KJV

14 My kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have forgotten me.

15+ They that dwell in mine house, and my maids, count me for a stranger: I am an alien in their sight.

 

16 I called my servant, and he gave me no answer; I intreated him with my mouth.

 

A sad reflection of who and what we are to the aged. May God grant us the spirit of discernment to know those who are ‚Äúfair-weather friends‚Äù whose reason and purpose for being around us is to ‚Äúuse and dump‚Äù us. 

 

My lamentations! 

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: Trust As An Investment
text:
Trust As An Investment

Psalms 5

KJV

11+ But let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them ever shout for joy, because thou defendest them: let them also that love thy name be joyful in thee.

 

Trust is an investment, therefore be careful whom you invest in. Be a wise investor! Many an investment has gone bad due to poor judgment 

 

Trust is a currency, it can appreciate or depreciate therefore value any trust people repose in you. Use it wisely 

 

Trust is a key to success and failure. Depending on its value at any given time, it can open or shut doors. 

 

Trust is an investment people make in you they will therefore expect a good return; so do not squander their trust. 

 

Once depreciated, trust is difficult to appreciate no matter how hard you try. Be diligent to maintain its value at an appreciable level at all times. 

 

Trust is not your personal property, it belongs to others. They can withdraw it, close their account with you without notice; so be careful and watchful.

 

Many have gone bankrupt as a result of squandering both the goodwill and trust invested in them. Let this not happen to you 

 

My few thoughts to share with you 

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: Try Again: Because You Said So!
text:
Try Again: Because You Said So!

Luke 5

KJV

5+ And Simon answering said unto him, Master, we have toiled all the night, and have taken nothing: nevertheless at thy word I will let down the net.

 

On reading this incident two important lessons stood out! 

 

Like many, I have faced challenges that nearly brought me down! I have encountered frustrations and disappointments in life ( and still do!); but the ‚Äòwhispers‚Äô of a few placed my feet firmly on the ground. 

 

My story, like yours, is not different from that of Peter, Can you imagine the frustrations and disappointments with which he uttered these words? 

Luke 5:5

NIV

[5] Simon answered, ‚ÄúMaster, we've worked hard all night and haven't caught anything. But because you say so, I will let down the nets.‚Äù

 

Experienced as he was in the art of fishing, he caught nothing! Experienced as we may be yet our endeavors/efforts show no sign of progress. But when someone whispered words of hope victory was ours to claim. 

 

Yes, beloved ‚Äúbecause you said so ‚Äú many a frustrated and a disappointed, can stand on their feet. 

 

Let me be personal here, when I first put pen to paper to write articles, I came under a barrage of ‚Äòattacks‚Äô from some who thought they were my target of writing! 

 

Such were the ‚Äòattacks‚Äô that I almost gave up! I announced that effect at a general meeting! As soon as I took my seat two men stood up to say how beneficial my articles are to them. 

 

It is to these two men that I owe my perseverance in writing over the years. We need friends who will speak to us Words of encouragement. Unfortunately, these are a few apart. On the contrary, it is the opposite that abounds! 

 

Jesus spoke encouraging words to Peter which resulted in success; read it 

Luke 5:6 

NIV

[6] When they had done so, they caught such a large number of fish that their nets began to break.

 

Many potential, gifted etc persons whose contributions be it secular or spiritual that can change the course of history and make life better for many are unable to step out because of the negative, discouraging voices that surround them. The impossibility thinkers! 

 

May we learn to speak words of encouragement to those who are undertaking tasks that will bring hope to us. 

 

The second important lesson Peter‚Äôs response and subsequent actions teach us is the need to be discerning and flexible. 

 

Peter knew who Jesus was so he was willing to act on his directive.  Some in his shoes would have turned down His directive. These will say ‚Äú We ( experts ) have toiled all night catching nothing; who are you and what do you know about fishing?‚Äù

 

Oh, we hear this said to many today. ‚ÄúWho are you to say this or that ??‚ÄùI like the word Peter used‚Äù Nevertheless‚Äù Yes, nevertheless, regardless of who or what ‚Äú I will give it a try‚Äù. 

 

Come to think of it, Jesus did not say anything Peter didn‚Äôt know. 

Read it ;

4 Now when he had left speaking, he said unto Simon, Launch out into the deep, and let down your nets for a draught.

 

The context seems to suggest that Peter and his crew had earlier gone on a fishing expedition which resulted in nothing. So they berthed their boats and washed their nets. 

 

Read it ;

Luke 5:2-3 

NIV

[2] He saw at the water's edge two boats, left there by the fishermen, who were washing their nets. 

 

[3] He got into one of the boats, the one belonging to Simon, and asked him to put out a little from shore. Then he sat down and taught the people from the boat.

 

The earlier expedition brought nothing but disappointment, this explains the reason Peter said what he said. He initially doubted, he is human just like us. 

 

But he quickly discerned and was flexible in thought and decision. Here is where he puts many of us to shame probably including you!  

 

Dear reader be discerning and flexible in life After all you lose nothing by giving a suggestion a trial!

 

Discernment and flexibility are signs of growth and maturity, whereas fanaticism is a sign of the opposite. 

 

Come to think of it Jesus did not say anything strange or new.  Peter knew and understood what he suggested. 

 

Read it ; 

Luke 5:4 

NIV

[4] When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, ‚ÄúPut out into deep water, and let down the nets for a catch.‚Äù

 

‚ÄúDeep Water Oooh‚Äù that was what he suggested to Peter. Something Peter knew from experience but probably overlooked. 

 

How many times have we not been reminded of something we knew but overlooked which is key to our succeeding in an undertaking? 

 

Is this not what is meant by ‚Äú Sankofa ?‚Äù  

 

These two lessons I learnt from reading this incident which I share with you I hope it helps! 

 

  1. If you have nothing positive to say keep quiet. 
  2. Be discerning and flexible in thought and decisions. You may have the monopoly over some form of knowledge ( speciality ) but certainly not over WISDOM! . 

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: I Want To Know What Love Is
text:
I Want To Know What Love Is

1 John 3

KJV

16+ Hereby perceive we the love of God, because he laid down his life for us: and we ought to lay down our lives for the brethren.

 

The Apostle John was an eyewitness to the life of Jesus; he observed Him from a close range. As such, his writings reflect the very detailed life that Jesus led. 

 

As is known he was the disciple who was described as the one ‚Äúwho leaned on his breast at supper‚Äù   Read it 

John 21

KJV

20+ Then Peter, turning about, seeth the disciple whom Jesus loved following; which also leaned on his breast at supper, and said, Lord, which is he that betrayeth thee?

 

As you recall it was only John who wrote what has become the profound test of knowing what love is. Please read it? 

John 15

KJV

13+ Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.

 

His epistles therefore are the account of his experiences and observations of the love that Jesus taught and practiced. It is these that informed our text for this write-up Regarding the title, listeners of music will know that it was the title of a popular hit many years ago. ( Foreigner -1984) 

 

Do you want to know what love is? Then here is how it is manifested by anyone who claims to love you. Is he/she willing to ‚Äúlay down his/her life ‚Äú for you? 

 

1 John 3:16 NIV

[16] This is how we know what love is: Jesus Christ laid down his life for us. And we ought to lay down our lives for our brothers and sisters.

 

To make sure his readers do not confuse what he means by ‚Äú laying down ‚Äú Of life, he added the following; 

1 John 3:17 

NIV

[17] If anyone has material possessions and sees a brother or sister in need but has no pity on them, how can the love of God be in that person?

 

The context therefore gives us the meaning of those words. There is no ambiguity about what John meant. No one can say he does not understand what he meant. When we give to someone what is of great value, to enhance his life or lift him from a low level we are ‚Äú laying down our life‚Äù for the recipient! 

 

There are too many fake, hypocritical and pretentious acts parading as love which must be exposed. These are mainly words coined to deceive and mislead the unsuspecting. Some mistook ‚Äú admiration ‚Äú for love. Which is not, unless backed with action; admiration is mere words! 

 

John cautioned against this; read it ; 

1 John 3:18-19 

NIV

[18] Dear children, let us not love with words or speech but with actions and in truth. [19] 

This is how we know that we belong to the truth and how we set our hearts at rest in his presence:

 

A genuine action, from a genuine heart, motivated and inspired by genuine 

concern and love for the recipient or beneficiary! This is what love is! 

 

On a practical note to illustrate, recently I was bereaved and many were those who sent their ‚Äú condolences ‚Äú my inbox was full! On the day of the funeral only a few of the many ‚Äú condolencers‚Äù showed up.  Their ‚Äú condolences ‚Äú were mere words because they failed to translate them into deeds. 

 

Do you remember what John said?

1 John 3:18 

NIV

Dear children, let us not love with words or speech but with actions and in truth.

 

Translate your ‚Äú condolences ‚Äú into deeds this is what it means to  ‚Äúlay down one‚Äôs life‚Äù! A condolence is a sympathy, deeds (actions) translate sympathy into empathy. Beloved, sympathy and empathy are not the same, Many sympathize, only a few empathize 

 

With this experience, I was approached a few days ago by a brother who want to publish my second bereavement which just occurred on a platform, unfortunately, I turned down the request. I told him my inbox will be full of ‚Äúcondolences ‚Äú which will result in no show on the day of burial. Yes, these  are hard and unpleasant truths known to all . Beloved, I want to know what love is! 

We have loved each other by words for far to long, that a mere expression of sympathetic words  ( a condolence ) is interpreted as love!  

 

A thought to share

title: The Valley Of Decision
text:
The Valley Of Decision 

Joel 3

KJV

14+ Multitudes, multitudes in the valley of decision: for the day of the Lord is near in the valley of decision.

 

The words of this scripture featured in one of the songs of the world-acclaimed ‚Äòsocial philosopher‚Äô Robert Nestor Marley. The Valley Of Decision! 

 

In every man‚Äôs life, there comes a moment that demands action‚Äîa decisive moment that, if left unattended, can lead to a lifelong disaster! 

 

In the Valley of Decision, we are confronted with questions that have to do with our destiny. Questions that have to do with our spiritual, economic, social etc destinies. 

 

The decisions and choices we make will shape our life‚Äôs destinies. What we are today reflects the choices we made in the past.. What we shall be tomorrow is based on what we do or don‚Äôt do today

 

Some choices are irreversible and so are some decisions. Ask any aged person and he /she will confirm this to you. This is because he/she has once walked through the Valley of Decision. 

 

Every step we take in every hour or day forms part of the building blocks we lay for our future. The entire structure of the building will be completed at our old age. It is for this reason that we must weigh carefully the choices we make. 

 

It must be admitted, many of us (including this writer ) have made some irreversible choices, the consequences of which are with us today. 

 

Human as we are we can not escape such mistakes. We just have to accept and live with them till we sleep one night and wake up no more! . Though a difficult and daunting task yet we have no choice but to face it squarely   To procrastinate is to postpone what will catch up with us later 

 

Walking through the Valley of Decision in life, beloved requires help. Hear how someone who once walked through this Valley concluded; 

 

Psalms 23

KJV

4+ Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.

 

Rod and staff here indicate, training, guidance and discipline. Read a few ;

 

Job 5

KJV

17+ Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth: therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty:

 

Proverbs 3

KJV

11+ My son, despise not the chastening of the Lord; neither be weary of his correction:

12+ For whom the Lord loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.

 

Hebrews 12

KJV

5+ And ye have forgotten the exhortation which speaketh unto you as unto children, My son, despise not thou the chastening of the Lord, nor faint when thou art rebuked of him:

6+ For whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth, and scourgeth every son whom he receiveth.

 

1 Corinthians 11

KJV

32+ But when we are judged, we are chastened of the Lord, that we should not be condemned with the world.

 

He acknowledged and attributed his successful walk through this Valley to God. ‚ÄúI will fear no evil, for thou art with me‚Äù he said. 

 

Beloved, it is only with the presence of God in our lives, and the help of the Holy Spirit that we can walk successfully through the Valley of Decision. 

 

The Holy Spirit will illuminate both the eye and the mind guiding and granting us the ability to discern so we make the right decisions and choices. He does these through the Word and promptings! A key feature in the believer‚Äôs daily walk with God which unfortunately the majority overlook! . 

 

The Valley of Decision is a valley that some have visited and climbed out of, Make every effort to walk through it successfully! 

 

If you ever find yourself in the Valley of Decision do not panic seek help when and where necessary.  

 

Thoughts to share

title: Self Restraint: An Essential Requirement
text:
Self Restraint: An Essential Requirement 

Proverbs 25

KJV

28+ He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls.

 

I  am not a chef, nor do I have any cooking experience, but anytime I taste a delicious meal I often ask to know the ‚Äúwhat‚Äù and ‚Äúhow‚Äù. The answer I usually get always points to the ‚Äúingredients ‚Äú used. 

 

I am told by the ‚Äúexperts‚Äù that for a meal to pass the test, it must have the right proportions of ingredients. 

 

I found this knowledge relevant and applicable to life. For any life to be called a good life it must have in proportion all virtues. Virtues such as honesty , trustworthiness , politeness , respectfulness etc. Most important of all is ‚Äúself-restraint‚Äù. 

 

As the above scriptures state, ‚Äúself-restraint‚Äù ‚Äú self rule ‚Äúand ‚Äúself-control‚Äù must be part of what it takes to be a good-natured man. 

 

To hold one‚Äôs spirit in check no matter what the situation may be, is more to be preferred than anything else. 

 

Read it again 

Proverbs 16

KJV

32+ He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.

 

It does not take much to take a city but it takes much to rule one‚Äôs spirit. To take a city is an external warfare but to rule one‚Äôs spirit is internal which is the toughest. This explains why not many can rule their spirits! 

 

To be unable to rule one‚Äôs spirit is simply to be lacking in character, unprincipled, because character is the anchor that holds a person in check amid human storms!

 

You may have been at some meetings where there were outbursts, tempers flaring and the atmosphere was thick and tense. This is because someone failed to ‚Äòrule his spirit‚Äô! 

 

To be around people who have mastered the art of self-restraint is a joy and a delight, Conversations and discussions are conducted in a low tone!  Anything said no matter how unpleasant does not provoke outbursts, silence is maintained! Each at the meeting has learned to swallow his pride! 

 

Take note, when two people standing close to each other speak (shout) to each other in a high tone then know that they are out of sync. They‚Äôve both failed to rule their spirits. 

 

So, how do we self-restrain (rule) our spirits? It begins with self-respect which is then extended to others. 

 

The next is acceptance; to accept that all men are not the same in terms of thought and practice; there will always be differences. Make room for divergent views and opinions, speak/express yours respectfully and politely. 

 

Not everyone knows what you know, In life some are above you, while others are below in many respects. So factor this into your dealings with people. Learn from the one above you, and teach the one below you. 

 

Learn to agree, and or disagree, know what is essential and what is not.  In essentials stand firm on nonessential give way to liberty! 

 

Walk away from anyone who is lacking in character and is unprincipled! Avoid the ‚Äúnoisy‚Äù, these are vexations to the spirit 

 

Always remember, in the midst of the unwise, it would be foolhardy to be wise. As a proverb says so ‚Äú save your breath to cool your porridge ‚Äú. 

 

Always remember this; 

Proverbs 9:8-9 

NIV

[8] Do not rebuke mockers or they will hate you; rebuke the wise and they will love you. [9] Instruct the wise and they will be wiser still; teach the righteous and they will add to their learning.

 

Above all, exercise maximum self-control by putting a heavy padlock on your lips among provocateurs. Be deliberate and conscious. 

 

Finally, be patient towards all; 

Ecclesiastes 7

KJV

8+ Better is the end of a thing than the beginning thereof: and the patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit.

9+ Be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry: for anger resteth in the bosom of fools.

 

Thoughts to share 

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: The Hidden Reward:A Testimony
text:
The Hidden Reward: A Testimony. 

Galatians 6

KJV

7+ Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.

 

Proverbs 21

KJV

21+ He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.

 

The two scriptures above are statements, confirmations, and recommendations; they are also universal spiritual and physical laws! 

 

Sowing and reaping is common knowledge to everyone hence no need to belabor it. What is often not highlighted is the fact that not every sowing is deliberate, some are done unknowingly 

 

This aspect of sowing was brought home to me when I received a blessing from someone who said he was a recipient/beneficiary of a ‚Äúseed‚Äù I sowed.  

 

This ‚Äústranger‚Äù tried to remind me of the ‚Äúwhen‚Äù, ‚Äúwhere‚Äù and ‚Äúhow‚Äù this ‚Äúseed‚Äù was sown but I could not remember! He confirmed that yes, I was not aware of what I was doing at the time! 

 

This brought to mind two other scriptures ;

Ecclesiastes 11

KJV

1+ Cast thy bread upon the waters: for thou shalt find it after many days.

 

The other, the parable of the Sower; 

Luke 8

KJV

5+ A sower went out to sow his seed: and as he sowed, some fell by the way side; and it was trodden down, and the fowls of the air devoured it.

 

Beloved there are many a seed we‚Äôve sown unintentionally the results of which we shall reap at the appropriate time. Be they good or bad!

 

While thinking through this encounter the following scripture also came to mind ; 

Galatians 6

KJV

9+ And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.

 

God loving /fearing people will give back to us what we give out consciously or otherwise! Some in pursuit of a cause they believed to be just not to seek recognition ended up being recognised. 

 

Take the case of the ongoing activities of the group known as the ‚ÄúBus Stop Boys‚Äù. Their pursuit of keeping drainages open and clean has won them national recognition 

 

This also confirms what the writer of the Proverbs letter said ; 

Proverbs 21

KJV

21+ He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.

 

That we get what we deserve as a result of what we do is a true observation in life.

 

Follow the path of evil and you‚Äôll get evil paid back to you. In the same way as following the path of righteousness, you‚Äôll get righteousness credited in return. 

 

The question then is which path are we walking, and where is it leading to? Pause for a moment to think over this. 

 

Here are a few ‚Äú follow afters‚Äù that are worth considering ;

Romans 14

KJV

19+ Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another.

 

Psalms 34

KJV

14+ Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.

 

Hebrews 12

KJV

14+ Follow peace with all men, and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord:

 

Whatever we sow, knowingly or unknowingly (good or bad) we shall receive payments. 

 

A testimony to share  

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: Yet A Little While
text:
Yet A Little While

Psalms 37

KJV

10+ For yet a little while, and the wicked shall not be: yea, thou shalt diligently consider his place, and it shall not be.

 

There is no permanency in life, everything is in transition This reminds me of inscriptions we read embossed on some trotro wooden vehicles that were the public means of transportation in Accra in the sixties and seventies

 

One such inscription reads ‚Äú Friends today, enemies tomorrow‚Äô‚Äù. As a primary school pupil, these writings served as reading exercises as we learn to read. There were many such inscriptions; as they were the fashion of the time, owners used their vehicles to express their thoughts, feelings and sentiments. 

 

But truly speaking nothing is permanent in life not even relationships. Some we forget as we move on in life and our associations change; others we break as goals, interests, values and aspirations change. The worst of which is when a friend becomes an enemy. 

 

It is important to note that what unites us as friends is our shared interests, goals, values, principles etc Whenever there is a shift or change in any of these we part company. This definition of friendship is what the prophet Amos gave 

Amos 3

KJV

3 Can two walk together, except they be agreed?

 

Though this can be heartbreaking and a source of worry, we take consolation in what Solomon once said regarding the non-permanency of everything. Hence to be forewarned is to be forearmed; read it ; 

 

Ecclesiastes 3:8 

NIV

[8] a time to love and a time to hate, a time for war and a time for peace.

 

All that is needed is for one to be prepared for any such situation, this way one can move on in life. Who you call a friend today can become your enemy tomorrow. Remain true and be committed to what is right! 

 

Yes, yet a little while it shall come to pass. A word to the wise is enough! 

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: Destination: Which Way Are You Heading?
text:
Destination: Which Way Are You Heading?

John 14:4-6 

NIV

[4] You know the way to the place where I am going.‚Äù 

 

[5] Thomas said to him, ‚ÄúLord, we don't know where you are going, so how can we know the way?‚Äù 

 

[6] Jesus answered, ‚ÄúI am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.

 

I remember when I first arrived in Headington, Oxford I stayed on campus for a few days without going to the city centre though I needed a few items for use The reason was simple, I didn‚Äôt know how to get around! I felt shy to ask for help. 

 

There was no Google Maps at the time. It had not yet been invented or created. 

 

After a day or two when life was getting rough due to my lacking these basic items, I decided to go out on my own. And guess what I got lost. I struggled to find my way back to campus. 

 

During the first weeks when lectures began, I made friends with some African students, fortunately, some lived in England so they knew their way around places. 

 

The first thing they suggested to me was to buy a guidebook. Interestingly there are guidebooks covering the entire country, mainly focused on streets. If you are in Oxford there is one solely for use there. 

 

Oh, they also made me know that I can approach any Policeman I meet and ask for directions. Something I did when I visited London! Though some helped, others confused me the more! 

 

Thankfully I bought a copy which settled my fear of getting lost in town! I bought those of other county‚Äôs I visited during my stay 

 

To know one‚Äôs destination especially how to get there is very important in life. 

 

The same applies to Christianity, Jesus once told his disciples ‚ÄúYou know the way to the place where I am going.‚Äù! He didn‚Äôt land when one ( Thomas) raised his hands to say Massa (sic) ‚Äú 

Lord, we don't know where you are going, so how can we know the way?‚Äù 

 

Did you notice? He said they don‚Äôt know the ‚Äú where ‚Äú and the ‚Äú how‚Äù. A destination is made up of two things the place and the how to get there. 

 

I guess you‚Äôve heard said ‚Äú if you don‚Äôt know where you are going any direction to take will lead you there ‚Äú 

 

It is one thing to know the place and another to know how to get there! We know a place by hearing others tell us of it. This is a theoretical approach, which creates in us a desire to visit the place. 

 

We know Heaven through the stories and descriptions the scriptures provide! Read the book of Revelation and some of the things Jesus said about the place in the Gospels. 

 

Critical to the issue is how to get there. Here is where mankind is divided. Though everyone would love to be there, sadly only a few will make it. Why? Because they are not paying attention to the map! 

 

It was to avoid this that Jesus explicitly said ‚ÄúI am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.‚Äù

 

I rest my case. Want to go to Heaven? Here is the answer to the question ‚ÄúHow do I get there ?‚Äù The Guide Book is the Scriptures, consult it regularly as you travel the way. 

 

There may be junctions or bypasses etc make sure you don‚Äôt miss them. Most importantly always keep your eyes on the road! 

 

A thought to share 

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: How Long?
text:
How Long Are We Going To Be Here? 

James 4

KJV

14+ Whereas ye know not what shall be on the morrow. For what is your life? It is even a vapour, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away.

 

How long are you going to be here is a question no one can answer! Many have tried but to no avail. Even medical practitioners have told some that they will leave within a few months but this has turned into years. 

 

The transient and impermanent nature of our stay is what James described as a ‚Äú vapour‚Äù A vapour is a mist, it rises and within seconds vanishes into thin air. Life if compared to a flower, it grows, blossoms, gives out fragrance and thereafter withers! Who knows at which stage of this plant you are at this moment in life?

 

Compared to the grass here is what Peter said about life; 

1 Peter 1

KJV

24+ For all flesh is as grass, and all the glory of man as the flower of grass. The grass withereth, and the flower thereof falleth away:

 

Our beauty, handsomeness, glory, fame, popularity etc will fade with time! 

 

When Isaiah was told ‚Äú Cry‚Äù and he asked what he was to say read what he was told; 

Isaiah 40

KJV

6+ The voice said, Cry. And he said, What shall I cry? All flesh is grass, and all the goodliness thereof is as the flower of the field:

7 The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: because the spirit of the Lord bloweth upon it: surely the people is grass.

 

The psalmist also added his voice; 

Psalms 103

KJV

15+ As for man, his days are as grass: as a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.

 

16+ For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; and the place thereof shall know it no more.

 

Scriptures record a conversation between Peter and Jesus. Peter tried to ask this very question though he didn‚Äôt put it directly; a careful reading of the conversation between him and Jesus indicates that was his intended question 

 

Read it; 

John 21:20-23 

NIV

[20] Peter turned and saw that the disciple whom Jesus loved was following them. (This was the one who had leaned back against Jesus at the supper and had said, ‚ÄúLord, who is going to betray you?‚Äù)

 

[21] When Peter saw him, he asked, ‚ÄúLord, what about him?‚Äù

[22] Jesus answered, ‚ÄúIf I want him to remain alive until I return, what is that to you? You must follow me.‚Äù

 

[23] Because of this, the rumor spread among the believers that this disciple would not die. But Jesus did not say that he would not die; he only said, ‚ÄúIf I want him to remain alive until I return, what is that to you?‚Äù

 

So, yes the duration of our stay here is unknown as is testified to by the variations in ages we see on the funeral posters/banners of those who have been recalled! The obituary notifications. 

 

This being the case beloved, let us make the most out of what time we are allotted! It is true none can initiate and complete whatever he/she desire; but initiate something anyway. 

 

It is true you can not please or make everybody happy, but let a few feel happy and enjoy their time with you! This is how they will remember you. 

 

Impact a life for good and not evil! Let whatever duration you stay/spend here be meaningful! For we are here today, gone tomorrow! Do not lose sight of this, factor it into everything you do. 

 

My thoughts to share 

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: A Confession Of Note
text:
A Confession Of Note: Identifying With The Psalmist 

Psalms 38

KJV

4+ For mine iniquities are gone over mine head: as an heavy burden they are too heavy for me. 5 My wounds stink and are corrupt because of my foolishness.

 

6 I am troubled; I am bowed down greatly; I go mourning all the day long. 11 My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my sore; and my kinsmen stand afar off.

 

12+ They also that seek after my life lay snares for me: and they that seek my hurt speak mischievous things, and imagine deceits all the day long.

 

The above are the outpourings of the psalmist, confessing his waywardness and the calamities that befell Him. 

 

The entire psalm must be read as to appreciate and feel the desperate nature of a burdened heart  Like the psalmist, we all must admit that the ills that befall us are basically due to our ‚Äú foolishness ‚Äú. Read what he said;

 

‚ÄúMy wounds stink and are corrupt because of my foolishness.‚Äù 

 

To be foolish is to be unwise, not taking heed or paying attention to details. To take/make decisions based on assumptions. Or to give credit to someone who does not deserve it; only to regret later. To abuse a privilege granted or an honour bestowed. 

 

Beloved this is what has plunged many of us into holes that are so deep that we can not come out without suffering bruises!. Yes, the price we pay for being unwise and undiscerning! 

 

Nothing hurts the most when those you thought would provide you with a cover stand aloof. Read the case of the psalmist ;

Psalm 38:11 

NIV

[11] My friends and companions avoid me because of my wounds; my neighbors stay far away.

 

As if this is all, others will put as it were ‚Äú salt into the wound ‚Äú. (sic) Read it; 

Psalm 38:12,19-20

NIV

[12] Those who want to kill me set their traps, those who would harm me talk of my ruin; all day long they scheme and lie. 

 

[19] Many have become my enemies without cause ; those who hate me without reason are numerous. 

[20] Those who repay my good with evil lodge accusations against me, though I seek only to do what is good.

 

Yes, ‚Äúthough I seek only to do what is good !‚Äù Can you identify with any of these? Yes, surely you can! Well, you are not alone The psalmist of old experienced what you are going through today. 

 

Take courage for these are temporal trials, soon it will be over. Remain steadfast by holding on and trusting in God. This was exactly what the psalmist did! 

Psalm 38:21-22

NIV

[21] Lord, do not forsake me; do not be far from me, my God. [22] Come quickly to help me, my Lord and my Savior.

 

Say to yourself ‚Äú whatever will be should be, may God‚Äôs will be done‚Äù  Like Jesus, pray ‚Äú

Matthew 26:42

NIV

[42] He went away a second time and prayed, ‚ÄúMy Father, if it is not possible for this cup to be taken away unless I drink it, may your will be done.‚Äù

 

Indeed, May His Will Be Done!. 

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: Keeping The Saved Safe
text:
Keeping The Saved Safe: Why I Write.

1 Peter 2

KJV

2+ As newborn babes, desire the sincere milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby:

 

There is diversity of service in the Ministry a fact often acknowledged but less understood! All these services are interlinked, with the end goal being the salvation of a soul.

 

Reread what the Holy Spirit said to the church through  the Apostle Paul ;

1 Corinthians 12:4-6 

NIV

[4] There are different kinds of gifts, but the same Spirit distributes them. [5] There are different kinds of service, but the same Lord. [6] There are different kinds of working, but in all of them and in everyone it is the same God at work.

 

As stated earlier the end goal of these services (gifts) is summed up by the Holy Spirit In these words ; 

1 Corinthians 12:7 

NIV

[7] Now to each one the manifestation of the Spirit is given for the common good.

 

Did you read ‚Äú the common good ‚Äú? They were meant to be used in a way that benefits everybody. 

 

Ephesians 4:12 

NIV

[12] to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

 

They were therefore not given to provoke envy, jealousy or rivalry in the church; but to help build the Body of Christ. 

 

Now to the point of this writeup, some have asked why I don‚Äôt devote the time and platform to teaching ‚Äú doctrine‚Äù? By which they mean subjects such as ‚Äú baptism, weekly observance of the Lord‚Äôs Supper, giving, a cappella (unaccompanied) singing etc! 

 

Good and relevant as these are, my target audience is not unbelievers but believers. My writings are meant to keep the saved safe. To mature them in the faith by living/leading lives that reflect their profession as believers.  

 

My writings are inspired by the following scriptures ; 

Matthew 28

KJV

20+ Teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you: 

 

1 Peter 2:2 NIV

[2] Like newborn babies, crave pure spiritual milk, so that by it you may grow up in your salvation,

 

Hebrews 6

KJV

1+ Therefore leaving the principles of the doctrine of Christ, let us go on unto perfection; 

 

These and several other scriptures suggest that the saved must be kept safe, they will not be kept safe by repeatedly teaching the very same subjects that they believed and were brought into Christ. Baptism by immersion. Weekly Lord‚Äôs Supper etc. 

 

There are the ‚Äúmilk,  ‚Äúbones, meat‚Äù subjects which suggest the need for a progressive growth and development of every believer.  

 

The continuous emphasis and teaching of these elementary subjects (post-baptism) have resulted in a lack of growth ( maturity ); evidence of which we encounter every day among us. 

 

The Hebrew writer encountered a similar situation hence he wrote; 

Hebrews 5

KJV

12+ For when for the time ye ought to be teachers, ye have need that one teach you again which be the first principles of the oracles of God; and are become such as have need of milk, and not of strong meat.

 

Is this not a true reflection of how many look? Read how he described some of us; 

13 For every one that useth milk is unskilful in the word of righteousness: for he is a babe.

 

Oh, what a sad description! Could this be you? Read how he concluded ; 

14 But strong meat belongeth to them that are of full age, even those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern both good and evil.

 

Grow your faith, that is what He means! 

 

So, my writings are meant to turn ‚Äúspiritual children‚Äù into ‚Äúspiritual adults‚Äù! It does not come to me as a surprise when some don‚Äôt read them because they are content with being ‚Äúspiritual infants‚Äù in Christ. A condition that manifests itself in how they behave and conduct themselves in the Assembly even though they have been in Christ for a long time!. 

 

If you are wondering or asking why I don‚Äôt write about baptism, the Lord‚Äôs Supper, etc it is because some are teaching them. These are foundational settings, after which I lay blocks of ‚ÄúChristian character‚Äù to complete the spiritual building! 

 

Those who teach such subjects and I are working together. We are both collaborating to build the church of God. Without them I can not lay the blocks of Christlike character which my writings are meant to be. 

 

This also explains why I am not into ‚Äú controversies ‚Äú but rather what will build a believer in word and deed. Lifestyle. I have defined my target audience, the post-baptized believer. 

 

I do not write to answer ‚Äú what must I do to be saved ?‚Äù I write to answer ‚ÄúWhat must I do to remain saved ?‚Äù  

 

My answer to any who wish to know why I write what I write! 

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: At The Pleasure Of God
text:
At The Pleasure Of God

Romans 14

KJV

8+ For whether we live, we live unto the Lord; and whether we die, we die unto the Lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we are the Lord's.

 

Having lived through different political administrative dispensations spanning seven decades one certain thing, among several others is the transitional nature of holding a political office. 

 

There is no permanency in political appointments. Every appointee holds his/her office at the pleasure of the president or the appointing authority. 

 

You may have heard it said, ‚Äú the president appoints and dis-appoints‚Äù. Indeed contrary to what some may think or believe. No condition is permanent, positions are not possessions! Everyone serves at the pleasure of somebody 

 

Beloved, the same applies to our walk and work with God, He alone ‚Äúappoints and dis-appoints‚Äù. We live and serve at His pleasure. He ‚Äú ordains and dis-ordains‚Äù! None can query or fight Him over his ‚Äúappointment and or dis-appointment ‚Äú

 

Read again what Paul said ;

Romans 14:8 

NIV

[8] If we live, we live for the Lord; and if we die, we die for the Lord. So, whether we live or die, we belong to the Lord.

 

We are His to use as He wishes, He made us to serve His purposes on Earth. So wherever you find yourself be it ‚Äúpleasant or unpleasant‚Äù understand that you are there or in that situation because He wants to use YOU!

 

Jesus once found himself in a ‚Äúworrying‚Äù situation, Read what he said; 

John 12:27 

NIV

[27] ‚ÄúNow my soul is troubled, and what shall I say? 'Father, save me from this hour'? No, it was for this very reason I came to this hour.

 

Did you read that ‚Äú it was for this very reason I came to this hour!‚Äù. Take note and be guided by this example! 

 

Events that occur in the lives of the children of God are meant to serve a divine purpose. The difficulty we have is recognizing and knowing in advance that it is God‚Äôs will. 

 

This may be difficult to accept by many but history and experience show how true this statement is. How many times, and at what point have you not quoted what Paul wrote regarding things that happen to us? 

Romans 8

KJV

28+ And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose.

 

‚ÄúAnd we know ‚Äú at what time did we know; is it not after we have complained? Yes. 

Beloved, whatever purpose(s) for which God called you will work well for you in the end.

 

If He takes you through ‚Äúfire/heat ‚ÄúHe will have His Hand on the thermostat, to regulate it. Is this not what He meant when He spoke through Isaiah;  Read it,

Isaiah 43

KJV

2+ When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee; and through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame kindle upon thee.

 

We are unable to accept these assurances and live with them because of two things, fear and anxiety. Admittedly we are human, none is exempt! (Not even this writer !) Ours is to wait patiently which again is a difficult thing to do! 

 

Patience is required! To walk and serve God beloved patience is required. If we do not have patience we can not serve or walk with Him This writer learnt this the hard way ( and continues to learn) and can testify that it is true. 

 

Be honest, have you not ever said in private ‚ÄúWhy is God slow in doing this or that for me?‚Äù  Yes! To be patient is to wait and waiting for the majority is a challenge! 

 

Finally, how do we learn patience? 

 

We do this by acknowledging that we are weak, do not know it all, can not do it on our own we need help, and this help will come from someone who will act when he has time for us.  

 

Whether that someone will attend to us immediately or later, we don‚Äôt know it all depends on their time and not ours. 

 

Through experience, we have all been treated like this before. I have asked for help from some who acted on my request at the time they wished, even as I write some have but even said a word! Nor did they show any sign of attending to a request for help! I can not force or compel them. Mine is to wait and this is patience, painful as it may be! 

 

Beloved, if we can wait patiently for humans to attend to our needs, then we can do the same with God. The difference is, though men may disappoint, He doesn‚Äôt!  

 

Let us learn to resign our wills to Him. Yes, whether we live or die, we are His. We live and serve at His pleasure! He alone ‚Äú appoints, and or dis-appoints‚Äù To Him we owe everything!.

Thoughts to share 

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: Partnering For Success
text:
Partnering For Success

Exodus 17

KJV

11+ And it came to pass, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed: and when he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.

 

It is undeniable that no one can single-handedly win any battle, a truth demonstrated by the record of how Israel won its battle against Amalek. 

 

Fierce was the battle, strong were the enemies that it became necessary that an unconventional tactic has to be deployed. A tactic that involved three Moses, Aaron and Hur. 

 

The initial arrangement was that Moses was to stand on top of a hill to be visible to the Israeli forces under the command of Joshua. He was to carry with him the rod of office 

 

Read it ;

Exodus 17:9 

NIV

[9] Moses said to Joshua, ‚ÄúChoose some of our men and go out to fight the Amalekites. Tomorrow I will stand on top of the hill with the staff of God in my hands.‚Äù

 

[10] So Joshua fought the Amalekites as Moses had ordered, and Moses, Aaron and Hur went to the top of the hill.

 

And so it was when Israel engaged the Amalekites, however, a strange phenomenon was observed as the battle went on; whenever Moses lowered his hands the Amalekites broke through the Israelite defence and killed many

 

Read it;

Exodus 17:11 

NIV

[11] As long as Moses held up his hands, the Israelites were winning, but whenever he lowered his hands, the Amalekites were winning.

 

Moses, human as he is got tired of standing and holding high his hands and so the two men Aaron and Hur came to his assistance by first finding him a huge stone on which he sat and then holding his hands high in place. 

 

Read it ;

Exodus 17:12

NIV

[12] When Moses' hands grew tired, they took a stone and put it under him and he sat on it. Aaron and Hur held their hands up---one on one side, one on the other---so that his hands remained steady till sunset.

 

Oh, what a lesson! Oh how we miss this to our loss 

 

No one has it all. No one knows it all. No one can do it all. Success is teamwork. Success comes through collaboration. Success comes when we unite our forces, talents etc each contributing their quota. 

 

Let us look at the role each played in winning the battle.  

 

First God, though not mentioned yet He featured prominently in the success of Israel 

 

It was He who ordained and empowered Moses. The rod/staff in Moses‚Äô Hand was the sign of God‚Äôs presence with him and His authority which he wielded. 

 

Second is Moses, as the leader he must be visible hence his position on top of the hill. For a team to be successful its leader must be visible at all times. A leader must inspire and encourage those he leads. This Moses did that day. He provided what is called today Inspirational leadership 

 

Then thirdly, Aaron and Hur, these were subordinates, it was they who mooted the idea to get Moses seated comfortably. And also supported him by holding his two arms high in place so Israel could see and advance in the battle. 

 

‚ÄúThey took a stone and put it under him and he sat on it. Aaron and Hur held his hands up---one on one side, one on the other---so that his hands remained steady till sunset.‚Äù

 

There was no rivalry. There was no undermining, Aaron and Hur knew where they belonged. Aaron was an orator as we know from the pre-exodus account. 

 

He was the spokesperson when they appeared before the pharaoh. But he never used this endowment to challenge or undermine the authority of Moses, instead, he collaborated with him. 

 

Hur, we know very little about him but from the accounts, he was one of the trusted aides to Moses At one point placed Israel under his care along with Aaron during his absence. Read it 

 

Exodus 24

KJV

14+ And he said unto the elders, Tarry ye here for us, until we come again unto you: and, behold, Aaron and Hur are with you: if any man have any matters to do, let him come unto them.

 

He was a confidant of Moses and played this subordinate role with distinction. Can you as a confidant and an aide be trusted as Hur was? 

 

To succeed in any endeavor there is a need for partnership. We must partner with one another to uplift the work of God. For this to become a reality we must recognize and know our place in the scheme of things. 

 

The spirit of rivalry, competition, etc must never be part of the project. Pride and bloated egos must be buried. 

 

Just like Israel, we shall win if those who lead us will cooperate, collaborate etc with each other. 

 

We must also accept that in every human assembly, there must be a leader of leaders. ‚ÄúPrimus inter pares‚Äù meaning ‚Äú first among equals ‚Äú   It is from this Latin word that we got the term ‚ÄúPrime Minister‚Äù   Failure to accept this arrangement is a recipe for failure 

 

Aaron and Hur recognized this which led to the success of Israel!  

 

A thought to share!  

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: Contradictions : How To Resolve Them
text:
Seemingly Biblical Contradictions: How To Resolve Them.  

Luke 23

KJV

46+ And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice, he said, Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit: and having said thus, he gave up the ghost.

 

Matthew 27

KJV

50+ Jesus, when he had cried again with a loud voice, yielded up the ghost.

 

John 19

KJV

30+ When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, It is finished: and he bowed his head, and gave up the ghost.

 

A few weeks ago my attention was drawn to a claim to the effect that the above-cited verses are contradictions! 

 

Some ‚Äúunfriendly‚Äù readers of the Gospels have drawn attention to the writings of Mathew, Luke and John to make the case that all three writers put out different accounts of the same event. 

 

According to them each of the three writers gave accounts which seem to be at variance and this has ‚Äú worried ‚Äú them! 

 

There is nothing wrong with what each wrote, to know exactly what was said by Jesus one has to piece together what the three wrote. 

 

Here we go. 

In Mathew‚Äôs account Jesus ‚Äú cried again with a loud voice, yielded up the ghost.‚Äù  He did not state what was said ( content) in that ‚Äúcry‚Äù 

 

To Mathew, Jesus cried, saying something which he did not state. 

 

In Luke, he cried with a loud voice, and said, ‚ÄúFather, into thy hands I commend my spirit‚Äù: and having said thus, he gave up the ghost.‚Äù 

 

Luke told us what was said in that ‚Äúcry‚Äù. 

 

Finally, John also recorded, when he ‚Äú had received the vinegar, he said, It is finished: and he bowed his head, and gave up the ghost.‚Äù

 

So John reveals another thing that was said by Jesus! 

 

Both Mathew and Luke wrote ‚Äú he cried ‚Äú. John wrote ‚Äú he said ‚Äú all of them admit that something was said. 

 

To know precisely what Jesus said we have to put all three accounts together; and this is how it reads ‚Äú It is finished: Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit‚Äù:

 

Remember, all agreed that He gave up the ghost, but before doing so He said something! 

 

The purpose of this write-up is to throw light on what some termed a contradiction and to show how such thoughts are resolved. 

 

Many see these ‚Äúmissing links‚Äù in the account of the three writers as contradictions, when in fact they are not. Scriptures can not contradict themselves it is the untrained reader who sees it like that. 

 

The example has always been given by referring to newspaper reporters A, B and C sent by different news organizations to cover an accident or an event. 

 

Each presented what he saw, and they will all report the same but they may differ in a few areas   This is because each reporter may have in addition to what he saw interviewed some bystanders! 

 

In a scenario like this, no one can fault any of the reporters because they published different stories of the same event. 

 

The similarities in their report show what was obvious to everyone. The dissimilarities are a result of the interviews they had with different bystanders. 

 

The rule is, to know what precisely took place one must put together the three reports published by the reporters. Similar to what you‚Äôve just fine with the three Gospels 

 

Dear reader anytime you come across what may look to you as a ‚Äú contradiction‚Äù here is what is recommended that you do. 

 

First, approach the issue with an open mind. Banish all biases, preconceived thoughts, conclusions or notions from your mind. 

 

Secondly, credit the Author of the Scriptures, in this case, God (Holy Spirit)! Who can not make a mistake   He is all-knowing

 

Thirdly, look for verses, passages etc that contain similar thoughts; assemble all just as we‚Äôve done above. Piece them together 

 

Lastly, seek help from historical documents that have something to do with the subject matter under discussion We call these ‚Äúextra-biblical ‚Äú materials. 

 

Here is how we resolve what may appear to readers as biblical contradictions when in fact they aren‚Äôt. 

 

I hope this helps in knowing how to handle the seemingly contradictory verses in the scriptures 

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

title: Becoming What We See
text:
Becoming What We See: A Christlike Template

2 Corinthians 3

KJV

18+ But we all, with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory, even as by the Spirit of the Lord.

 

Scripture confirms that we eventually become images of what we often see. Several examples abound in life as we see look-alikes. We also see these in professions, homes, and even in churches. 

 

We become who we follow, as we step in, and walk in their footsteps consciously or unconsciously. I remember receiving a WhatsApp message from a relative telling me about someone she met who speaks and acts like me, and wanted to know if the person has been associated with me.

 

The above scriptures make a similar case for believers as they behold the glory of God! As we read, hear, and meditate daily on the Word of God we experience transformations; we are changed to look like Him in character! We end up exhibiting godly character.

 

We become Christlike in word and deed as we stay closer to Him through His Word. His words influence our thoughts which translates into deeds. Remember, to walk with Jesus is simply to walk /live by what He taught. 

 

This is how observers will know if we are truly His followers. 


Beloved how close we are to the Word is seen through how we do things! How we love, how we live, what fellowship we enjoy, what causes we support, what truths we uphold, where our loyalty lies etc. 

 

A question that should engage our thoughts is, as men watch us what conclusions will they arrive at? Do we look like Him in love? Do we look like Him by how we relate to each other? Etc. 

 

It is these that should engage our attention the most, as we make our claim to the world that we are His followers. 

 

Yes, Paul was right when he wrote; 

2 Corinthians 3:18

NIV

[18] And we all, who with unveiled faces contemplate the Lord's glory, are being transformed into his image with ever-increasing glory, which comes from the Lord, who is the Spirit.

 

May our Christlike lives be a template for others to emulate. May the Holy Spirit empower us as we strive every day to look like Jesus!

title: The Purge
text:
The Purge That Awaits Us: A Reminder

Matthew 13

KJV

41 The Son of man shall send forth his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend, and them which do iniquity;

42+ And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

 

In a recent conversation with some friends, a casual mention was made of death and dying; quickly the speaker was ‚Äòcautioned‚Äô and made to stop alluding to such scenarios in conversations. 

 

When he asked to know why, he was told such topics ‚Äú spoil‚Äù conversations! In other words, there are some subject matters no one would like to hear mentioned or talked about in the open. 

 

One of those topics I later discovered is where we shall find ourselves as professing believers when we pass away. 

 

As is known and believed everybody wants to be in Heaven just for the fact that he/she is a member of the church. Which is true and desirable, however, what is not mentioned is the fact that before entering Heaven there will be a purge. 

 

It is this ‚Äú purging‚Äù that Jesus was referring to in the above passage. Read it again 

. ‚ÄúThe Son of man shall send forth his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend, and them which do iniquity;‚Äù 

 

Please note that the ‚Äú kingdom ‚Äú of Christ mentioned there is the Church of Christ! The church is Christ‚Äôs Kingdom! So there will be a purging which is to be carried out by His angels. 

 

All readers of the Bible know what Peter said concerning this very purging; 

Read it

1 Peter 4

KJV

17+ For the time is come that judgment must begin at the house of God: and if it first begin at us, what shall the end be of them that obey not the gospel of God?

18 And if the righteous scarcely be saved, where shall the ungodly and the sinner appear?

 

( Notice the three categories mentioned righteous, ungodly and sinner Everyone on earth belongs to one of these categories. Two can be found in the church, the righteous and ungodly.)  

 

A purge can be likened to a police swoop undertaken in a community to arrest weed (wee) smokers. In the process, everyone gets arrested whether guilty or not.

 

Thereafter screening is done and the users are identified and arrested while the innocent are set free. This is what is implied in the scriptures above. 

 

Comparisons exist from reading the OT. A similar purging was ordered by God. in the days of Ezekiel 

Read it ;

Ezekiel 9

KJV

4 And the Lord said unto him, Go through the midst of the city, through the midst of Jerusalem, and set a mark upon the foreheads of the men that sigh and that cry for all the abominations that be done in the midst thereof.

 

6+ Slay utterly old and young, both maids, and little children, and women: but come not near any man upon whom is the mark; and begin at my sanctuary. Then they began at the ancient men which were before the house.

 

Beloved it is not a matter of church attendance, donations, etc these are good; it is about godly living and exhibiting godly character! 

 

Of what use is it if I give to the poor, but am a liar, a wicked etc person, What is the difference between me and the unbeliever? The unbeliever also gives to the poor and tells lies and is wicked. 

 

There will be a purging so let us examine our lives and ways always lest we be taken out. Read the warning John gave us; 

2 John 1

KJV

8 Look to yourselves, that we lose not those things which we have wrought, but that we receive a full reward.

 

2 John 1:8 

NIV

[8] Watch out that you do not lose what we have worked for, but that you may be rewarded fully.

 

May the Lord bless us with an understanding heart and mind.
