title: Was Jesus A Celebrity?
text:
Was Jesus A Celebrity?

Isaiah 53

KJV

2+ For he shall grow up before him as a tender plant, and as a root out of a dry ground: he hath no form nor comeliness; and when we shall see him, there is no beauty that we should desire him.

 

This is the second time I am addressing this very subject. Followers of my write-ups will recall I‚Äôve discussed this subject before, many years ago! I am back again because many have asked to know if Jesus was a type, a celebrity etc! 

 

In an age and time when men of God desire to be known, treated and revered as ‚Äú celebrities‚Äù the same can not be said of the Man whose servants they proclaim to be. 

 

Indeed, Jesus did not leave us with a photograph or portrait but the descriptions the Holy Spirit gave us are enough to help us know what He looked like. One such passage that describes Him is what you‚Äôve read above. 

 

Read it again ;

Isaiah 53:2 

NIV

[2] He grew up before him like a tender shoot, and like a root out of dry ground. He had no beauty or majesty to attract us to him, nothing in his appearance that we should desire him.

 

In case you are having difficulty identifying his description here is it, 

‚ÄúHe had no beauty or majesty to attract us to him, nothing in his appearance that we should desire him.‚Äù 

 

That he wasn‚Äôt a handsome man wielding any majestic influence etc is highlighted by the above scriptures! He borrowed a donkey to ride into Jerusalem, today we ask for a 4x4; or an aircraft to fly us 

 

He had no wardrobe, we have innumerable, assorted specially made attire to fit etc 

 

He walked without bodyguards, today we are surrounded by bodyguards! A public display to enhance our superiority. He sat on a donkey with no one holding its rein, today we are chauffeur-driven, on some occasions with police escorts 

 

Even when we arrive at venues we wait for some time before stepping out, and we have the doors open for us by bodyguards. Yes. Red carpets are strewn in our paths for us to walk on! 

 

He sat and ate with the ordinary a practice we see as unfit and belittling; an anathema! He fraternize, socialized with the lowly an act we abhor. He avoided the limelight we invite and adore it. The tv cameras must be on us!

 

Jesus was not a celebrity, He lived a simple lifestyle! I can hear some say, yes that‚Äôs true but times have changed! This is not true, he lived in a sophisticated and advanced culture and civilisation but none of these influenced him! 

 

Today‚Äôs men of God must return to the basics. Peter said he left us examples to follow not only the spiritual but also the social. 

 

1 Peter 2

KJV

21+ For even hereunto were ye called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that ye should follow his steps:

 

A thought to share

title: What Is A Day?
text:
The Mystery Of A Day

Matthew 6

KJV

34+ Take therefore no thought for the morrow: for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.

 

I woke up to this verse firmly rooted in my mind, and I then paused to reflect and think of its meaning and implications. Here is what I came up with, which I share with you! What Is A Day? 

 

A day is like a journey that begins from the very hour we wake. The moment your eyes open is as if you‚Äôve landed at an airport and the plane has taxied to a stop. 

 

Coming out of the bedroom is like walking through the arrival immigration checkpoint and your praying and composing yourself before you leave the bedroom is like collecting your luggage from the roller. 

 

The first person(s) you meet and greet are your arrival team waiting to receive and welcome you. Do you notice how every first morning greeting is said with a broad smile? Yes indicating joy and happiness for seeing each other. Just as happens at every reception point. 

 

The newness and mystery of each day is like entering a town for the first time not knowing what goes on unless you get there. Everything you see or hear is new! 

 

Every day we see, we hear and we say new things. Every day‚Äôs experience is new! 

 

A day is full of mysteries as nobody knows what it holds in store for them! Some miscalculations, misjudgments will be made because everything is new, you are encountering them for the first time. 

 

People you‚Äôll meet will tell you things you‚Äôve not heard before. They‚Äôll ask questions you‚Äôve not thought about; all combined will put stress on your mind as you listen trying to make sense of whatever you hear! The questions will task your mind to think. 

 

Every encounter, every experience is new! Even if you think it is a routine it is always new because there is always an addition to what existed yesterday 

 

A day is indeed a journey, you have never walked through it before. It is for this reason that you must begin each day well prepared spiritually, mentally and emotionally. For you don‚Äôt know the challenges, trials, temptations etc. that may come your way. 

 

Focus therefore on the day in hand and not that of tomorrow, take each day ( journey) seriously. I am persuaded to believe that this is what Jesus meant. 

 

Matthew 6:34 

NIV

[34] Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.

 

Therefore enjoy today‚Äôs ‚Äú journey ‚Äú as I write this it‚Äôs seven (7) am, my plane just landed and I am getting ready to step out of it. I am yet to meet a welcoming party to say good morning! 

 

Enjoy the beauty of the day, have fun do not over stress yourself. Admire everything! It is a journey enjoy the trip, soon departure time ( night) will come and announcements will be made asking you to board your flight back to bed!

title: Adversity Seen Through A Positive Eye
text:
Adversity Seen Through A Positive Eye

Psalms 23

KJV

4+ Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.

 

Bold and a courageous affirmation you‚Äôve just read from a man who  turned adversity into an advantage, impossible to possible, tears to joy, poverty to riches, dishonor to honor, grass to grace, Yes this is David, reflecting on his experiences 

 

Unlike many, David saw the positive side of every adversity that befell Him. To him, anything that happened has a positive value or lessons to teach him. This is what he meant when he said 

‚ÄúThy rod and thy staff they comfort me.‚Äù  

 

Beloved, the rod and staff describe the two ends of the same stick a shepherd carries. 

 

The two ends of the shepherd‚Äôs ‚Äú stick ‚Äú are not the same both in shape and usage. One end is straight the other curved. One end is used to guide ( the straight end)  the other ( the curved) is used to punish. There are times when both ends are used simultaneously to punish. 

 

Adversity, tragedy, mishap, misfortune etc contrary to what the majority thinks, are God‚Äôs ways to redirect us. David knew this from experience hence what he wrote. 

 

Beloved many of us will say the same regarding things that have happened to us, by which means we are who and what we are today. I discovered my gift of writing when I left the pulpit. Instead of lamenting the Holy Spirit directed me to the pen! 

 

Words either spoken or written are weapons that no one can stop! The pen is mightier than the sword. Through writing, I have probably preached almost half of the sermons I‚Äôve preached orally though the audience may be small I‚Äôve reached many than I would have if I were glued to one place. 

 

What about people with physical disabilities? Take a look at the great things most of them have done. Yes, physical disability is not mental or intellectual disability! It is God‚Äôs way of directing their destinies. 

 

Yes, God uses adversities to redirect our destinies. This is the beauty of adversity and this is how it should be seen. Ever heard the saying ‚Äú when sea dry we go by land ?‚Äù Adversities should not stop us, they are meant to redirect, refocus, and reset so we can climb up to higher grounds in life. 

 

Is this not what James meant when He said; 

James 1

KJV

2+ My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations; 3+ Knowing this, that the trying of your faith worketh patience.

 

4+ But let patience have her perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing.

 

This situation is truly difficult to understand if one is not wise and this is why James added the following verse; read it 

 

5 If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.

 

So now, you see why James mentioned wisdom? Pay attention to the context. It is a prescription To see and turn adversity into an advantage you‚Äôll need wisdom! Which is true and it is only the wise who see adversity as an opportunity! 

 

All that I‚Äôve said so far is not to downplay the negative effects and or the consequences of adversities. No on the contrary I acknowledge that they can and are very devastating.

 

Yet, they are the Divine means by which our destinies are redirected. So wake up, wipe the tears, stop complaining, look beyond them, see (visualise) the glory and the goodness that lies ahead. 

 

With God all things are possible and with Christ, you are more than a conqueror! This is how many have turned adversities into advantages! You can also do the same. 

 

‚ÄúAdversities Re-position Us‚Äù

 

My thoughts to share

title: Treasure What You‚Äôve Found!
text:
Treasure What You‚Äôve Found!  

Matthew 13

KJV

45 Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls:

46+ Who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had, and bought it.

 

In a society where the majority settles for anything this merchant is presented to us as a man of different character. 

Instead of settling for anything, he chose to first investigate before making a move. 

 

In the context as we read, the statement is about the ‚Äúkingdom of heaven‚Äù, which ‚Äúkingdom‚Äù is represented on earth by the church of Christ! 

 

The lesson is don‚Äôt settle for anything ( church) until you‚Äôve investigated its quality, and by extension take time to study before you join any religious group. 

 

Apply the same spirit of curiosity to almost everything. Is it business, friendship, social club, marriage etc; take time to examine everything! Many have joined groups, churches, social clubs, marriages etc only to regret. Yes! 

 

In the case of the church, many had to move from one church group to another before finally settling down with the church that is mentioned and described in the New Testament! Like the merchant, they were equally looking for a pearl of great value in terms of biblical truth/teaching and practice. 

 

The second lesson from the action of this merchant is that he ‚Äúgave up to give in ‚Äùwhen he found the best. One word describes what he did: commitment.

 

He was influenced by the phrase I‚Äôve often used, ‚Äú Decision determines destiny ‚Äú. It was a critical step, choice and decision he made. 

 

Lack of commitment has been identified as a major factor in the failure of many an enterprise be it religious, social or economic! Commitment is the ingredient that brings to life dreams and aspirations! 

 

You‚Äôve heard the saying ‚Äú if wishes were horses, beggars would ride to hell‚Äù ! Yes, it is our commitment that translates dreams into reality, or else they remain wishes.  

 

Beloved, there are many on the periphery of life, many with their heads full of dreams and wishes, but what they lack is the initial spark and commitment to turn that spark into a flame! 

 

If you‚Äôve given up all you had to get whatever you now have, then be committed to it else your loss will be devastating! Give heed to the Apostle John‚Äôs exhortation ; 

2 John 1

KJV

8 Look to yourselves, that we lose not those things which we have wrought, but that we receive a full reward.

 

On a lighter note, we were blessed and privileged to locate this Merchant and asked him how he felt after giving up all to get what he got; he asked instead to sing a song as his answer! And here is what he sang, 

 

I have decided to follow

Jesus, no turning back, 

No turning back!

 

The Cross before me

The world behind me 

No turning back 

No turning 

 

Though none will

Go with me,

Still, I will follow 

No turning back ‚Äú

 

We walked away believing that we had met a mentor, a great example of what it means ‚Äú decision determining a destiny.!‚Äù

 

My take.

title: Attention: Do Not Ignore This!
text:
Attention: Do Not Ignore This! 

Acts 9

KJV

23 And after that many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel to kill him:

24+ But their laying await was known of Saul. And they watched the gates day and night to kill him.

25+ Then the disciples took him by night, and let him down by the wall in a basket.

 

I wish I were a painter, this is one picture I‚Äôll paint and hang on my wall to remind me of the need to be cautious. Can you imagine this happening to the great Apostle Paul? 

 

Someone who stood before Felix and Agrippa, and several others spoke powerfully without fear or intimidation. Yes!  Yet here is he being put in a large-sized laundry basket! Carried, towed or dragged on the floor pushed through an opening in a wall. 

 

Not only this, there was another threat to his life which was revealed to him by his nephew! As a result, the authority took measures to protect him. 

Read it ; 

 

Acts 23

KJV

16+ And when Paul's sister's son heard of their lying in wait, he went and entered into the castle, and told Paul.

17 Then Paul called one of the centurions unto him, and said, Bring this young man unto the chief captain: for he hath a certain thing to tell him.

 

Why didn‚Äôt he say to his nephew ‚Äú Oh God will take care of me so don‚Äôt worry ?‚Äù

 

Yes, there comes a time and moment when even the strong yield to weakness. Surely Paul was not the first nor the last, visit Elijah and interview him you‚Äôll hear the same story. Read his account ; 

 

1 Kings 19

KJV

2 Then Jezebel sent a messenger unto Elijah, saying, So let the gods do to me, and more also, if I make not thy life as the life of one of them by to morrow about this time.

3+ And when he saw that, he arose, and went for his life, and came to Beer‚Äìsheba, which belongeth to Judah, and left his servant there.

 

4+ But he himself went a day's journey into the wilderness, and came and sat down under a juniper tree: and he requested for himself that he might die; and said, It is enough; now, O Lord, take away my life; for I am not better than my fathers.

 

This was shortly after the local newspapers and social media have published the events that took place on Mount Carmel. Everyone was expecting to see the hero of the day, so the streets were lined up expecting Elijah. Only to be told he has fled! 

Beloved, even the strongest of the strong is also human, the blood that flows through our veins is the same that flows through his. 

 

Both Elijah and Paul took measures to protect themselves. Even Jesus did the same as recorded read it ; 

 

John 7

KJV

1+ After these things Jesus walked in Galilee: for he would not walk in Jewry, because the Jews sought to kill him.

 

It would be foolhardy if the three mentioned ignored the threats to their lives. Even so, it would be foolhardy today if any should ignore threats to their life all in the name of ‚Äú God will protect me‚Äù. Is God unable to protect Paul, He can but Paul agreed to the advice and suggestion to be put in a basket! 

 

There are always physical,  spiritual ( or both) threats to our lives, from both known and unknown sources, ignore these at the peril of your life. Even friends we eat and socialize with can become security threats. 

.

Did the Lord not acknowledge this? He did hear him; 

Matthew 10

KJV

36+ And a man's foes shall be they of his own household.

 

And also the psalmist, read what he wrote from experience, 

Psalm 55:12-14 

NIV

[12] If an enemy were insulting me, I could endure it; if a foe were rising against me, I could hide. 

 

[13] But it is you, a man like myself, my companion, my close friend, [14] with whom I once enjoyed sweet fellowship at the house of God, as we walked about among the worshipers.

 

Beloved, threats ( physical or spiritual) to our lives are real do not underestimate or downplay any. Paul took his seriously, Jesus did the same and so was Elijah. It would be foolhardy to ignore. 

 

Watch and pray He said. He did not say we close our eyes and pray. It is like saying to us; listen around, pay attention to developments around you. Watch the movements around you. Discern actions even words that are spoken reveal threats so think through whatever you hear. 

 

Every man of value and importance to God /society /family/workplace etc is a target if you are one of these then do not let your guard down! Watch and pray listen to and take advice

 

Paul did and was delivered learn to do the same. You are of value and importance to us. 

 

A thought to share; a word to the wise!

title: What And Why Do We Forget?
text:
What And Why Do We Easily Forget?

 

James 1

KJV

25+ But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty, and continueth therein, he being not a forgetful hearer, but a doer of the work, this man shall be blessed in his deed.

 

Like many of you, I have often struggled to remember important calendar dates, such as birthdays and anniversaries. The reason(s) for these form the basis of this article. 

 

Many have accused me of forgetting their birthdays, marriage anniversaries, outdooring, and other such ceremonies and they are right in doing so. I‚Äôve always pleaded guilty and offered sincere apologies. 

 

But why is it so, is a question I set out to find out and here is what I discovered!

 

Anything that does not occur daily, any item that I don‚Äôt use daily, falls under this category. Birthdays don‚Äôt occur every day, marriage anniversaries do not occur every day so the possibility of me forgetting them is high. You can make a list of things that do not occur daily in your life. 

 

Now, there are two most important things that can be so embarrassing in life if forgotten! You may ask what these are? I‚Äôd love to leave it to you to find out but for the sake of time, I‚Äôd like to help! 

 

These are passwords and scriptures! These two if not used regularly can be forgotten with dire consequences! 

 

Imagine standing in front of an ATM Machine on a cashless day trying to withdraw money for the weekend. 

 

Imagine trying to open your laptop or tablet and being requested to input your password because it has been a long time since you used it. 

 

What about the scriptures?

Imagine being confronted with a spiritual challenge, and you open the Bible to read a verse that will comfort and help you pray, only to discover you‚Äôve forgotten the book, chapter and verse where to find the verse. 

 

Imagine being engaged with someone in a discussion in which you have proven publicly that the other party is in the wrong, and he demands to know the passage of scripture that forms the basis of your conclusions. You took the Bible flipped through but could not locate the verse. 

 

Dearly beloved, like passwords, the bible if not regularly studied or read the tendency to forget its contents are very high. So to avoid this use your passwords regularly and read the Bible daily

 

The majority have put their passwords as it were on ‚Äúautopilot‚Äù, once signed in they never revisit it again. These do argue ‚Äú oh I don‚Äôt have time to be retyping ‚Äú   It is when the equipment crashes or gets corrupted that is when they see the importance of typing in the password regularly. 

 

In the way many have put their lives ( mind, brains!) on ‚Äú autopilot ‚Äú they are not learning anything new. They are content and satisfied with what they knew several years ago! It is these who resist change everywhere hence the lack of development and growth wherever they find themselves. 

 

If you care to know ‚Äú autopilot‚Äù is a lazy way of living, a lazy way to lead people or institutions as it lacks growth and dynamism. 

 

To avoid forgetting things in life, adopt a sign-in-each-day approach, the constant and regular use of anything helps retain knowledge and wisdom. 

 

Let me conclude with these wise words of comparison by the Hebrew writer 

 

Hebrews 5:12,14 

NIV

[12] In fact, though by this time you ought to be teachers, you need someone to teach you the elementary truths of God's word all over again. You need milk, not solid food! [14] But solid food is for the mature, who by constant use have trained themselves to distinguish good from evil.

 

The operative words are ‚Äú constant use‚Äù. Use your passwords regularly just as you'll read the bible. 

 

My take.

title: A Case For Mutual Dependence
text:
A Case For Mutuality And Interdependency 

 

2 Corinthians 8

KJV

14+ But by an equality, that now at this time your abundance may be a supply for their want, that their abundance also may be a supply for your want: that there may be equality:

 

2 Corinthians 8:14 

NIV

[14] At the present time your plenty will supply what they need, so that in turn their plenty will supply what you need. The goal is equality,

 

Paul on his fundraising campaign for the brethren in Judaea made this his central theme, the interdependency of the church.  He told the brethren at Corinth a well-endowed city of the need to assist the needy brethren in Judaea. 

 

His argument is simple, no condition is permanent; today it is them (sic) tomorrow it will be you. The unfortunate truth is this exhortation has been forgotten, and has been replaced by the majority with selfishness! 

 

Instead of cooperating with each we are rather in competition with one another. Instead of sharing we are hoarding our blessings. Each wants to outshine the other. 

 

The proverbial ‚Äúscratch my back so I scratch your back‚Äù though this has been used in the negative and derogatory sense; is what Paul‚Äôs appeal seems to suggest. Scratch my back today so I scratch yours tomorrow! 

 

Though we see around us the truth of this statement yet we are unable to embrace and apply it. 

 

Mutual dependence is a natural law, every creation of God depends on each other to survive. Plants, animals and humans depend on nature‚Äôs provisions. Each provides support to the other.  

 

That we need each other to survive is an undeniable truth. To avoid loneliness we make friends to provide us with fellowship! To help us improve our lives we engage the services of teachers or mentors. 

 

‚ÄúNo man is an island‚Äù is a poem written by John Donne, in which he stressed the interconnectivity of humanity. Read the entire poem to feel the import. 

 

No man is an island,

Entire of itself;

Every man is a piece of the continent,

A part of the main.

 

If a clod be washed away by the sea,

Europe is the less,

As well as if a promontory were:

As well as if a manor of thy friend's

Or of thine own were.

 

Any man's death diminishes me,

Because I am involved in mankind.

And therefore never send to know for whom the bell tolls;

It tolls for thee.

 

He is saying to us, no congregation of the Lord‚Äôs church is an island it is interconnected, interlinked etc with the rest; its action or inactions therefore impacts positively or negatively on the others. 

 

May we revise our notes on congregational mutuality so that we extend help to each other. Today may be a good time for you, but please time and circumstances change. 

 

Share today with others what you have so when your downturn comes they‚Äôll extend a hand of help to you! This is a law of nature 

 

A thought to share

title: A Hidden Wisdom:I Wish I Knew
text:
A Hidden Wisdom: I Wish I Knew 

 

Proverbs 13

KJV

12+ Hope deferred maketh the heart sick: but when the desire cometh, it is a tree of life.

 

When we were young we were taught to set aside some of the money we took to school. , little as it was yet we were ‚Äúforced‚Äù to comply. Some did, others failed. I was one of those who failed to comply! 

 

This was the era the Ayigbe carpenters ( Efo) introduced to the Ghanaian market the small wooden savings boxes. Yes,  (Ayigbe Carpenters) to them belong the patent no one can deny that! 

 

Then came adulthood, and we had financial experts demonstrating to us financial plans that can make us financially sound and stable if we apply them. Many did, others failed. 

 

The challenge of pursuing present gratification as against deferral has worried every youth, to this day it is still the number one hurdle to overcome. Interestingly, the Bible recommended long ago the deferral approach as the way to future joy and happiness. 

Read it again 

 

Proverbs 13:12 

NIV

[12] Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but a longing fulfilled is a tree of life.

 

Yes, gratification ( hope) deferred surely makes the heart sick, your friends are enjoying and you‚Äôll love to do the same but choose not to because you want to invest for tomorrow! 

 

It is not how you start but how you end. You can have a good start but end up miserably. You can have a slow start but end up a winner. What passage of scripture does this bring to mind?

 

Ecclesiastes 9

KJV

11+ I returned, and saw under the sun, that the race is not to the swift, nor the battle to the strong, neither yet bread to the wise, nor yet riches to men of understanding, nor yet favour to men of skill; but time and chance happeneth to them all.

 

Yes, exactly! 

 

I must admit as a youth the thought of postponing gratification was a great challenge! What if ‚Äú tomorrow ‚Äú never comes to meet you ? This is the question that keeps popping up! When is the future? 

We hear it said every day, but when is it? 

 

Beloved, every day was once a future. Today was referred to yesterday as a future just as tomorrow is called a future today. Every day therefore is a future come real so do not think of a future as if it were a distant time. 

 

Since man must live as is usually said what then must we do with regards to postponing today‚Äôs enjoyment to tomorrow? Must it be all or some? Here is a recommendation. 

 

‚Äú All work and no play made Oko an anti-social moron! 

 

There is a principle called ‚Äúselective deferment‚Äù, by which is meant there are things that can and must of necessity be deferred whereas others can be enjoyed. What these are depends on your choices and goals in life!  

 

For example, you can defer early ‚Äúmarriage‚Äù to pursue the   academic/training/apprenticeship etc, the same applies to entertainment here moderation is the word. 

 

Make friends, associate with groups etc. but ‚Äúabhor‚Äù certain groupings so you do not come into conflict with the law Always remember what scripture said; 

 

Proverbs 1:10-11,13-15 

NIV

[10] My son, if sinful men entice you, do not give in to them. [11] If they say, ‚ÄúCome along with us; let's lie in wait for innocent blood, let's ambush some harmless soul; 

 

[13] we will get all sorts of valuable things and fill our houses with plunder; [14] cast lots with us; we will all share the loot ‚Äù--- [15] my son, do not go along with them, do not set foot on their paths;

 

So what is all this about? Defer ( postpone) the present for the future   Deny yourself the present to enjoy the future. Yes, it will hurt, but that is the only way. to a better future. Use the present to lay a strong foundation for tomorrow 

 

However you define the future, it will surely come. Remember today was yesterday‚Äòs future. 

 

A complex thought to share!

title: A Question Of Christian Liberty
text:
The Question Of Christian Liberty  

 

Romans 14

KJV

14+ I know, and am persuaded by the Lord Jesus, that there is nothing unclean of itself: but to him that esteemeth any thing to be unclean, to him it is unclean.

 

In a complex society with diverse views and interests, we must respect each other‚Äôs choices of what they prefer, especially where no rule has been established. 

 

Right and wrong as a rule are determined by what scripture says and not by man. This is what should be in the church. Whereas civil society points to a constitution as the basis of determining right or wrong, the church points to the scriptures (the Bible). 

 

If something is right or wrong by scripture, and it is so established and grounded in unambiguous terms; then that is what it is nothing can be done to make a right wrong or vice versa. Scriptures have spoken. 

 

But where there is no such stated rule(s) we are left to fashion out our own rules however these must not be rigidly imposed or enforced. Acceptance and compliance are voluntary choices to the extent that each person sees them as they are. 

 

We do this because there is no law, and where there is no law there is no sin. For it is through the law that we come to know what is sin. Sin is not defined by man, sin is not what man says it is, but what the scriptures say. 

 

Romans 5

KJV

13+ (For until the law sin was in the world: but sin is not imputed when there is no law.

 

Romans 3

KJV

20+ Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law is the knowledge of sin.

 

It is in this context that the above scriptures must be understood, 

Romans 14:14 

NIV

[14] I am convinced, being fully persuaded in the Lord Jesus, that nothing is unclean in itself. But if anyone regards something as unclean, then for that person it is unclean.

 

As can be seen from the discussion, the controversy that Paul was addressing is the eating of meat, herbs etc.  It looks like the contention was between vegetarians and non-vegetarians. 

 

The issue was about liberty, Do Christians have liberty? Do we have any freedoms? This is a question nobody is asking! To most Christians there is nothing like liberty all is about the rule of law and the strict obedience without which you are not a Christian. 

 

Paul‚Äôs statement ‚Äú  that nothing is unclean in itself.‚Äù Has to do with anything that the Scriptures have said nothing about. Surely, there are things that scriptures have designated as clean and unclean so if care is not taken to understand what Paul meant by putting this expression in context, we shall be making scripture to contradict itself. 

 

It is a question of Christian liberty when it comes to things that are not mentioned and also in the absence of rules, or any thus saith the Lord;   In such situations what should we do?  

 

Here is where we have the problem, whereas some would prefer not to do anything though there is no law, some think otherwise. So the conflict or controversy is between those who prefer to do nothing and those who prefer to do something! 

 

By Paul‚Äôs logic, those who prefer to do nothing have not done anything wrong it is their choice. Likewise, those who prefer to do something have also not done any wrong except that they should take into account the feelings of the other group!

 

The bottom line is that neither of these two groups has sinned. For where there is no law, there is no sin. To do or not to do anything where there is no law is a matter of the individual's choice. 

 

What is important is that no one puts a stumbling block in the path of the other. Because each shall render account. 

 

2 So then every one of us shall give account of himself to God.

13+ Let us not therefore judge one another any more: but judge this rather, that no man put a stumblingblock or an occasion to fall in his brother's way.

 

Our problem is one of knowing, acknowledging and understanding that ; 

  1. Not everything is stated in black and white in the scriptures 
  2. There is something called Christian liberty 
  3. The practice of which is a matter of choice and not a force, it is voluntary 
  4. This liberty is practiced in matters that have nothing to do with salvation 
  5. In the practice of Christian liberty, each must be considerate and mindful of their actions, it‚Äôs impact on others. ( anti-libertarians)

 

The problem of disunity and controversy in the church has to do with the failure to accept, understand and practice this concept called Christian Liberty. If we do controversies shall be a thing of the past. 

 

A thought to share

title: A Question Of Biographies And  Tributes!
text:
The Question Of Biographies And Tributes 

 

John 20

KJV

30+ And many other signs truly did Jesus in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book:

 

John 21

KJV

25+ And there are also many other things which Jesus did, the which, if they should be written every one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that should be written. Amen.

 

Wow, you‚Äôll say but it is true. The Apostle John attempted to pen down as it were a biography of Jesus, along the way he realized how daunting such a task would be. Hence the conclusive statements you‚Äôve just read. 

 

These verses came to mind when I was tasked to write a biography of a loved one who lived up to a ripe old age ( age withheld for ethical reasons). I applied all the research skills I was taught in school but I found that one story leads to another. In the end, I had to give up and sum up in a few paragraphs the ‚Äúlife and times ‚Äú of Mr X. 

 

What I learnt is this, the true entire biography of everyone can not be written on earth. I‚Äôve been to funerals where brochures numbered several pages but still, they could not capture the entirety of the dead! 

 

This was confirmed by listening to as many as were at the funeral; each has a story to tell, an incident to describe, an admonition to recall. Yes!

 

Our true biography can not be written here, it can only be written in Heaven. What we have written here are edited versions, some parts are removed, rephrased, rewritten etc. 

 

Can you imagine reading a biography of someone who lived up to a hundred in a little under ten or fifteen minutes? Yes, that is what you hear at funerals. Edited version. 

 

Beloved, we are looking forward to that of Heaven where there will be no editing, it will be read as it is.  That is what I‚Äôll love to hear. The heavenly one has no lies, encomiums, exaggerations, garnishing etc. It does not aim at making a fool look wise, a wicked look good, a selfish look selfless   

 

Oh yes! That day will be that day.! As Paul put it;

 

1 Corinthians 4:5 

NIV

[5] Therefore judge nothing before the appointed time; wait until the Lord comes. He will bring to light what is hidden in darkness and will expose the motives of the heart. At that time each will receive their praise from God.

 

So beloved, worry not about what your biography would be or look like, that of the earth is edited, rephrased, and efforts will be made to paint you a saint or an angel when they know full well that is not the case! 

 

A man known in his area as a no-nonsense husband; who often beat his wife, didn‚Äôt make her a top agenda but at his funeral; mourners were thrilled to hear what she wrote about him. , She wrote, ‚Äú he was a sweet loving man, he cared and provided for us OH! Hmmm, I miss him forever ‚Äú! Yes you‚Äôve heard this several times 

 

On one occasion I dared to ask why it is so? I was told that traditionally you don‚Äôt speak evil of the dead! Why? I received no answer! Will he come back to haunt you? Will he kill you? No one could answer. It's all a taboo design to let as it were ‚Äúsleeping dogs lie‚Äù  

 

A dead person whether good or bad must be praised and be well spoken of! Yes. But not so in Heaven there a spade shall be called a spade. If in doubt just take any bible character of repute and read everything about him and you‚Äôll know what heaven‚Äôs biography will look like! 

 

This is a question of biography and tributes, no matter how lengthy or short they are, the true one shall be both written and read in Heaven. The reading may take much longer than what pertains here. Prepare for it. 

 

There is so much good about you that is not known, that Day will reveal them. Those who choose deliberately not to know or acknowledge you will hear it read by not a human being but an Angel. 

 

The reading shall be interrupted intermittently by the sound of trumpets blown by Angels! After which a white robe shall be put over you, and you‚Äôll majestically be led to take your seat by the Throne. 

 

Oh, what a glorious day awaits you. 

 

A thought to share!

title: The Value And Place Of Wisdom
text:
Faith Moves Mountains; Wisdom Protects And Guides. Be A Patriot 

 

Ecclesiastes 9:14-15 

NIV

[14] There was once a small city with only a few people in it. And a powerful king came against it, surrounded it and built huge siege works against it. [15] Now there lived in that city a man poor but wise, and he saved the city by his wisdom. But nobody remembered that poor man.

 

Growing up I heard much said concerning patriotism and how we should love and serve our country. During the Young Pioneer Movement days of Nkrumah, we the members of were taught this virtue -to love and serve the nation. 

 

A pledge was composed which was recited at every meeting of the Movement. Later over time, the Young Pioneer Movement spread to include schools and every child became a member. It first began with a select few. 

 

A part of what we recited at our parades called the Code reads, ‚Äúprotection of state property, reliability and secrecy, comradeship and forbearance ‚Äú etc. It starts with the words ‚Äú I solemnly pledge to be faithful and loyal to the ideas ( ideals)  of the founder of the nation, Osagyefo Dr Kwame Nkrumah etc. etc. 

 

So, patriotism was woven into our moral conscience from the Word go, but for the coup of 1966, Ghana would have been a haven of patriots. Nation-building was the goal, and it was nearly achieved. 

 

The above scriptures talk about an incident that according to Solomon was amazing, a city was saved by the wisdom of a poor man. A patriot you may call him. According to ‚Äú Uncle ‚Äú Solo he learnt two lessons that he will never forget, that is; the value and place of wisdom and patriotism, regardless of one‚Äôs economic status. 

 

The city which was under siege was delivered through the wise advice this poor man gave. Something he did out of love for the city. Though we are not told what he said at least we know he was a man armed with ideas, know how etc. 

 

Hear Solomon;

Ecclesiastes 9:16 

NIV

[16] So I said, ‚ÄúWisdom is better than strength.‚Äù 

 

These words seem to suggest that at the Town Hall meeting convened to discuss what to do; the majority were of the view that a ‚Äú boot for boot ‚Äú approach should be used. 

 

When the wise poor man got up to speak, he was likely heckled by the rich majority   This can be gleaned from what Solomon said; Read it 

 

Ecclesiastes 9:17

NIV

[17] The quiet words of the wise are more to be heeded than the shouts of a ruler of fools.

 

It is a subtle way of saying that whereas ‚Äú the majority of rich fools‚Äù were screaming their na√Øve solutions, the poor man spoke his wisdom in a low tone! 

 

Have you not seen or experienced this before? Surely you have. Meetings where ‚Äú empty barrels‚Äù get up to scream incoherent, na√Øve etc ideas wanting to be heard just because they have a few socio/economic advantages! 

 

Wisdom has nothing to do with what you wear, how you appear, the car you drive, the food you eat, the house you own, or the bed you sleep on. It has got to do with the quality of the contents of your head-brain! 

 

Your ability to think quality thoughts. Your ability to provide quality solutions to challenges, your ability to see what others can not see. Your ability to make sense of nonsense! Need I add more? 

 

Wisdom is distilled knowledge, knowledge taken through the refinery of life. Tested and devoid of ambiguities and impurities of hazy, crooked thinking. Yes! 

 

Wisdom does not belong to the rich nor the poor, it is not the monopoly of a group. Wisdom is wisdom whoever desires it receives it. It is a gift. 

 

James 1

KJV

5+ If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.

 

The man in question was not wise because he was poor! 

Poverty is a condition, a state, an economic and not a mental/intellectual deprivation! It is reversible. 

 

Just as knowledge comes from books, so does wisdom come from God, every endowment has a source. There is divine wisdom and there is the secular they both have a part to play in human endeavours and are therefore necessary. Blessed is the man who possesses both, for he shall do wonders. 

 

Because wisdom comes from God, He gives it to whomsoever He chooses, young or old, illiterate or literate, poor or rich, believer or non-believer etc; per what He wants accomplished! 

 

Yes, Faith moves mountains, wisdom guides and protects we need both to be patriotic citizens of the kingdom of God, the Church of the Living  God! 

 

A thought to share

title: Choices, What Influences Them
text:
Choices And What Influences Them: The Case Of A Selfless Person. 

Philippians 1

KJV

23+ For I am in a strait betwixt two, having a desire to depart, and to be with Christ; which is far better: 24 Nevertheless to abide in the flesh is more needful for you.

 

Life is filled with choices, decisions, consequences etc, each day or hour we are called upon to make a choice or a decision. Some of which may conflict with what we wish for ourselves but for the sake of others we act in ways that will inure to their good. 

 

What is it that influences such decisions and how do we call persons who make such choices? 

 

Paul found himself in one such situation which is what you‚Äôve read above. He opted for that which will inure to the good of his followers. This is the hallmark of a selfless person.

 

A selfless person is among other things is someone who puts others‚Äô interests, convenience, etc above his own. Read the following as examples; 

 

Say I have a bottle of water to drink but seeing that you are thirstier than l am, I choose to offer you the water. Not because I am not thirsty, you saw that I am. 

 

Again I had GHC 5,000 to use in settling a debt which is due in two weeks, it is a mandatory payment l must honour; yet you approached me with an urgent request. Your child is in admission and needs a life-saving medication. 

 

I have a debt to settle failure of which will bring me public disgrace as my name will be blacklisted and published in the dailies. Yet I gave the money to you. 

 

This is the hallmark of a selfless person. Someone willing to endure humiliation to save a life! Do you know that is what Jesus meant in practical  terms the oft-quoted scripture 

 

John 15

KJV

13+ Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.

 

Let us look at the scenarios I painted in the examples above to see how they respond to Jesus‚Äô statement! 

 

Water is life any reduction in the level in our bodies is called dehydration which poses a threat to life if not corrected early. So in giving away my water, I laid down my life for my friend who received and drank it. 

 

Doesn‚Äôt this answer to Jesus‚Äô statement? 

 

Scenario two, I gave out money I should have used to settle a mandatory debt, consequences of which are public disgrace and humiliation   Yes, but I did this to save a life. 

 

Now you know what it means to be selfless. If we make a choice that ends up in helping someone out of a predicament at a cost to us, this makes us selfless and pleases God. 

 

Beloved this is not something you and I cannot do; some do it almost every day! You are one, if you care to know the last time you offered me a lift even though you were not going my direction. 

 

The last time you made me that tea using the last milk and teabag which you were going to use for yourself. ( This reminds me of the widow of Zarephath ) 

 

The last time you saw me off with money you had intended to use for a pressing need, to buy fuel to take me home. Hardly did you know that you were laying down your life for my good.! 

 

In doing these you are fulfilling what both Jesus and john said. Read that of John

1 John 3:16 

NIV

[16] This is how we know what love is: Jesus Christ laid down his life for us. And we ought to lay down our lives for our brothers and sisters.

 

( You read my article titled ‚Äú I want to know what love is!) 

 

To Paul, this is what it means to walk in love. ; 

Ephesians 5

KJV

2+ And walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us, and hath given himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour.

 

If Jesus did these for our sakes, we also ought to do the same to ourselves ;

John 13

KJV

14+ If I then, your Lord and Master, have washed your feet; ye also ought to wash one another's feet.


Be selfless, in making choices, factor in how the choice will inure to the good of others. There is so much selfishness parading as success in our midst. This is very subtle and is not easily discerned. 

 

A word to the wise!

title: In His Hands, We Are Safe
text:
In His Hands, We Are Safe!


Psalms 121
KJV
5+ The Lord is thy keeper: the Lord is thy shade upon thy right hand. 6 The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.

 

7+ The Lord shall preserve thee from all evil: he shall preserve thy soul. 8+ The Lord shall preserve thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth, and even for evermore.

 

With the storms raging and our hearts filled with fear and uncertainty, these words of assurance become the guiding stay that we can lean upon.

 

The invincibility of a believer is what these words convey. With God on our side, we are invincible, though evil minds will wage war against us, yet our victory is assured and guaranteed!

 

For we are surrounded by the Host of Angels sent to protect and guide us. His ‚Äúpillar of fire‚Äù and that of the ‚Äúcloud‚Äù shall lead us both in the ‚Äúday‚Äù and at ‚Äúnight‚Äù.

 

Though the storms rage and the billows rise, we shall remain strong, steadfast, unmoved because our hope is grounded in His unfailing words and love.

 

7+ The Lord shall preserve thee from all evil: he shall preserve thy soul. 8+ The Lord shall preserve thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth, and even for evermore.

 

Our wills and destinies are in His Hands, we have resigned ours to accept His so we can boldly say ‚Äú not mine but Thine be Done ! ‚Äú whether in life or death may Thy perfect Will find fulfilment in our lives!

 

Beloved, another Day has dawned, another week has begun; as children of the Most High;  triumph and victory over the Enemy is what we seek and these shall be ours because the Lord God is our Rock and Redeemer!

 

Maranatha!

title: Divination And Sorcery : The Bane Of A Nation
text:
Divination And Sorcery, A Threat To True Faith.: Nothing New!  

Acts 13

KJV

6 And when they had gone through the isle unto Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Bar-jesus:

8+ But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn away the deputy from the faith.

 

Acts 8

KJV

9+ But there was a certain man, called Simon, which beforetime in the same city used sorcery, and bewitched the people of Samaria, giving out that himself was some great one:

 

10 To whom they all gave heed, from the least to the greatest, saying, This man is the great power of God.

 

11+ And to him they had regard, because that of long time he had bewitched them with sorceries.

 

13 Then Simon himself believed also: and when he was baptized, he continued with Philip, and wondered, beholding the miracles and signs which were done.

 

Acts 16

KJV

16+ And it came to pass, as we went to prayer, a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us, which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying:

 

17 The same followed Paul and us, and cried, saying, These men are the servants of the most high God, which shew unto us the way of salvation.

 

18+ And this did she many days. But Paul, being grieved, turned and said to the spirit, I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her. And he came out the same hour.

 

19 And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone, they caught Paul and Silas, and drew them into the marketplace unto the rulers,

 

Matthew 7

KJV

15+ Beware of false prophets, which come to you in sheep's clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.

 

Today, the ‚Äúchristo-religious‚Äù foundation in Ghana is shaking under the weight of diviner‚Äôs and sorcerers parading as apostle‚Äôs and prophets to whom almost everyone educated or uneducated, politician or electorate, rich or poor, etc are turning to for succour. 

 

The most sought-after personalities today are Diviners (predictors/forecasters). People who can look into the future and predict gloom and doom, because good news does not attract it is the bad, so if you can predict gloom and doom then you are in business! Fear is the key factor!

 

A wave of change is blowing through the nation. True faith has come under threat, many are wavering, unsure of which is which, the country is at the crossroads. Developments are scary and extreme fear has gripped the populace 

 

The passages listed above speak volumes about the challenges faced by the early Christians. Diviners and sorcerers were present as they are today. The early believers were warned and told to expect these developments ;

 

2 Peter 2:1, 3 

NIV

But there were also false prophets among the people, just as there will be false teachers among you. They will secretly introduce destructive heresies, even denying the sovereign Lord who bought them-bringing swift destruction on themselves. 

 

[3] In their greed these teachers will exploit you with fabricated stories. Their condemnation has long been hanging over them, and their destruction has not been sleeping.

 

Today majority are unable to identify divination and sorcery, as it was in the past so it is today many mistake it to be the power of God. 

 

The girl with the spirit of divination that Paul rebuked was not saying anything wrong. She was telling the truth   

Hear her; 

Acts 16:16-17

NIV

[16] Once when we were going to the place of prayer, we were met by a female slave who had a spirit by which she predicted the future. She earned a great deal of money for her owners by fortune-telling.

 

[17] She followed Paul and the rest of us, shouting, ‚ÄúThese men are servants of the Most High God, who are telling you the way to be saved.‚Äù

 

Did you read this? ‚ÄúWe were met by a female slave who had a spirit by which she predicted the future‚Äù?

 

The KJV reads, 

Acts 16

KJV

16+ And it came to pass, as we went to prayer, a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us, which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying:

 

Two words worth noting: ‚Äúdivination and soothsaying ‚Äú  

 

The spirit of ‚Äú divination‚Äù enables the possessor to ‚Äú predict the future ‚ÄúDo you now understand what is meant by divination? There is a spirit which, when you possess you can predict the future. That is what we are reading from this verse!

 

The practice of Divination, involves the practitioner entering and peeping into the spiritual realm! A practice God forbade the Jews from engaging in. Divination and sorcery were part of a package that included other practices they were forbidden to practice. 

 

Leviticus 20

KJV

6+ And the soul that turneth after such as have familiar spirits, and after wizards, to go a whoring after them, I will even set my face against that soul, and will cut him off from among his people.

 

Deuteronomy 18:9-12 

NIV

[9] When you enter the land the Lord your God is giving you, do not learn to imitate the detestable ways of the nations there

. [10] Let no one be found among you who sacrifices their son or daughter in the fire, who practices divination or sorcery, interprets omens, engages in witchcraft, 

[11] or casts spells, or who is a medium or spiritist or who consults the dead. [12] Anyone who does these things is detestable to the Lord; because of these same detestable practices, the Lord your God will drive out those nations before you.

 

Whether we believe it or not, there is a spiritual realm where invincible forces war against each other. It is a battle between good and evil. It is not a movie but a reality. Jesus knew this, and Paul was aware. Did he not say the following? Read a few ; 

2 Corinthians 10

KJV

4+ (For the weapons of our warfare are not carnal, but mighty through God to the pulling down of strongholds ;)

 

Ephesians 6

KJV

12 For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places.

 

At a point in His ministry, Jesus interceded for Peter when Satan planned for his downfall, read it 

Luke 22

KJV

31+ And the Lord said, Simon, Simon, behold, Satan hath desired to have you, that he may sift you as wheat:

32 But I have prayed for thee, that thy faith fail not: and when thou art converted, strengthen thy brethren.

 

The invincible unseen Hand of God surrounds us as such the evil hosts of Satan are unable to penetrate! We in leadership are his target, he will use every means possible, every little opening etc to derail our forward march!  

 

Unfortunately, some church members are ready-made, willing tools in his hand to be used in executing his diabolical plans! 

 

Some spiritual hosts are arrayed against us, but at the same time, there are friendly hosts fighting on our behalf as Jesus did for Peter. 

 

It is into this realm that diviners and sorcerers tap through satanic means to either alter, falsify, turn /change destinies etc. One such incident was what Jesus saw about Peter and aborted it. Satan was going to change his destiny! 

 

This is exactly what we see unfolding before our very eyes. People‚Äôs destinies are being changed and aborted in the spiritual realms! Unnatural phenomena are occurring because the arrangements in the spiritual realms have been infiltrated and tampered with! 

 

Divination and sorcery are real! They are not imaginary or theoretical concepts. 

 

Do you recall this incident?

 

1 Samuel 28

KJV

11 Then said the woman, Whom shall I bring up unto thee? And he said, Bring me up Samuel.

 

12 And when the woman saw Samuel, she cried with a loud voice: and the woman spake to Saul, saying, Why hast thou deceived me? For thou art Saul.

 

13 And the king said unto her, Be not afraid: for what sawest thou? And the woman said unto Saul, I saw gods ascending out of the earth.

 

14+ And he said unto her, What form is he of? And she said, An old man cometh up; and he is covered with a mantle. And Saul perceived that it was Samuel, and he stooped with his face to the ground, and bowed himself.

 

15 And Samuel said to Saul, Why hast thou disquieted me, to bring me up? And Saul answered, I am sore distressed; for the Philistines make war against me, and God is departed from me, and answereth me no more, neither by prophets, nor by dreams: therefore I have called thee, that thou mayest make known unto me what I shall do.

 

Some have doubted and denied this incident because they lack knowledge of the dark world. Unfortunately, these are those who fall prey to diviners because they lack knowledge regarding the practice. 

 

Spiritism, divination, soothsaying etc are real. There is the temptation to deny but they are real. We are forbidden to dabble in any of these practices 

 

Deuteronomy 29:29 

NIV

[29] The secret things belong to the Lord our God, but the things revealed belong to us and to our children forever, that we may follow all the words of this law.

 

This scripture acknowledges that there are ‚Äú secret things ‚Äú but they belong to God. He placed an embargo on His servants not to venture into such realms to look for etc anything He has ‚Äú classified ‚Äú which the writer referred to as ‚Äú secret ‚Äú

 

The same scripture also leaves in the Hands of God the right to ‚Äú declassify ‚Äú and whatever He ‚Äúdeclassifies ‚Äú we will put it into the public domain. Whatever He declassifies is no secret! 

 

So if any claims to be a servant of God and yet ventures into such ‚Äúsecret realms ‚Äú when Hw has forbidden any to enter, then he is not a true servant of God, He is a disobedient servant, a fake or an imposter because he has disobeyed His directives 

 

There is a need for prayers and discernment, for the times are dangerous. 

 

These may say ‚Äú God has revealed this or that to me‚Äù which is not true. What he claims is something he saw when he peeped into the secret forbidden realms! 

 

Indeed we are at a crossroads! Like Elymas some of these diviners/sorcerers sit at high places with rulers ( politicians )    They‚Äôve made the rulers ( politicians ) to believe and endorse them as powerful men!!

 

Ghana is not a theocracy (spiritual) but a democracy (secular) both have different forms of governance structures and constitutions! These must be respected by the two institutions ( church and state ) and their operatives ( ministers and politicians ) 

 

Unfortunately for us, there is a drift by the operatives of the spiritual towards the secular, for whatever reasons your guess is as good as mine. Limelight, political favour and privileges! 

 

These are dangerous times, diviners and sorcerers are taking over true faith and practice, and by extension political governance as they seek to influence rulers and men in authority 

 

Beloved as the psalmist of old requested so do I today ; 

Psalm 122:6-7 

NIV

[6] Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: ‚ÄúMay those who love you be secure. [7] May there be peace within your walls and security within your citadels. ‚Äù

title: Victory Through Perseverance
text:
Victory Through Perseverance 

Matthew 15

KJV

27+ And she said, Truth, Lord: yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters' table.

28 Then Jesus answered and said unto her, O woman, great is thy faith: be it unto thee even as thou wilt. And her daughter was made whole from that very hour.

 

I was amazed by this response from the Canaanite mother who came to plead on behalf of her daughter who was experiencing some spiritual challenges. 

 

Jesus wanted to test her faith by saying what may be regarded today as an unpleasant comment. Read it. 

22 And, behold, a woman of Canaan came out of the same coasts, and cried unto him, saying, Have mercy on me, O Lord, thou Son of David; my daughter is grievously vexed with a devil.

24 But he answered and said, I am not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

 

25+ Then came she and worshipped him, saying, Lord, help me.

26+ But he answered and said, It is not meet to take the children's bread, and to cast it to dogs.

 

Did you read this?

Matthew 15:26 

NIV

[26] He replied, ‚ÄúIt is not right to take the children's bread and toss it to the dogs.‚Äù

 

Dogs? Just because I‚Äôve come to seek help? Oh no!!  Surely this is enough to put away anyone making a plea or a request, as it sounds offensive but not this woman.! 

 

Read her response 

Matthew 15:27 

NIV

[27] ‚ÄúYes it is, Lord,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúEven the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their master's table.‚Äù

 

She did not doubt what Jesus said but she also gave a profound response, a response that touched the heart of Jesus. She said, ‚Äú master, with all due respect in case you‚Äôve forgotten, let me remind you, even the crumbs that fall from the table are delicacies to dogs! 

 

(Please note, she said these while smiling! Not in a combatant disrespectful manner!) 

 

At this saying of her‚Äôs Jesus had no option but to yield to her request. He understood and interpreted her response as an expression of faith. Read it;

Matthew 15:28 

NIV

[28] Then Jesus said to her, ‚ÄúWoman, you have great faith! Your request is granted.‚Äù And her daughter was healed at that moment.

 

This is victory through perseverance! This woman instead of walking away stood her ground, regardless of how provocative Jesus‚Äô answer to her was, she stood her ground! 

 

Beloved, regardless of what the negatives are or may be; stand your ground until your request is granted. See these negatives as a test of your  resolve. 

 

When I was young and TV sets were not very common, so we often trooped to watch one in a house where we were not entertained! Our parents could not afford one so we were treated as outcasts! 

 

At six pm every evening we would go to watch Bonanza,(?) featuring Dan Blocker, Pernell Roberts and also The Saint etc.  We would be accused of not taking our baths therefore we are smelling!  We were not allowed to cross a demarcated zone even though the TV set was placed outside.

 

Yes. All manner of insults would be rained on us, with strict restrictions among which is not to talk, laugh or shout! Reader, who watches an exciting film without engaging in any of these? But these were the rules. The intent was to make things intolerable so we quit! 

 

Like the woman mentioned above, we stood our ground regardless of the provocations and insults because we wanted to enjoy ourselves! We were focused, we defied all odds to remain and watch the TV. We never walked away. 

 

Poverty teaches lessons,  one such lesson is perseverance. This we learnt from our youth due to the circumstances we found ourselves in. Little did we know we were preparing ourselves to face the challenges in life. 

 

Dear reader, regardless of provocations, no matter the unpleasant comments, ‚Äògo and comes‚Äô (sic) that may be thrown in your path; persevere for they are the trials of your faith and patience. 

 

Do not walk away from the prize before you because of insults, stand your ground and victory will be yours. Always remember, ‚Äúno thorns no crown! ‚ÄúIf you can wear the crown of thorns, you‚Äôll have no difficulty wearing that of gold! 

 

As Paul said ; 

Acts 14

KJV

22+ Confirming the souls of the disciples, and exhorting them to continue in the faith, and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God.

 

Yes, we must go through hazards to win a victory, this is a principle of life we can not escape but must experience. The Canaanite woman walked away after receiving a commendation from Jesus. ‚Äú Great is Thy Faith !‚Äù  This can also be said of you, Great is your perseverance!

6+ Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:

 

Beloved, the more I read, the more I acknowledge how poor I am! I have many tools in my toolbox at home, thinking they were meant for one specific task until I started seeing the same tools used in multiple ways by others. 

 

As the above scripture points out, knowledge is not the monopoly of one man, great or small, birds or reptiles, insects or whatever all have specialized knowledge that is needed by everyone. 

 

Am I the only one saying this? Read this ; 

Job 12

KJV

7 But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:

8 Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.

 

Ants have something to teach and so do snakes, Yes! In the case of snakes not much is known but we know this, it sheds its skin to be covered with another! Which in itself is a powerful lesson captured in these verses ;

 

Colossians 3

KJV

8+ But now ye also *put off* all these; anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication out of your mouth.

9 Lie not one to another, seeing that ye have put off the old man with his deeds;

10+ And have *put on* the new man, which is renewed in knowledge after the image of him that created him:

 

Put Off, to put On‚Äù, even Crabs do the same! I was surprised to watch this shedding of coat live on TV by a Crab! 

 

The great ‚Äúentomologist ‚Äù said this about the Ant read it ; 

 

Proverbs 30

KJV

25+ The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;

 

It is not about ‚Äústrength‚Äù, wealth, etc, but the application of brain power;- vision, creative and innovative thinking! These are ignited in us as we interact with each other, as we listen and watch how others go about things. 

 

Beloved. Everyone, both wise the unwise has something to teach just be patient and observe! Intellectual poverty, spiritual poverty and wisdom etc are the result of not being patient and observant in life! 

 

Do these and you‚Äôll be rich in knowledge, wisdom and common sense!
