title: What I Found!
text:
What I Found Out

Ecclesiastes 7

KJV

29 Lo, this only have I found, that God hath made man upright; but they have sought out many inventions.

 

In my quest to understand life, through reading, observing and experience, l realised how simple life was meant to be! Unfortunately, we have made it complex and demanding! 

 

I came to fully understand John‚Äôs words as an attempt to trace the root causes of the challenges we face. Read it

 

1 John 2

KJV

16 For all that is in the world, the lust of the flesh, and the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, is not of the Father, but is of the world.

 

  • Lust of the eyes
  • Lust of the flesh 
  • Pride of life 

 

John identified the above as the sources of the problems we face in life, and they are the truth. They are a summary of all that works against us. Not openly but in subtle ways. 

 

Observing life in general I realised that these three areas are the most tempting and challenging and if we can work on them life will be pleasant! 

 

Again observing from a distance l learnt this, the antidote to the above ‚Äú three killer diseases ‚Äù is ‚Äú contentment ‚Äú   To be satisfied with what one has unfortunately is where the real battle lies. 

 

The desire to be, the desire or drive to conform to be seen and counted as belonging etc is what makes it difficult to be content. 

 

For example, growing up our girls were proud of their natural hair, they plaited or fashioned it as to look so gorgeous and attractive.  , not so today! 

 

The natural is disdained for the artificial as a result women must wear ‚Äúcaps‚Äù, or ‚Äú hats‚Äù made of artificial hair every day! One can imagine the discomfort of having to wear such ‚Äú hats‚Äù under the scorching sun every day. 

 

Yes, God created a simple world,

Ecclesiastes 7:29

NIV

[29] This only have I found: God created mankind upright, but they have gone in search of many schemes.‚Äù

 

It is these schemes that have brought us to where we are today; suffocating under insatiable desires. Oh that we return to the natural state of simplicity that was made for our good! 

 

Like the Ecclesiastics writer, I also found these, the choice is ours to make! May these words of Paul remind each of us ;

 

1 Timothy 6

KJV

6+ But godliness with contentment is great gain.

 

My take on simplicity as a key to living a fulfilled life! Though not easy yet it is attainable!

title: Our Common Deniminator
text:
Our  Common Denominator! 

Ecclesiastes 9:2 

NIV

[2] All share a common destiny---the righteous and the wicked, the good and the bad, the clean and the unclean, those who offer sacrifices and those who do not. As it is with the good, so with the sinful; as it is with those who take oaths, so with those who are afraid to take them.

 

Though we differ in many respects, pursue different ideals and goals in life one thing is common to us all, death. 

 

No matter what are status‚Äô is in life we have one thing in common; death, as was said to Adam our great-grandfather; ‚Äú from the dust you were taken and to dust shall thou return ‚Äú. 

 

This we see every day as we visit the cemetery where coffins containing the mortal remains of people who once lived, ate, laughed, etc with lowered into a pit dug for them and covered with soil and in a split moment vanish from our sight for good! 

 

As has also been said, these take nothing they possessed away; ‚Äú we brought nothing into the world and we shall certainly take nothing away ‚Äú. Nothing In, Nothing Out! 

 

Everything we own here is on a rental basis, they don‚Äôt belong to us, even our bodies are rented properties! At the appropriate time when our tenancy runs out the owner takes His properties back. 

 

Everyone entering the world at birth signed a tenancy agreement, interestingly this agreement is not physical but spiritual. It is deposited with the Landlord no copy is given to us. 

 

Admittedly. It is this that makes it very ‚Äú uncomfortable ‚Äú since no one knows the expiry date in the agreement except the Landlord! 

 

The Omnipotent Landlord we are told is gracious, merciful etc, and can choose to renew, extend etc the expiry dates! One thing is clear, He does not abrogate the contract/tenancy, He allows it to run its full course! Any abrogation is not His but man-initiated. So be careful you don‚Äôt initiate any process that will abrogate your tenancy agreement. 

 

Again we the tenants can not Influence Him. He does what He likes to whomsoever He delights in; per whatever plans and purposes He has. 

 

The Landlord on several occasions have told us that we are strangers and pilgrims, we are here on a temporary visitor‚Äôs visa! ( We are on a Hajj!) 

 

He said this to let us know how we should conduct ourselves. A pilgrim does not acquire many properties except those that will make his ‚Äú short stay‚Äù comfortable! Here is where we have the challenge and problems!  

 

No matter what, the fact remains that death is our common denominator, it levels all rich or poor, wise or foolish, as is said ‚Äú six feet at last‚Äù. 

 

Let us therefore walk humbly and patiently with each other, for soon our tenancy will expire! When, we don‚Äôt know this weekend we are seeing many off since their tenancies have expired! 

 

Let us be wise with how we live, we are living on borrowed time so every second matters! 

 

My take.

title: My Grace Is Sufficient For You
text:
My Grace Is Sufficient For Thee! 

2 Corinthians 12

KJV

9+ And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.

 

A very revealing word of comfort and assurance you‚Äôve just read. Paul had petitioned God to remove a ‚Äúthorn in his flesh‚Äù which he described as ‚Äú

the messenger of Satan to buffet me,‚Äù 

 

He petitioned three times but to no avail, only to be told, ‚ÄúMy grace is sufficient for you.‚Äù In other words, God is saying to him, ‚ÄúI‚Äôll provide you with my cover so that even though you are walking under the valley of the shadow of death, you‚Äôll triumph.‚Äù 

 

This is the experience of Paul hence he wrote these self-assuring words ;

Philippians 4

KJV

13+ I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.

 

In Gethsemane, God did the same to Jesus, He sent His angels to strengthen him through the agonising moments ( mental, emotional) he was experiencing 

 

Luke 22

KJV

43 And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven, strengthening him.

44+ And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly: and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground.

 

The same assurance from God is what Isaiah recorded; read them 

Isaiah 43

KJV

2+ When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee; and through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame kindle upon thee.

 

Isaiah 40

KJV

29 He giveth power to the faint; and to them that have no might he increaseth strength.

30 Even the youths shall faint and be weary, and the young men shall utterly fall:

 

31+ But they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.

 

In life we each have a ‚ÄúCross ‚Äú to carry much as we wish we never have, it is God‚Äôs way of manifesting His power and presence with us. It is also His way of teaching us to rely on Him! 

 

As Paul said, it was God‚Äôs way of humbling him lest he become proud. 

7 And lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure.

 

Did you read this; ‚Äú lest I should be exalted above measure‚Äù yes a ‚Äú thorn in our flesh ‚Äú could be God‚Äôs way of teaching us humility! 

 

But what could this ‚Äú thorn ‚Äú be? It varies from person to person, but simply it is any permanent inconvenience that puts limitations on enjoying your total freedom! 

 

Many have certain limitations that they‚Äôve worried themselves about, they‚Äôve spent so much fortune to have them removed but to no avail. 

 

These are not alone, Paul was like that. Three times he petitioned God, but to no avail. However, unlike us, he resolved and resigned his will to God. Read what he wrote,

 

8 For this thing I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me.

9+ And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. ‚ÄúMost gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities‚Äù, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.

 

Beloved, accept your ‚Äú cross ‚Äú live with it and enjoy life. Your worries will not change anything! I have a metal implant in my right arm, and it‚Äôs been there since 1989! Truly a ‚Äú thorn in my flesh‚Äù there is nothing I can do about  it but to live with it. 

 

My grace is sufficient for thee was not said only to Paul, but by extension also to us who are in situations similar to his. 

 

Therefore beloved, avoid self-pity. Look at the positive side of life and enjoy yourself regardless! God will provide strength to help us bear our Crosses! He did it to Paul and will do it to us who trust Him 

 

My take

title: In Praise Of Kindness
text:
In Praise Of Kindness! 

2 Peter 1

KJV

7+ And to godliness brotherly kindness; and to brotherly kindness charity.

 

Because of the wickedness of the majority, many have lost faith in humanity! However, there are still kind and good people around though they are few! 

 

This came to light when a brother despite mounting pressures offered to assist me in attending to an assignment outside my locality. 

 

Reflecting on the events I went through my hope and faith were rekindled by this generous act. That was when the above scriptures came to mind! 

 

2 Peter 1

KJV

7+ And to godliness brotherly kindness; and to brotherly kindness charity.

 

Brotherly kindness is a demonstration of love, no one will show you kindness if he/she does not first love you. Just as kindnesses are in degrees so is love hence the Lord said, 

 

John 15

KJV

13+ Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.

 

If there is ‚Äú greater love,‚Äù then there must also be a ‚Äú lesser love. ‚ÄúAll love is not the same in terms of degree! It follows, therefore, that there is ‚Äúgreater kindness‚Äù and ‚Äú lesser kindness.‚Äù These are seen through the respective actions /deeds performed. 

 

Love is love but there is a greater love. Kindness is kindness but there is greater kindness. Since love demands a sacrifice, it follows that the greater the sacrifice made the greater the love demonstrated. 

 

In a similar tone, kindness is also a sacrifice (costs), so the greater the sacrifice, the greater is the kindness shown to us. 

 

The act of love and kindness shown to me by this brother has challenged me to review and revise my notes, and to do likewise! 

 

Thank you brother for the lessons I‚Äôve learnt from your actions. 

 

My take on what it means to be kind!

title: Swimming Against A Tide
text:
Swimming Against A Tide: An Impossible Task
( An Inquiry)

 

There are many practices that each generation creates and leaves behind to be inherited by successive generations!

 

From the traditional to the modern times, there has been as it were a template for writing official letters.

 

When I served as an administrator in a state-owned company  I encountered this pattern, any attempt I made to reform it was met with rebuke and reprimand from my immediate supervisor! 

 

Tradition die hard is a true statement!

 

I have been reading on funeral posters the expression ‚Äú all friends and sympathisers are cordially invited ‚Äú. The question is, are ‚Äúfriends and sympathisers ‚Äú not the same people? Therefore one word ‚Äú sympathisers‚Äù is enough to describe them!

 

Should it not rather read ‚Äú  family and sympathisers ‚Äú are cordially invited ? Since these groups are distinct; if you are not a ‚Äúfamily‚Äù you are a sympathiser!

 

So, the invitation is to the generality, family and general public. But to say ‚Äú friends and sympathisers ‚Äú is problematic ! Friends and sympathisers are the same people; a sympathiser is a friend.

 

My observation from reading most of the ‚Äútemplate‚Äù  captions displayed on funeral posters indicates a not well-thought-out design. Home Call! Call To Glory!  Etc

 

In my humble view,  perhaps invitational statements should read ‚Äú family, empathisers and sympathisers ‚Äú are cordially invited.

 

These are 3 distinctive groups, the family on one side, the general public that attends is in two groups ‚Äúempathisers‚Äù and ‚Äúsympathisers‚Äù these are not the same. Empathisers stay longer and make tangible, quality contributions than sympathisers

 

Sympathisers are also in three (4)  groups, those who leave immediately the body is lifted from the funeral ground ( church) to the cemetery.

 

(2) The other group accompanies the body to the cemetery, but stays at the entrance ( car park) waiting for those who go to bury.

 

The (3) group are those who will not attend both the church service and the burial ceremonies but show up at the refreshment ceremony

 

And the final group (4) are those who will not attend any of the above three functions but show up only at the Sunday Thanksgiving service!  
 

The worst group (5) of sympathizers are the ‚Äú condolences ‚Äú group. These are those who are quick to send condolences but will not show up at any of the above events.

 

It is only the ‚Äú family and empathisers‚Äù who stay through all the stages mentioned above.

 

Now you‚Äôve seen the error contained in the template! Each of us belongs to one of the family, empathisers and sympathizers groups!

 

Truth is what you‚Äôve just read. Where do you belong? Read it again!

 

My take
.

title: Let Him Have His Way :The Cutoff Point
text:
Let Him Have His Way: A Question Of Cutoff Point!  

(Part 1)

Matthew 5

KJV

39 But I say unto you, That ye resist not evil: but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also.

 

40 And if any man will sue thee at the law, and take away thy coat, let him have thy cloke also.

41+ And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile, go with him twain.

 

Indeed, humanly speaking these are requirements that are difficult to observe! If this were a test many are those who will fail to meet the passmark. They will skip this section and move to the next. 

 

Unfortunately in the case of believers answering them forms part of what will qualify him/her to make the grade, so he/she cannot skip them! 

 

Indeed, beloved, if the ‚Äúcutoff point‚Äù is not lowered, most of us will not make it! True!!

 

The issue of ‚Äú cut off‚Äù point does not feature in our church vocabulary but it is there and real except that either we deliberately ignore it or are ignorant of it! 

 

The concept of a ‚Äúcutoff‚Äù is there in the OT, it is what the concept of the ‚Äú remnants ‚Äúspeaks to. 

Isaiah 1

KJV

9+ Except the Lord of hosts had left unto us a very small remnant, we should have been as Sodom, and we should have been like unto Gomorrah.

 

Lamentations 3

KJV

22+ It is of the Lord's mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.

 

Isaiah 10

KJV

21+ The remnant shall return, even the remnant of Jacob, unto the mighty God.

22+ For though thy people Israel be as the sand of the sea, yet a remnant of them shall return: the consumption decreed shall overflow with righteousness.

 

Romans 9

KJV

29+ And as Esaias said before, Except the Lord of Sabaoth had left us a seed, we had been as Sodoma, and been made like unto Gomorrha

 

The concept of ‚Äú cutoff‚Äù is embedded in what was called ‚Äú the remnant ‚Äú in the OT! .

 

Jesus said the same thing but in a different way. Read it ;

Matthew 7

KJV

21+ Not every one that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my Father which is in heaven.

 

22+ Many will say to me in that day, Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in thy name? and in thy name have cast out devils? and in thy name done many wonderful works?

23+ And then will I profess unto them, I never knew you: depart from me, ye that work iniquity.

 

The ‚Äú cutoff point‚Äù forms the basis on which the above was said by Jesus. Those he referenced did not meet the cutoff! 

 

It is this very same ‚Äú cutoff ‚Äúas a criterion that Peter points to when he wrote;

1 Peter 4

KJV

17+ For the time is come that judgment must begin at the house of God: and if it first begin at us, what shall the end be of them that obey not the gospel of God?

 

The ‚Äúcutoff point‚Äù will be applied to even Christians! So please, Beloved know this, our entry or acceptance into Heaven requires that we each make the pass grade   It is not enough to attend or profess to be a church member. 

 

Do not be misled into thinking or believing that just attending and observing worship requirements is enough to earn you a place in Heaven. It takes more than these 

 

Whatever it is we must make the grade. 

1 Corinthians 10

KJV

12+ Wherefore let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he fall.

 

Job 31

KJV

6+ Let me be weighed in an even balance, that God may know mine integrity.

 

Daniel 5

KJV

27+ TEKEL; Thou art weighed in the balances, and art found wanting.

 

Read how Paul expressed it;

1 Corinthians 9

KJV

27+ But I keep under my body, and bring it into subjection: lest that by any means, when I have preached to others, I myself should be a castaway.

 

Part 2 follows!

title: Let Them Have Their Way
text:
Let Them Have Their Way 

(Part 2)

Matthew 5

KJV

 

39 But I say unto you, That ye resist not evil: but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also.

40+ And if any man will sue thee at the law, and take away thy coat, let him have thy cloke also

 

41+ And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile, go with him twain.

 

Truly speaking these are not easy requirements but are a requisite. They are part of the requirements that will enable us to obtain the pass mark. So strive to exceed the cutoff point. 

 

The bottom line here is simple have patience and exercise tolerance! Painful though these are, they are the answers to the questions that one must answer to obtain the passmark. 

 

Many are the charges and accusations that will be levelled against you falsely and ignorantly. Though you may want to respond or react; yet the requirements are ‚Äú let it be!‚Äù This is what you are reading above. 

 

Many are those who will rise against you for no justifiable reason or cause except for envy, dislike or both. These you can easily take on but you are asked to let them have their way. 

 

If you should ask why, you‚Äôll be told that to make the grade for Heaven these are part of the questions you must answer and answer correctly. 

 

They form part of section B, section A has to do with church attendance and participating in the worship, which the majority will score high marks. Section B are the toughest section and requirements! 

 

So do everything possible to secure the passmark. There is a cutoff point make sure to cross it. The examples I‚Äôve cited in part one ( Part 1) should remind you of the need to go beyond the cutoff. 

 

Let no one deceive or mislead you, there is a cutoff mark make sure you cross it. Patience and tolerance are the key, though they‚Äôll make you look foolish yet that‚Äôs how you‚Äôll obtain the pass mark. 

 

I am learning these the hard way and feel I should share them with you! 

 

I hear someone saying ‚ÄúOh grace is the key‚Äù. Beloved grace is 70% of the passmark which has already been credited to you for free, the remaining 30% is yours to make! 

 

Have you not read this,? 

Philippians 2

KJV

12+ Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.

 

70% down payment has been made for you, top up with 30% to make the grade!

title: Our Temporal Visit!
text:
*Our Temporal Visit*
1 Chronicles 29
KJV
15+ For we are strangers before thee, and sojourners, as were all our fathers: our days on the earth are as a shadow, and there is none abiding.

Though some would want to make this place their permanent home! The truth is ‚Äú there is none abiding‚Äù  none will stay forever! . Oh! Our days on Earth are as a Shadow! Which vanishes quickly from sight.

[17] ‚Äî‚Äîlive out your time as foreigners here in reverent fear  [24] For, ‚ÄúAll people are like grass, and all their glory is like the flowers of the field; the grass withers and the flowers fall,

title: Some Were Wise
text:
Some Were Wise!

Matthew 25

KJV

2+ And five of them were wise, and five were foolish.

 

I‚Äôve often wondered how some today will take the description mentioned above, if they were those  described as ‚Äú foolish?‚Äù As we all know they will not take kindly to it even though by their deeds they are! . 

 

Yes, we see these demonstrated daily by most people! Yet we can not say it in the open but only in private! Basically to avoid ‚Äú trouble !‚Äù 

 

But what is it that made them ‚Äú foolish?‚Äù! The context provides the answer! Read it; to learn and avoid such mistakes! 

 

3 They that were foolish took their lamps, and took no oil with them:

 

Do you see? They did not plan. They did not think it through. They did not anticipate! They did not project.! They did not envisage! It was these that conferred on them the unfortunate title /description ‚Äú foolish!‚Äù! 

 

Am sure after reading these some names/friends etc came to mind! You know some just as I also do. 

 

In this category are found people with weak minds, people who accept /believe etc things on face value. People who follow some for the sake of it! People who put their trust explicitly in others without thinking for themselves.

 

In Marxist terminology, they are called the ‚Äú lumpen-proletariat ‚Äú. The working class that places its absolute trust in its leaders. 

 

If you‚Äôve ever read George Orwell‚Äôs novel ‚Äú The Animal Farm‚Äù you‚Äôll come across a horse called ‚Äú Boxer‚Äù!  Yes! He worked tirelessly because he believed in  Napoleon and the rest as always being right. Only to be disappointed in the end! 

 

Today we have the same in our fellowship, secular (political)  or divine ( church ) where some place absolute trust in leadership! Forgetting that they are also human, flesh and blood. 

 

In our case, some do this to gain favour, to be in the good books of leaders, what we would call blind followership for selfish interests' sake. Even though they see and know what is wrong they‚Äôll not speak out! 

 

These are not only ‚Äú foolish ‚Äú but also ‚Äúhypocritical‚Äù. Wherever they outnumber the wise you can be sure of failure in that setup be it secular or divine. 

 

Not only does the description /tile ‚Äúfoolish‚Äù fit the weak-minded followers, but equally fits some in leadership! Yes. These are those who play politics with the Truth by turning a blind eye to the truth! Unfortunately, there are many! 

 

Like secular leadership, these love/crave the support offered by the weak-minded in society or church; the human ‚ÄúBoxers ‚Äù Of the Animal Farm drama of George Orwell!  

 

After serving in the ministry for over half a century I have seen these unfortunate developments at work! Wherever you turn to in life, there will always be the ‚Äú five were wise and five were foolish ‚Äú! 

 

Unfortunately, the ‚Äúfoolish‚Äù we shall have with us always. 

 

My revisit to the parable, lessons I learnt these I share with you!

title: Regrets :Who Is Without One?
text:
Regrets: Who Is Without  One ? 
Matthew 26
KJV
34+ Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, That this night, before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.
74 Then began he to curse and to swear, saying, I know not the man. And immediately the cock crew.
75+ And Peter remembered the word of Jesus, which said unto him, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice. And he went out, and wept bitterly.

 

None can beat his/her chest for not having made a decision that he/she regretted thereafter! The above scripture confirms the fact that all do have regrets. This is the case of Peter! It is recorded to teach us!

 

Peter went out and wept bitterly, after which he resolved not to repeat this act. This explains why when the Chief priest and his elders  warned him and the others not to speak in the name of Jesus, he stood his ground and made this bold defiant statement   

Read it

Acts 4
KJV
18 And they called them, and commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus.
19+ But Peter and John answered and said unto them, Whether it be right in the sight of God to hearken unto you more than unto God, judge ye.

20+ For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard.


Dear reader, have your regrets in life taught you any lessons?

 

When Joseph‚Äôs brothers regretted their criminal, and hideous wrong that they committed,  they went to seek forgiveness and reconciliation! A commendable example they left us!

 

Unfortunately in our case,  we uphold our regretful mood and defend it by saying ‚Äú mak√† √† mak√†, ma y√® a ay√® may√¥‚Äù A hardening of the heart!

 

Even Judas of all people, regretted his actions and attempted to seek forgiveness but missed it!   Because he went to the wrong place, and to the wrong people  Unfortunately this is what many do!

 

Not so with the prodigal son, he knew whom he had wronged so when he regretted his actions he took steps to ask for forgiveness and to seek reconciliation. Read it;

 

Luke 15
KJV
18+ I will arise and go to my father, and will say unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and before thee,

19 And am no more worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.

 

Like the prodigal son, get up and go to the wronged, and say  ‚Äú l am no more worthy to be called your friend, take me as one of your acquaintances ‚Äú.

 

Regret, is a prick or a prompt of the conscience so listen to your conscience when it pricks or prompts you. The majority are suffering under the weight of numerous regrets.

 

You can see this through their gloomy facial mood, their joys are gone!  A once vibrant, fun-loving, loud outburst of laughter has become quiet! Yes. They are emotionally dead as their consciences continue to accuse them!

 

We can pretend but we cannot hide the truth. The effects of unattended to regrets show outwardly and the discerning can see.

 

Beloved, restore the joy you once had, anytime your conscience accuses and makes you guilty please act! Do not let them linger for long. This is the sure way to know you are in God‚Äôs good book!  

Read it,


1 John 3:19-21 
NIV
[19] This is how we know that we belong to the truth and how we set our hearts at rest in his presence: [20] If our hearts condemn us, we know that God is greater than our hearts, and he knows everything. [21] Dear friends, if our hearts do not condemn us, we have confidence before God

 

( Put the word ‚Äú conscience ‚Äú in  place of ‚Äú heart‚Äù and you‚Äôll see how unattended to regrets affect us spiritually)   Read the above again!

 

A challenge to all!  A charge to keep I have!

title: Clouds Without Rain

Clouds Without Rain

14+ Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift is like clouds and wind without rain.

 

In recent times, the weather has been very deceptive; it is full of uncertainties! There are times when it looks like it will rain, but nothing drops from the skies! At other times, it looks like the sun is going to shine, only to remain cloudy and dull! 

 

Clouds without rain are deceptive; they promise but can not deliver, and so is anyone who parades himself as somebody when, in reality, he is not.  

 

There are more talkers than there are doers, there are more armchair directors than there are movers and shakers! The failure of nations, organisations, institutions, families, churches etc is the result of having leaders whose actions are best described as ‚Äú clouds without rain‚Äù! 

 

Nations, like churches are built by doers and not talkers! Shakers and movers, visionaries, men who have climbed to the top of the Mountain as Moses did, and have seen the Promised Land, though they may not get there with us but are prepared to lay the foundation upon which the destiny of future generations will lie. 

 

These are not ‚Äú clouds without rain ‚Äúleaders but solid and refined thinkers, promise keepers, action-troopers! These are the people we need today in our quest to reach our full potential be it secular or spiritual.

 

May the Lord bless us with such people be it in the secular or in the church; because their actions shape both destinies. 

 

My thoughts to share, as I reflect on our journey so far as a nation and church!

title: Grace Found Us!
text:
Grace Found Us 

Romans 5

KJV

8+ But God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.

 

Grace influenced the planning and execution of our salvation well in advance. This is what you‚Äôve just read, our salvation was not an afterthought as some would have us believe. It was planned even before the foundations of the world were laid. 

 

This tells us what kind of Father God is to us! Good fathers are proactive, they envisage and visualise and make provisions before reality dawns 

 

Perhaps you may not understand what God did as per the verse you‚Äôve read. Read this human experience and example. 

 

I know men who at the very word ‚Äú pregnant ‚Äú from their wives begin to plan. They cut down on leisure, to save! They begin to buy basic items that will be needed by the yet-to-be-born. 

 

Any child born into such a family will say ‚ÄúGrace found me ‚Äú. My father made provisions before I was born! In like manner, God made provisions even before we ever sinned. 

 

Some have said, God did not know that Adam would sin hence putting in jeopardy His eternal plan for mankind! No. The God we worship /serve etc is all-knowing. He knows the end from the beginning. He is the Alpha and the Omega! 

 

The plan of salvation was not an afterthought, it was part of His eternal scheme, Adam‚Äôs sin did not come as a surprise to Him! 

 

Read again what the verse said ;

Romans 5

KJV

8+ But God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.

 

While we were *yet*! 

 

It was this verse that inspired the song O! The Love That Drew Salvation‚Äôs Plan! Read the words of the song ;

With regards to our salvation; Love designed it, Grace brought it down to Man, and Mercy implemented it! God tampered justice with mercy. This is all that salvation is about. This act is called Grace!

title: The Question of Transition
text:
The Question of Transition 

Job 14

KJV

14+ If a man die, shall he live again? all the days of my appointed time will I wait, till my change come.

 

‚ÄúTill my change come‚Äù, is how the writer described his transition. I was filing past the body of my late sister who was laid in state at the palace of Togbui Nyah‚Äôs-Tamakloe ( Whuti) last Saturday!

Job 14:14 NIV

Life after death was both a thought and a question that occupied the minds of the ancients, they all looked with anticipation and uncertainty to what follows hereafter.

1 Thessalonians 4

14+ For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so them also which sleep in Jesus will God bring with him.

17+ Then we which are alive and remain shall be caught up together with them in the clouds, to meet the Lord in the air: and so shall we ever be with the Lord.

18 Wherefore comfort one another with these words.

 

These words are enough to settle the question ‚Äú if a man die, will he live again ?‚Äù

 

Behold we shall live again, we shall see each other again though not in this form or shape, but we shall surely see each other. This mortal body we have shall be changed into a spiritual one!

title: The Power Of A Collective Will
text:

Matthew 18

KJV

18+ Verily I say unto you, Whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.

 

When we were teenagers we often went out seeking adventure, we ‚Äú invaded‚Äù territories that were ‚Äúno-go areas‚Äù for outsiders. Our mission was simple to ‚Äúchase the girls‚Äù in that community. 

 

Yes, you read it! Years we spent in vanity and pride, caring not that Jesus died, knowing not it was us He died at Calvary. Now we know! 

 

We knew very well that the ‚Äú area boys‚Äù would resist and fight us but we trusted in our numbers. That was Accra then, areas such as Adabraka, Osu were our targets! 

 

We go out with the mindset that our collective strengths will work wonders for us, and it did in most cases except for a few. 

 

The same mindset, the collective will; is what the above scriptures are teaching us, that whatever we wish, if we pool our spiritual strengths we shall record success because it receives Divine approval. 

 

Here is where we‚Äôve failed as a people. The foundational theology teaches that this was said to the apostles and since we are not it does not apply in our time. 

 

Yes, we are not ‚Äúapostles ‚Äú but the ‚Äúprinciple‚Äù remains the same. Pool individual spiritual resources together and you attain results as it will certainly receive Divine approval. Period! 

 

It is on this basis that we offer collective congregational prayers for the sick, the needy, the oppressed etc seeking relief and recovery for them. 

 

What we lose on earth is loosed in Heaven, what we bind is bound These scriptures inspired the all-night prayer sessions that many engaged in with resounding results! 

 

The ‚Äúspiritual poverty‚Äù of the church lies in her failure to understand this very verse of scripture! Our prayers are nothing but ‚Äú ma tra makw√®√Æ‚Äù. ‚ÄúTry and see,‚Äù it is not based on faith.

There is spiritual strength and power in the collective. Whatever they bind is bound, whatever they loosen is loosed. This is a divine privilege that many have denounced.

23+ For verily I say unto you, That whosoever shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; and shall not doubt in his heart, but shall believe that those things which he saith shall come to pass; he shall have whatsoever he saith.

24+ Therefore I say unto you, What things soever ye desire, when ye pray, believe that ye receive them, and ye shall have them.

title: Be Careful Of This!
text:
Be Careful Of This!  

Proverbs 27

KJV

3 A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool's wrath is heavier than them both.

 

Why is it so? This was the first question that popped into my mind when I read this verse! I set out to search for ‚Äúthe why‚Äù by looking around me. 

 

My observations revealed that a fool does not know when to bring to an end any quarrel or a misunderstanding! He/she is always under the weight of a quarrel or a misunderstanding! 

 

‚ÄúStone‚Äù and ‚Äúsand‚Äù ( differences ) though heavy, yet ways are found to manage or handle them by the wise. In other words the wise know how to handle/manage differences; but not the fool! 

 

A fool is the one often described as ‚Äú w√≥n t√® gy√†√®‚Äù! Avoid these people! You can not stand their wrath! Sad, but such are some do not make friends with such persons. Their wrath lingers for a long time. 

 

A word of caution to share.

title: They Told Us!
text:
They Told Us Just, That We Didn‚Äôt Listen! 

Romans 15

KJV

4+ For whatsoever things were written aforetime were written for our learning, that we through patience and comfort of the scriptures might have hope.

 

Romans 4

KJV

23+ Now it was not written for his sake alone, that it was imputed to him;

24 But for us also, to whom it shall be imputed, if we believe on him that raised up Jesus our Lord from the dead;

 

1 Corinthians 10

KJV

11+ Now all these things happened unto them for ensamples: and they are written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the world are come.

 

I don‚Äôt know of you, after many years of reading, studying and observing I came to the conclusion that indeed ‚Äú they told us! ‚Äú

 

The Ancients,  our forerunners or forbears etc told us what we should expect or anticipate in life,  any serious student of life will admit that all they said is true. 

 

I know some successful men when interviewed, attributed their success to one source ‚Äì they listened and took the advice of their wise parents and or the elderly they were privileged to come across. 

 

I also know of some who admitted that their failure to attain greater heights was a result of not listening to the distilled wisdom of the elderly. 

 

Yes, these tell us either orally or through written autobiographies /biographies what life is all about and how they overcame challenges! 

 

Not today. Today most think  ‚Äúreinventing the spinning wheel‚Äù is a duty and will make them popular and famous! So they have no desire to listen to the elderly. 

 

Exuberance is the word used to describe such ignorant persons! Sad and unfortunately, they outnumber the wise! No wonder many are groping in darkness!  

 

Did Solomon not say there is nothing new under the Sun? So what makes you think there is? 

 

Ecclesiastes 1

KJV

9+ The thing that hath been, it is that which shall be; and that which is done is that which shall be done: and there is no new thing under the sun.

 

Ecclesiastes 3

KJV

15+ That which hath been is now; and that which is to be hath already been; and God requireth that which is past.

 

Take a closer look at the  word ‚Äú discover ‚Äú it is made up of two words ‚Äúdis and cover‚Äù to ‚Äú uncover ‚Äúwhat has been ‚Äú covered ‚Äú 

 

History teaches that Christopher Columbus ‚Äúdiscovered ‚Äú America! Mungo Park ‚Äú discovered the River Niger! Does it mean that before they got there these were not in existence? They were, they only made known to a bigger audience what was already there. 

 

To ‚Äú invent ‚Äú is not the same as to ‚Äú discover !‚Äù 

 

Growing up, before I read it from  books, I was told ‚ÄúAnyone who serves a great man, is preparing himself for future greatness !‚Äù This I later found to be true in life. 

 

So what is the point? Give heed to what a wise elderly person tells you. They will enrich your life and make you stand tall among your contemporaries. 

 

Yes, they told us! And they are still telling us but who is listening? 

 

A word to the wise

title: Value What You Have
text:
Value What You Have

Matthew 13

KJV

45 Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls:

46+ Who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had, and bought it.

 

There are various means by which we come  into riches ! Some inherit it, others search for and work for it! How we value or cherish things depends on how we come by them.

 

The same applies to how we come by friends, some accidentally meet, others deliberately seek out a person to be his/her friend. 

 

Like riches,  how you come by a friend is seen through how you treat or value him/her. If someone you call a friend treats you casually, know that he/she never looked for you. He/she does not desire you as a friend. To him, you are an acquaintance and not a friend. 

 

There is nothing wrong with being an acquaintance, it is a relationship; just that it is a low-level relationship.  And take note, low-level relationships come with low-level commitments! Do not expect much from such a relationship.  

 

On the other hand, a friendship that is treasured and highly valued is seen through the treatment one receives. 

 

It is a relationship of high commitment to each other. Read this example, 

Ruth 1

KJV

16+ And Ruth said, Intreat me not to leave thee, or to return from following after thee: for whither thou goest, I will go; and where thou lodgest, I will lodge: thy people shall be my people, and thy God my God:

 

17 Where thou diest, will I die, and there will I be buried: the Lord do so to me, and more also, if ought but death part thee and me.

 

Do you see the difference?

 

Is it not in affliction or in adversity that we know who our true friends are? No wonder Naomi treasured and valued Ruth, a relationship that God used to bring the Saviour into the World! Reads it; 

 

Ruth 4

KJV

17 And the women her neighbours gave it a name, saying, There is a son born to Naomi; and they called his name Obed: he is the father of Jesse, the father of David.

 

So now we know, how some treat you indicates your status and how he/she rate your relationship! An acquaintance or a friend, casual or real. One loves in words the other in deeds. 

 

1 John 3

KJV

18+ My little children, let us not love in word, neither in tongue; but in deed and in truth.

 

An acquaintance loves in words, but a friend loves in deeds! Beloved, there are more acquaintances than there are friends in the world so value and cherish those you have as friend. 

 

Do not make this mistake that many have made by misconstruing an acquaintance for a friend only to regret it later. Have you not heard/experienced someone you regard as a friend denying you? 

 

It is better to have fewer friends than many who are acquaintances. 

 

A word to the wise!

title: Timing Of Death: An Unexplained Mystery
text:
Timing Of Death: An Unexplained Mystery 

John 9

KJV

4+ I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day: the night cometh, when no man can work.

 

These are the words that fell from the lips of Jesus which highlighted the priority He gave to the use of time. 

 

In the context, he was asked by the disciples irrelevant questions! They saw a blind man and then suddenly engaged themselves in fault-finding. Just like some do today.  

 

Read it 

John 9

KJV

1 And as Jesus passed by, he saw a man which was blind from his birth.

2+ And his disciples asked him, saying, Master, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?

 

Oh! How we engage ourselves in the irrelevant, and by so doing waste precious time debating and arguing! Not so with Jesus. Anyone who knows he has limited time to stay here does not spend time unwisely. Nor does he /she fellowship with time-wasters.

 

Hear Jesus again;

John 9

KJV

4+ I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day: the night cometh, when no man can work.

 

There have been times when some have engaged me in the ‚Äúirrelevancies‚Äù of life! Issues and questions that lack substance! I am not alone in this   I guess you‚Äôve also experienced the same! 

 

Beloved, the clock set on our lives is ticking and the Lord knew this hence the statement. It is easy to be distracted from goals and objectives which is what pleases Satan. 

 

Be very discerning, there are weightier matters of life focus on them. 

 

Every man/woman transitions this life after he/she has finished his/her allotted time! When our divine mission and purpose here is completed that‚Äôs when we transition. No matter our age at the time. 

 

There is a ‚Äú divine ‚Äú mission and purpose just as there is a ‚Äúsecular‚Äù assigned. Both may or may not be the same! Whichever it is, once you‚Äôve finished your ‚Äú divine ‚Äú mission you‚Äôll be recalled. 

 

It may be that you‚Äôve finished the ‚Äú divine‚Äù but not the ‚Äú secular ‚Äú Here is where the difficulty lies in accepting the death of some. 

 

When a person dies in his/her prime it is felt badly and we often hear say he/she have not lived a full life. We say this because we are looking at the ‚Äú secular ‚Äú ( not the divine) mission on which he/she has embarked! 

 

Jesus died at the age of 33, one of the last words he spoke on the Cross was ‚Äú It is finished‚Äù. This is with reference to His ‚Äúdivine‚Äù mission yet to many it was a big blow to a young man and his family. 

 

According to  ‚Äú secular ‚Äú mission thinkers , he did not accomplish much ! His life was shortened. But to God, ( divine) He lived His fullest. So yes, it is not about the secular but the divine mission and purpose 

 

I was inspired to write this as a result of a conversation/question etc; a sister had with me. When your divine mission is over, regardless of the secular, regardless of age etc; you‚Äôll be recalled. 

 

So like Jesus; please remind yourself ; 

John 9

KJV

4+ I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day: the night cometh, when no man can work.

 

Be wise!

title: The Trumpet Call: A Communication Challenge
text:
The Trumpet Call: A Communication Challenge 

1 Corinthians 14

KJV

8+ For if the trumpet give an uncertain sound, who shall prepare himself to the battle?

 

Before the invention of radio, phones, telegraph etc the standard item used in communicating was the trumpet. To this day some institutions like the military do use it. 

 

Messages are encoded and every sound of the trumpet is distinct, none is alike it takes a trained ear to decode each sound and act accordingly! A long, medium or short blow or blast means something. 

Judges 3

KJV

27+ And it came to pass, when he was come, that he blew a trumpet in the mountain of Ephraim, and the children of Israel went down with him from the mount, and he before them.

 

1 Samuel 13

KJV

3+ And Jonathan smote the garrison of the Philistines that was in Geba, and the Philistines heard of it. And Saul blew the trumpet throughout all the land, saying, Let the Hebrews hear.

 

Sounds mean a lot to the ancient, it is only today that we do not value them. Growing up in the village, even a mere breath of whistle made with the lips meant something to the trained ear! 

 

Growing up in Accra, the same breath of sound made with the lips was used to invite girls to meet their boyfriends without the knowledge of their parents since the latter do not understand the meaning of the sound! 

 

We must start learning the meaning of sounds as we are told the second coming of Jesus will be preceded by the sound of a trumpet! Can we decode the sound we should hear? This is a great/difficult question. 

 

Before He descends physically, the trumpet sound shall be heard and those who will understand it shall gather/assemble. 

 

The two events, trumpet sound and physical descent shall not occur simultaneously, though the verses seem to suggest this, but from my point of observation, one will precede the other. There will be a duration, an interval between the two events! 

 

Read the sequence 

( first the gathering ) 

Matthew 24

KJV

31+ And he shall send his angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.

 

(OT example) 

Isaiah 27:12-13 NIV

[12] In that day the Lord will thresh from the flowing Euphrates to the Wadi of Egypt, and you, Israel, will be gathered up one by one. 

 

[13] And in that day a great trumpet will sound. Those who were perishing in Assyria and those who were exiled in Egypt will come and worship the Lord on the holy mountain in Jerusalem.

 

(The physical descent) 

1 Thessalonians 4

KJV

16 For the Lord himself shall descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trump of God: and the dead in Christ shall rise first:

 

17+ Then we which are alive and remain shall be caught up together with them in the clouds, to meet the Lord in the air: and so shall we ever be with the Lord.

 

Revelation 1

KJV

7+ Behold, he cometh with clouds; and every eye shall see him, and they also which pierced him: and all kindreds of the earth shall wail because of him. Even so, Amen.

 

May we train our ears to decode and understand the sound if it should be blasted at any time. It will be done for a certain duration to enable the ‚Äú elect‚Äù to be gathered, before the physical descent which will be a surprise to those unprepared but not the assembled!  

 

Incidentally, the ‚Äúgospel trumpet‚Äù is being sounded, and the ingathering has begun! To these people, the final sound is to announce that the time is near! 

 

My thoughts

title: Why We Disagree With Each Other : A Case Study
text:
Why We Disagree With Each Other: A Case Study 

Acts 15

KJV

39+ And the contention was so sharp between them, that they departed asunder one from the other: and so Barnabas took Mark, and sailed unto Cyprus;

 

We hardly get this incident discussed among us because of the personalities involved. They are seen as the pillars of the Movement and discussing this incident may do damage to the high esteem in which they are held. 

 

Though we all agree that it was recorded to teach us, we are simply afraid of examining it. In my view, we can discuss it from the objective point of view. Each of the two men had reasons for splitting from the other. 

 

Take a look at the scenario ;

36 And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas, Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord, and see how they do.

 

37+ And Barnabas determined to take with them John, whose surname was Mark.

38+ But Paul thought not good to take him with them, who departed from them from Pamphylia, and went not with them to the work.

 

Firstly, they were united on the fact that there was the need to go revisit the brethren they had brought to the faith. 

 

Secondly, the contention was about who should go with them, the Team! Barnabas felt that the Team should be made up of the original members. 

 

His reason(s) may be that these are men who already have some experience in mission work so they‚Äôll not need to recruit and train as if they were new members. This could take time hence delaying the scheduled time. 

 

A cogent reason!

 

Paul would likely have agreed to this suggestion of Barnabas his fellow traveller. It was the mention and inclusion of John Mark, that triggered the conflict. 

 

Paul‚Äôs argument was, No he left and returned hence there is no need to take him along‚Äù. He further asked,‚Äù bro what is the guarantee that he will not repeat the same act?‚Äù

 

Despite Barnabas‚Äô assurances Paul stood his ground not yielding an inch. As a result, they parted company! Now let us look at the factors that could have influenced Paul‚Äôs decision 

 

He indeed argued from facts, John Mark left to return home. Barnabas on the other hand was of the view that he could be pardoned as a ‚Äú young man‚Äù who at the time was immature!‚Äù  This is also a fact. 

 

Acts 13

KJV

5+ And when they were at Salamis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews: and they had also John to their minister.

 

13+ Now when Paul and his company loosed from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia: and John departing from them returned to Jerusalem.

 

So in matters of fact, they both were correct; the other thing that influenced their decisions was ‚Äú emotion‚Äù and this was the main cause! Yes, emotion. 

 

Factual decisions, that is decisions based on facts don‚Äôt divide, it is rather the emotional! And this is exactly what took place. Read it again;

 

Acts 15:39 NIV

[39] They had such a sharp disagreement that they parted company. Barnabas took Mark and sailed for Cyprus,

 

The decisions made by both were influenced by their respective emotions! How do I know, you may ask? After many years when tension was down and tempers cooled, Paul asked for Mark to be brought to him! Read it; 

 

2 Timothy 4

KJV

11+ Only Luke is with me. Take Mark, and bring him with thee: for he is profitable to me for the ministry.

 

Did you read this ‚Äú he is profitable to me for the ministry?‚Äù Paul‚Äôs Words. 

 

Isn‚Äôt it the same among us? Factual interpretation of scriptures does not divide us, it is our opinions ( emotional) about a verse /passage etc that divides us. Most uphold and defend their opinions despite the facts pointing to the contrary. 

 

In my line of duty, I‚Äôve encountered many such conflicts. Whereas I argue and decide based on facts, others argue and decide based on emotional considerations of issues. 

 

Unfortunately, they are able to sway many ( the emotionalists ) to believe in their emotional decisions only to regret. Both Paul and Barnabas parted company not on the facts but on emotional grounds. 

 

Anytime there is a conflict, when you trace the source you‚Äôll come to one; emotional decisions were made. Wherever and whenever emotion and not reason are high, conflicts are bound to arise! 

 

And because emotions are difficult to control and bring down conflicts in whatever form ( wars, hostilities, quarrels, division ) etc continue 

 

What makes things worse is that to every emotion there is a name and a face called ‚Äú pride and shame‚Äù. It is these two that pose the challenge, they sustain and support emotional conflicts. 

 

There is only one medication that cures them, it is called ‚Äú maturity ‚Äú. I believe Paul and Barnabas took it hence Paul‚Äôs invitation to Mark to come and join him!

 

How do I know of Barnabas? Well, John Mark definitely would have to talk things over with his ‚Äúuncle‚Äù Barnabas before accepting to join Paul. 

 

Decisions based on facts don‚Äôt divide they unite. It is decisions based on emotions that divide because they fail to see reason! 

 

This is why ‚Äú in the midst of fools, it is foolishness to be wise !‚Äù 

 

My take.

title: Justify Your Inclusion
text:
Justify Your Inclusion

Matthew 22

KJV

11+ And when the king came in to see the guests, he saw there a man which had not on a wedding garment:

 

12+ And he saith unto him, Friend, how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment? And he was speechless.

 

All received the invitation but one was thrown out. The question the king asked is ‚ÄúFriend, how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment?‚Äù 

 

As the Black Stars prepare for the World Cup many players will be invited to camp, the purpose is to select those worthy to represent the country. Anyone invited knows that the invitation does not mean he is qualified or selected. It is an opportunity to justify his inclusion. 

 

The same applies to us, our call through our obedience to the Gospel is a call-up exercise. It is up to us to justify our inclusion as Peter once admonished 

2 Peter 1

KJV

10+ Wherefore the rather, brethren, give diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if ye do these things, ye shall never fall:

 

Made your ‚Äúcalling and election sure‚Äù. Your calling is one thing and your election is another something many of us in the church have misunderstood! They think being ‚Äúcalled up‚Äù ( baptised) is all that it takes to be included. The man in the story was ‚Äú called up ‚Äú invitation was extended to him, but he thought that was all that was required. He got there only to the disqualified. Paul sounded the same warning ;

 

1 Corinthians 10

KJV

12+ Wherefore let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he fall.

 

Dear reader, be careful you don‚Äôt get to the wedding only to be denied entry. Even if you find your way in by favouritism ( though there will be none!) you‚Äôll still be identified and walked out. What we are going through today in the church is called the ‚Äújustify your inclusion‚Äù period. So play and play well else you‚Äôll be sent back. 

 

My thoughts to share

title: They Will All Not Fade
text:
*They Will All Not Fade* 
Ecclesiastes 2
KJV
16+ For there is no remembrance of the wise more than of the fool for ever; seeing that which now is in the days to come shall all be forgotten. And how dieth the wise man? as the fool.

 

I was privileged recently to come across some old pictures of some family members. The discovery was a delight as I‚Äôve only heard about them but not seen any images to connect to the stories and legends I was told.

 

Indeed, I am blessed with legendary ancestors and the discovery was a joy because,  apparently I was named after one of them as tradition demanded!!

 

What struck me and inspired this article was the various shades and conditions of the pictures. Some were bright as if they were taken recently, others were disfigured, hazy,  and not that clear. I found it difficult to recognise.

 

Then came to mind this thought, our names, contributions and exploits, how will they sound or look to those who are not privileged to see us alive? Our pictures, both in word or deed

 

Like the pictures I saw, some names will sound to hearers as if they‚Äôve met them before, others will struggle to recall them! We do the same today when some names are mentioned! Some will fade others will remain intact.

 

As an example, just look at Ghana‚Äôs history, the most popular person each generation of Ghanaians ‚Äúsees‚Äù every day is  Kwame Nkrumah! While others have faded with the passage of time only to be remembered occasionally!

 

The Truth is every name, good or bad is linked to or associated with something! What will our names be associated with? Some pictures fade others remain intact, the same will be with our names. Some will be forgotten, others will be remembered

 

‚ÄúGone but not forgotten‚Äù, let this be what your name will evoke when mentioned anywhere at any time!  Each day of our lives, we are making history how will yours be read?

 

Think on these

title: The Seemingly Disappointments Of Faith

‚Äúand confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.‚Äù

title: A Difficult But Necessary Choice
text:
A Difficult But Necessary Choice! 

Romans 12:18 

NIV

[18] If it is possible, as far as it depends on you, live at peace with everyone.

 

The complex nature of human beings among whom we walk makes obedience to this verse necessary if we must see God ! ! Provocations and vexations are many, yet we are advised to choose peace instead of quarrelling!

 

As we go through life this advice or caution must guide our steps. On my part, I find it very relevant and important to take this advice seriously because I don‚Äôt know when or where I‚Äôll take my last breath. 

 

If it should be that at the time of taking my last breath, I am at loggerheads with you and you are not around for me to seek or ask for forgiveness, then my destiny is sealed and I am doomed if God‚Äôs Word is true! 

 

This is a worrying and frightening state which must be avoided at all costs because of the consequences that await us. It was for this reason that the Holy Spirit through Paul warned us ; 

Ephesians 4:26 

NIV

[26] ‚ÄúIn your anger do not sin‚Äù: Do not let the sun go down while you are still angry,

 

God is not saying do not be angry, anger is an emotion and as humans we have emotions. Not everything said or done to us sits well. Some go contrary to our nature, our likes or dislikes which provoke us and make us angry. 

 

This is why the Holy Spirit grants us as it were, the right to be angry. But He cautions against prolonging this state of anger. The sun must not go down on it, in other words before the close of day let it go! 

 

The Holy Spirit also said through the Hebrew writer; that our failure to seek peace and live peaceably with all men shall cost us our desire and cherish reason of becoming a Christian; which is to see God. 

 

Read it 

Hebrews 12

KJV

14+ Follow peace with all men, and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord:

 

Beloved do not leave this world knowing full well you have an  ‚Äúoutstanding debt‚Äù to settle. Make sure you put your life in order before you leave, or else what you never wished for will be your reward.

title: Are We Safe? A Personal Experience
text:
Are We Safe? : A Personal Experience 

Luke 12

KJV

3+ Therefore whatsoever ye have spoken in darkness shall be heard in the light; and that which ye have spoken in the ear in closets shall be proclaimed upon the housetops.

 

We live in an era when private conversations are no longer private. Even among close friends, privacy and confidentiality are gone. We find this at workplaces, family settings, and even in the church! 

 

The above scriptures came to mind when I became a victim of circumstance. I had a private conversation with someone about a neutral issue of no consequence, only to be told by some that they were in possession of my conversation. 

 

What was most worrying was that this privately recorded conversation was played at a meeting to the hearing of many, it was the agenda for discussion! Literally, I was put on trial, convicted and sentenced in absentia! Hmmm! 

 

Do you know what the sentence was? Keep away from him!. To this day I've not finished serving 

their sentence! Yes! How long the sentence will last I don't know. Thankfully I have prepared myself for all kinds of imprisonment, be it social, economic or political! 

 

Was the Lord by His words which you‚Äôve read foretelling what we are experiencing today? I believe so!! 

 

Growing up I‚Äôve heard proverbs that cautioned us about conversations held in private. One such proverb says ‚Äú walls have ears ‚Äú. 

 

As a teenager, I took it literally and laughed it off! As I matured it hit me hard to the face on one occasion when I was told what I had told someone in private about my displeasure with some developments. Read some of my experiences. 

 

I‚Äôve been to meetings where some have dialed people outside the meeting and had their smartphones on for the other party to hear what was being said! 

 

I‚Äôve also made private calls to some who apparently had their call recording app on to record our conversation! 

 

Also on several occasions while preaching I‚Äôve had smartphones placed in front of me to record my messages! On another, Ive had my private chat messages forwarded to others unknown to me. 

 

Yes, technology, like money is neutral it is how one uses it. Just as money can be used for good or bad purposes the same is true with technology! 

 

In all things whether recorded clandestinely, or openly for positive or negative purposes say what you can stand by and confirm when confronted with them.  

 

Do not be afraid, Truth is painful but it will stand the test of time! You‚Äôll lose face and friends but these show that they are not genuine friends after all. Eat with them but use a long spoon! Yes. 

 

Where possible and practicable record yourself, keep copies of any chat or messages you‚Äôve exchanged with others. I‚Äôve had chat messages taken out of context and forwarded to someone who used them against me. 

 

Beloved, life is a perilous journey not many with whom we travel on the bus are genuine and sincere. So be careful do not trust or credit every passenger. 

 

My experiences I share with you!  

The lamentations of an elderly man, be guided.

34+ Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, That this night, before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.

 

It is through adversity that true friends are known! Peter failed his friend and Master the moment he was needed most. When Jesus told Peter this, he was, in effect, telling him that ‚Äú your test of loyalty is about to happen, and you will fail!‚Äù 

 

And who said many have not suffered a similar fate in the hands of some who professed they know or love them? 

 

Beloved, it is not all who surround us who love let alone care about us, these people are revealed through adversity. In our darkest hour, who do we have standing by us?

 

Here is where adversities are of benefit to us. Yes! If I have not fallen into hardship, need, physical, spiritual, emotional etc how would I know who among the many that surround me is a genuine person? , 

 

Adversities help us sieve the ‚Äúwheat from the chaff‚Äù, the genuine  from the fake, spurious, and counterfeit.  

 

He who stands with and by you in times of adversity is your friend! A friend in need is a friend in deed! Not a friend in word. You‚Äôll know your true friends through deeds. 

 

So, yes send condolences, express your grief etc;  but back them with deeds. A word to the wise is enough!

title: When At The Crossroad, Panic Not!
text:
When At The Crossroad, Panic Not! 

Genesis 22

KJV

6 And Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering, and laid it upon Isaac his son; and he took the fire in his hand, and a knife; and they went both of them together.

 

7 And Isaac spake unto Abraham his father, and said, My father: and he said, Here am I, my son. And he said, Behold the fire and the wood: but where is the lamb for a burnt offering?

 

8+ And Abraham said, My son, God will provide himself a lamb for a burnt offering: so they went both of them together.

 

Some have asked, did Abraham lie to Isaac or did he know God would not let him down? Was he by this answer to Isaac expressing his absolute trust, confidence and faith in God? I leave you to answer for yourself. 

 

Abraham was at the crossroads, the promised child had been born and not long he was asked to offer him as a sacrifice! It was a moment of mental agony and torment! But Abraham did not waver. Why? 

 

Let us cross-examine him, what compelling evidence did he have hence he did what he did? What stands out is faith. But what is faith? 

 

Hebrews 11

KJV

1+ Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.

 

From this definition, we know that faith is not blind but is based on ‚Äú evidence ‚Äú! But what evidence does Abraham have? To cut a long story short, he has walked with God since he left his hometown; and has experienced the hand of God in many ways so he knew the God he was dealing with! 

 

He left his fate in the hands of God! Beloved, there comes a time in life when all you can do is to leave everything in the hands of God. At the crossroads in Gethsemane Jesus left his fate in the hands of God when he said 

 

Luke 22

KJV

42+ Saying, Father, if thou be willing, remove this cup from me: nevertheless not my will, but thine, be done.

 

There comes a time when humanely speaking you‚Äôve exhausted every known answer, avenue, solution etc but still things remain the same. Like Abraham, like Jesus resign your will to God. 

 

Like Abraham you‚Äôve also walked with God for many years now, you‚Äôve known at least how in your darkest hours He brought you ‚Äúsalvation‚Äù from nowhere. Trust Him to do it again. 

 

Abraham knew what God could do, hence the answer he gave to Isaac. 

 

Genesis 22:8 NIV

[8] Abraham answered, ‚ÄúGod himself will provide the lamb for the burnt offering, my son.‚Äù And the two of them went on together.

 

When you come to the crossroads, do not panic commit the situation or circumstance to God. Stand still and watch, you‚Äôll see the hand of God moving to restore calm to your restless mind! 

 

Isaiah 26

KJV

3+ Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusteth in thee.

 

As I write I am at a crossroad, I‚Äôve done all that is possible but the situation remains unchanged I‚Äôve decided to let go so God take control. Human reasoning has a limit, where it ends that‚Äôs where faith starts. 

 

Yes, even though we walk through the valley of the shadow of death, we shall fear no evil! Greater is He who is in us than who is outside. By faith,  we like Abraham shall overcome to His glory. Panic not. 

 

Thoughts to share with you

title: The Problem With Self-Comparison
text:
The Problem with Self-Comparison 

2 Corinthians 10

KJV

12+ For we dare not make ourselves of the number, or compare ourselves with some that commend themselves: but they measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, are not wise.

 

Yes, you read it! Measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves are not wise !‚Äù 

 

Unhealthy, egoistic. Opportunistic rivalry you name it; has no place in the church of the Living God yet our assemblies are filled with these negatives. Sisters comparing themselves with themselves; brothers comparing themselves with themselves! 

 

These comparisons would have been greatly appreciated had they been in things spiritual; unfortunately, they are all in the material. 

 

The church at Corinth comes to mind when we talk about rivalry, as a result of self-comparison! The church was riddled with rivalry so much so that Paul had to step in to stop it! Today we see the same spirit manifesting itself. 

 

Regarding sisters, it is who is more beautiful, dresses more cutely than the other, and has more fans as if beauty is forever, as if the church is a fashion parade! Just look at how ‚Äúcrumbled‚Äù your face and skin look today compared with how they looked a few years ago! Yes! 

 

My dear, no matter how much makeup you put in, they rather make you look weird than real. Yes! 

 

The late AB Crentsil in his evergreen song which I often listen to titled; ‚Äú Ye W√¥ A D√® OY√®‚Äù made this remark about youthful girls who compare and boast of themselves. ‚Äú Bobby stand, back tyres are loose‚Äù. Yes! Such was many an old woman of yesterday! But how do they look today? A pale shadow! 

 

It is vain if not foolish to compare oneself to another. Everything about us is in transition, beauty fades! We are rendered valueless, as we age with time. Indeed, our greatest enemy is time! 

 

In the 70‚Äôs there was this popular song titled ‚ÄúGrowing Old‚Äù A line reads ‚Äú I wish I‚Äôll never grow old!‚Äù May we learn not to compete or compare ourselves with each other, these are vanities and create hatred and enmity. 

 

Be happy and content with who you are. You are unique there is none like you. Be proud of who you are do not trade it for who or what someone else looks like!!!  

 

As for me, I am in my own class! So you too, be in your own class, do not compare yourself with or to anybody. If you do as Paul said, you are not a wise person! 

 

In life, there will always be someone higher or lower than you. Be yourself, if some does not like or love you, simply tell them ‚Äú they can go to hell and greet the devil, you don‚Äôt give a hoot!‚Äù

 

2 Corinthians 10:12 

NIV

[12] We do not dare to classify or compare ourselves with some who commend themselves. When they measure themselves by themselves and compare themselves with themselves, they are not wise.

 

A thought.

title: Concerning Gifts And Their Uses
text:
Concerning Gifts And Their Uses! 

Psalms 21

KJV

2+ Thou hast given him his heart's desire, and hast not withholden the request of his lips. Selah.

4 He asked life of thee, and thou gavest it him, even length of days for ever and ever.

 

This morning, in a chat with a sister, we both acknowledged the day as a gift and wished each other a blessed day. But before then came the question, ‚ÄúHow do we spend a gift?‚Äù What use? 

 

How beneficial a gift is depends on us. We‚Äôve just received a gift of 24 hours! Before it expires at midnight today find out what you‚Äôve been able to do with it.  Do this with a pen in hand and paper by your side.  

 

Beloved, these are questions many have never thought of nor asked themselves! Is it not true that most don‚Äôt put to good use any gift they received? When I was a student in the UK, there were county newspapers that advertised sales of goods. Some advertisers list goods they are offering for sale as ‚Äú unwanted gift!‚Äù  Simply they don‚Äôt know what to do with them! 

 

In our case, some of the gifts we receive are left to collect dust on tables, kitchens etc. If they are clothes they are left on hangers in wardrobes unused. 

 

Today is a gift what will you do with it? What you do with it will determine your future. Remember, today is what yesterday you called tomorrow! You had plans for it, therefore put them into action today! 

 

To help you manage gifts here is what I do. Whenever I receive a gift I sit back and think about what to do with it to improve my life! I think through to find out how best the gift can help me achieve a goal-add value to my life. This is what every gift we receive should be seen and regarded. 

 

It is the proper and appropriate use of a gift that enhances life which we call a blessing. If today which is a gift will be a blessing to you then think and plan how to use it. Do this before you step out, make a list of priorities and see them through. 

 

I‚Äôve been doing this for years and I have found it extremely helpful. I therefore recommend this approach to you. Make the most out of every day. 

 

Enjoy the gift of Today. While doing so please do not forget the Giver. Pause to give Him thanks! 

 

A thought to share with you

title: Good Never Lost: In Praise Of Benefactors
text:
Good Never Lost: In Praise Of Benefactors 

Joshua 6

KJV

17+ And the city shall be accursed, even it, and all that are therein, to the Lord: only Rahab the harlot shall live, she and all that are with her in the house, because she hid the messengers that we sent.

 

Accra in the 60s and 70s had mummy trucks known then as ‚Äú trotro‚Äù which served as the means of public transportation used by many as there were not many taxis then. 

 

Almost every trotro had written on it a message; some read ‚Äú good never lost ‚Äú, ‚Äú sea never dry ‚Äú ‚Äú who say man no dey ‚Äú ‚Äú I shall return ‚Äú. Etc. Some of these messages are what we call ‚Äú kutia ‚Äú in twi! I leave the rest. 

 

But my attention was drawn to the above scriptures when I received a gift from someone I found difficult to remember, as it has been several years since we met. He took time to replay memories and finally, I got him. 

 

He told me how things I‚Äôve said and taught have brought him great blessings over the years. He has tried to reach out to me with difficulty because he does not have my contact information. 

 

Truly I was humbled to hear him recount his experiences and attributed them to things he heard and learnt from me. It was then that this trotro inscription came to mind ‚Äú good never lost!‚Äù  I don‚Äôt know if it is good English but it was very commonly used then 

 

Yes, ‚Äú good never lost‚Äù that is what happened to Rahab. The same happened to the widow of Zarephath and several others that time and space will not allow me to list. 

 

Some have sent me money, items of great value etc because of what they have benefited from me in time past. I ask God‚Äôs abundant blessings upon these benefactors. In the darkest hours of my life, these have always extended hands of grace! 

 

Yes, cast thy bread upon the waters ‚Äú is indeed true advice which if obeyed will inure to our good.  

 

These are the equivalents of the blind man who returned to thank Jesus! Like Jesus asked, so also do I ‚ÄúWhere are the nine?‚Äù It may include you the reader. 

 

Let me conclude with the popular proverb ‚ÄúThose who drink from a Well they did not dig, should never forget those who dug it‚Äù

 

Thank you to all my benefactors!
