title: How To Speak So As Not To Be Called A Liar
text:
How To Speak So As Not To Be Called A Liar

 

Ephesians 4:25

NIV

[25] Therefore each of you must put off falsehood and speak truthfully to your neighbor, for we are all members of one body.

 

A simple instruction but very difficult to obey and apply. This instruction holds the key to a fruitful social interaction among friends or brothers of the same family-church!

 

I‚Äôve listened to many speak or say things only to be called liars, which is a strong derogatory term to describe a friend or a brother! But how did it get to that point? That is what this article intends to address. 

 

We begin by asking what it means to speak ‚Äú falsely ?‚Äù It is to communicate or to speak, say things etc; without facts or evidence to support what one says. The opposite of this is to speak ‚Äú truthfully‚Äù A truthful statement is one based on facts. 

 

To speak from assumptions, to exaggerate, to speculate, to conjecture etc are all part of what can be described as speaking falsely, simply because they are not facts! 

 

Assumptions, exaggerations, speculations etc are personal commentaries; there is nothing wrong with them, everyone has the right to express their views on a matter or subject. What is wrong is to affirm them as the truth and they must be obeyed by all

 

In any case, to avoid being classified or labelled as a ‚Äúliar‚Äù when you speak from any of the above-listed, it is highly recommended that you begin your statements/presentations etc, with a ‚Äúdisclaimer‚Äù. 

 

A disclaimer stating that in‚Äù your considered view or opinion here is what you think‚Äù  Let the audience know that what you are about to say is an assumption or deduction! This will help them know and understand your conclusions as ‚Äúopinions‚Äù. 

And indeed opinions they are and not a lie or falsehood because you‚Äôve earlier issued a disclaimer. 

 

It is important to note that there are all types of ‚Äú opinions !‚Äù  We have ‚Äú learned/educated opinions ‚Äú ‚Äú unlearned/, emotional opinions‚Äù fanatical opinions ‚Äú exaggerated opinions, consistent/inconsistent opinions!  

 

Just like how Paul labelled and cautioned against entertaining some questions; maybe we may have to apply the same to some ‚Äúopinions‚Äù so we avoid entertaining /commenting on some forms /types of opinions! Read it; 

2 Timothy 2

KJV

23+ But foolish and unlearned questions avoid, knowing that they do gender strifes.

 

It is when you did not issue any disclaimer but spoke as if they were facts, when what you said is found later to be untrue that is when you are a liar, because you‚Äôve spoken falsely! 

 

If what you say, teach, etc are accepted as ‚Äú opinions ‚Äú when the real facts are known you can change your views or opinions without any difficulty! You‚Äôll win the respect of your hearers. This is maturity but where despite the facts you still hold to your ‚Äú opinions ‚Äú and proclaim them to be true then you will be labelled a liar! 

 

This, beloved is a ‚Äúdisease‚Äù that has afflicted the majority! They have taught things that are based on assumptions, opinions etc now, in the light of the facts and evidence they still hold and believe their ‚Äú opinions‚Äù to be true! 

 

An unfortunate development! 

 

What is wrong with admitting that something said/taught/believed etc in the past was wrong? One word describes such a stand or position; pride. And read ; 

Proverbs 11

KJV

2+ When pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.

 

Proverbs 16

KJV

18+ Pride goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.

 

Proverbs 18

KJV

12+ Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility.

 

Proverbs 29

KJV

23+ A man's pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.

 

Beloved, when confronted with facts and indisputable evidence may we eat our humble pie. Facts are sacred, opinions are free. In matters of faith ( facts ) unity , in matters of opinion , liberty. This 18th century

Common sense approach to unity is still valid  

 

Let each express and hold fast to his opinions, he must also allow others to do the same. None must impose his opinions on any unless he believes and shares in the same opinions! 

 

Truth unites, opinions divide. Opt for the Truth so you can unite. 

 

Ephesians 4:25

NIV

[25] Therefore each of you must put off falsehood and speak truthfully to your neighbor, for we are all members of one body.

 

My take.

title: A Memorable Excursion!
text:

I‚Äôve always tried to remember my humble roots and beginnings by using my primary school days to make my case in most of my write-ups. I do so as a tribute to the many who taught me how to read and write. Without them, you‚Äôll not read what you are reading from me! 

 

After every school holiday, we were made to write a ‚Äú composition‚Äù with the topic  ‚Äú How I spend My Holiday ‚Äú

 

Simple as it sounds but difficult to some of us! Why? Because we went nowhere, we sat here in Accra! But we were forced to write what we did anyway. 

 

Looking back, I realized this was where and when I discovered my creative writing skills that later improved with time as I climbed the educational ladder.

title: How Many People Do You Need In Life?
text:
How Many People Do You Need In Life?

Proverbs 18

KJV

24+ A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.

 

Proverbs 27

KJV

10+ Thine own friend, and thy father's friend, forsake not; neither go into thy brother's house in the day of thy calamity: for better is a neighbour that is near than a brother far off.

 

The writer of the above scriptures wrote from experience, the wise should understand and take it to heart! 

 

He is extolling the fact that you don‚Äôt need many around you to enjoy life, if in doubt ask your father who is above 60 years! It is not about how many people you have surrounding you, it is about the quality. 

 

Quality joy, quality happiness, is not a direct function of the many but the few that surround you. A man with fewer but sincere and genuine friends is better off than one with many hypocrites around

It is not about ‚Äú fans‚Äù but ‚Äú family ‚Äú Of trusted people! 

 

When I lived in England I noticed strangely though how some are passionate about keeping animals as friends. Dogs wear specially sewn cover coats, eat good food, and sleep in the same bed with their owners. 

 

Initially, I was stunned and wondered why. It was later when l threw myself wholly into the ocean of humans and saw the infighting, bickering, Envy, jealousy, gossip etc that I realized how wise these men are. 

 

Dogs and cats don‚Äôt gossip, they don‚Äôt betray their masters, they are faithful and loyal to them! . 

 

These men kept a few genuine friends with whom they shared and enjoyed their lives. They shut out noise so they can listen to quality chat and conversation. Sika mp√® ded√®! Quality enjoyment is not about noise but serenity. 

 

Have you asked why few play or watch golf while the majority play or watch football? There are differences in enjoyment! Come to think of it, when you die how many people will we need to carry your coffin? 4! 

 

To be blunt, the more people you have in your life the more problems and challenges you face. The fewer the quieter and lesser the problems and challenges! This is not selfishness but peace of mind. 

 

So, if some throws you out of their company rejoice and be thankful. Our desire is to be found in the company of a few sincere and genuine friends. If you find such people don‚Äôt let them go!  I‚Äôm looking for them! 

 

A thought.

KJV

Ob√Æ n√Æ m√≤d√®√± √† √≤b√≥ √®y√® ob√Æ ah√Æar√† kw√†‚Äù! Yes, that is what you‚Äôve just read in twi! Solomon saw and experienced it firsthand hence he wrote in his diary what you‚Äôve just read!

title: Which Time Are You Living?
text:
Which Time Are You Living? 

Matthew 6:34 NIV

[34] Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.

 

Having lived, worked and walked with many I concluded that everyone lives in one of three different times, namely the past, the present and the future. ! Some try to live in a combination of two or all three! . 

 

I‚Äôve been around some who live in the past, there is not a single conversation that the past is not either mentioned or referenced! 

(Nostalgics)

 

Then there is the group that lives as it were in the future. There is not a single chat that reference is not make to the future. You‚Äôll hear these say ‚Äú Oh next year I‚Äôll buy this or do this or that then I will look like this or that‚Äù 

 

To them it is all about the future, their twi slogan is what we‚Äôve all heard since birth ‚Äú eb√® y√® yi√® ‚Äú which never comes to be. 

( Dreamers, fantasizers)  

 

Then there is the group that live their lives on a daily basis, these take on any challenge that comes their way without dwelling on or making comparisons/references etc to the past, nor postponing to another date or time called ‚Äú future.‚Äù

( Pragmatists) 

 

Beloved, the state in which you find yourself today indicates which of the three periods listed above you are living in. Your spiritual, social, economic etc state is a function of the time you live your life. 

 

If you live in the past you‚Äôll always be frustrated and disappointed with the present so much so that you‚Äôll practically do little to nothing! 

 

If you live in the future, you‚Äôll be doing nothing concrete today but delight in daydreaming. You‚Äôll be thinking of a non-existent ‚Äúfuture‚Äù; forgetting that each day is the future! 

 

Yesterday, you called today tomorrow which is the future that has come! There is no day or month called ‚Äú future‚Äù each day, each month etc is the future. 

 

If you live in the present the chances of making things happen and thus living a satisfied life are very high. You don‚Äôt postpone nor do you look back. Each day you take the bull by the horns, if it must be done then it is today and not tomorrow.

 

What Jesus said is do not live in the future, live in the present, tackle today‚Äôs problems and challenges! If there is any tomorrow, it begins from today. 

 

It is today that lays the foundation for tomorrow! A poor foundation today will guarantee you a poor tomorrow! So focus on today so that tomorrow will take care of itself.

 

Read it again,

Matthew 6:34 NIV

[34] Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.

 

Please remember He did not say ‚Äú don‚Äôt think‚Äù but ‚Äú don‚Äôt worry ‚Äú  there is a difference! 

 

My take.

title: Memories: What I Remember
text:
Songs, Hymns Of Memory:.What I Remember! 

Proverbs 10

KJV

7+ The memory of the just is blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.

 

Memories of good people, events, occasions and times flash through our minds very often but we are too busy to pause and reflect on them! I took time to reflect on one such memory here is how I felt. 

 

I happened to visit a church a few weeks ago, and during the worship service, a few old familiar hymns were sung! These were sung continuously, and the impact and effect they had on me made me stop singing and stand still! 

 

Why? Memories of the past began to rush through my mind I started seeing faces and moods of people who were with me when these songs were sung many years ago Unfortunately, though a few are alive the majority are no more. They‚Äôve gone home! 

 

I don‚Äôt know about you, but with me, songs in general ( spiritual or secular ) bring back memories whenever I hear them played or sung. They situate me precisely in time,  place and the occasion! I often pause to relive and enjoy them. Something I highly recommend. 

 

Such occasions made me feel young and it uplifts my spirit! 

 

There is a Ghanaian version of Handel‚Äôs messiah which we called locally ‚Äú Hallelujah chorus‚Äù which was popularly sung in the 80s! When I hear it sung today (though a pale shadow of itself,) it brings back sweet memories of fellowship! 

 

I feel the same when I hear some of the secular pop songs of the ‚Äò60s and ‚Äò70s they take me back to my youthful days. 

 

The likes of Otis Redding,( I‚Äôve Got Dreams!) Sam Cooke ( Chain Gang) Percy Sledge ( When A Man Loves A Woman) Wilson Pickett ( Midnight Hour) James Brown ( Papa‚Äôs Got A Brand New Bag) etc. not forgetting ABBA ( Super Trouper 80s) 

 

Songs, hymns etc, be they spiritual or secular bring back memories I shared with friends I hope the same applies to you. They help revive and renew bonds of friendship long forgotten! I remember picking up my phone to call a friend after hearing an old song we both enjoyed in our youth! 

 

So next time you hear a hymn or song let it remind you of the friendship, joy and happiness we shared sometime ago. The good times we shared, the love and admiration we had for each other before misunderstandings and foolishness ‚Äú parted us‚Äù Yes! 

 

Let us do this as quickly as we can because our departure time is here! Soon our flight will be announced, how prepared are we? 

 

I conclude with what Paul wrote;

Romans 8:35,37-39 

NIV

[35] Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall trouble or hardship or persecution or famine or nakedness or danger or sword? 

 

[37] No, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him who loved us.

 

[38] For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers, 

 

[39] neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

 

Let nothing separate us, remember the good old days and times we shared! The fun, the laughter, the journeys we took together, the rides, the food we shared as we ate together. 

 

O! Memories! Let us relive them. 

 

A thought to share

title: Comforting And Consoling Words: They Are Not Solutions
text:
Comforting And Consoling Words: They Are Not Solutions
James 2
KJV
15+ If a brother or sister be naked, and destitute of daily food,
16 And one of you say unto them, Depart in peace, be ye warmed and filled; notwithstanding ye give them not those things which are needful to the body; what doth it profit?

 

I was having a conversation with someone about an article I wrote on ‚Äúcondolences. ‚ÄúIn that article, I made the point that ‚Äúcondolences ‚Äú are mere words expressing the wishes and thoughts of the sender. They are not solutions to the challenges faced by the bereaved.

 

The thoughts I expressed are what James has also captured in the verses you‚Äôve just read! Comforting and consoling words are not the solution to any problem, need, or challenge faced by anybody!

 

They are what they are ‚Äú comforting and consoling!‚ÄùWords. 

 

What James is saying is, to put it bluntly ‚Äú Words don‚Äôt fill the stomach of a hungry man, Words don‚Äôt put cloth on a naked man!

 

Yes, Words have their time and place, they act as ‚Äú soothing balm ‚Äú to a wounded person but are not the cure. It is like saying ‚Äú I am sorry ‚Äú to someone you‚Äôve hurt or wronged. As I‚Äôve written before, sorry does not heal or correct the wrong it only soothes the pain inflicted by the wrong done.

 

Beloved it is important we draw the line between words and actions. Actions we are told, speak louder than words. This is not to say words don‚Äôt ‚Äú speak‚Äù they do, but ‚Äúactions‚Äù speak much louder, and it is the loudest sound that people hear and pay attention to.

 

Many a time, members bring their requests /problems/challenges etc to the church, seeking solutions; all they get is ‚Äú comforting and consoling Words ‚Äúthese are expressed or communicated through prayers!

 

This is the very scene James described above, he probably may have observed a congregation  at a midweek prayer session! Two members stood up to mention their needs or predicaments. 
And as usual, brother Q was asked to pray for them! And it ended there!

 

Brethren in Christ,  let us wake up to the Realities Of Truth, there are many suffering from the disappointments we have inflicted on them by only speaking ‚Äú comforting and consoling ‚Äú Words To Them in their hour of need devoid of any action whatsoever

 

A concern to raise! A solution to share! A charge to keep I have. My calling to fulfil. 

 

He who hath ears to hear let him hear! Soon we shall all stand in the witness box to be cross-examined, so put your Acts together.

title: Stunted Spiritual Growth: A Worry!
text:
Stunted Spiritual Growth: A Worry! 

2 Peter 3

KJV

18+ But grow in grace, and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. To him be glory both now and for ever. Amen.

 

I came across some frightening images while watching some medical documentaries on human developmental stages. I saw pictures of children whose body shapes do not match their age. I was told it is called ‚Äú stunted growth‚Äù. It frightened me to be honest! 

 

While pondering over these frightening images my thoughts settled on similar people I‚Äôve come across in the fellowship! Yes! 

 

Some of the causes of the stunted growth I learnt from the documentary are malnutrition! I noticed the same as the cause of the stunted growth of some in the church. Lacking proper spiritual nutrition.

 

These are those who have been in the church for years yet their attitudes, utterances etc do not match their years in the church. Stunted spiritual growth is a subtle disease that afflicts those who do not pay attention to their spiritual health. 

 

Peter exhorted the  newly baptized to pay attention to their growth, especially the diet they should take ; 

 

1 Peter 2

KJV

2+ As newborn babes, desire the sincere milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby:

 

Paul showed the way by feeding the newly established Corinthian brethren with milk; hoping that they would mature and transition to taking solid food, He was disappointed; read what he said to them; 

1 Corinthians 3

KJV

1 And I, brethren, could not speak unto you as unto spiritual, but as unto carnal, even as unto babes in Christ.

2+ I have fed you with milk, and not with meat: for hitherto ye were not able to bear it, neither yet now are ye able.

 

The Hebrew writer faced a similar situation; read his observation;

Hebrews 5

KJV

12+ For when for the time ye ought to be teachers, ye have need that one teach you again which be the first principles of the oracles of God; and are become such as have need of milk, and not of strong meat.

 

13 For every one that useth milk is unskilful in the word of righteousness: for he is a babe.

 

14+ But strong meat belongeth to them that are of full age, even those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern both good and evil.

 

He therefore challenged them,

Hebrews 6:1 

NIV

[1] Therefore let us move beyond the elementary teachings about Christ and be taken forward to maturity, not laying again the foundation of repentance from acts that lead to death, and of faith in God,

 

Stunted growth can be found in the church which is a worry. People whose years of being in the church do not reflect in their attitudes and utterances. Of greater worry and concern is that he holds office in the church! 

 

Are you one of these?

title: The One Week Celebration Dilemma: Is It Scriptural Or Not? My Take
text:
The One Week Celebration Dilemma: Is It Scriptural Or Not? My Take 

Romans 14

KJV

23 And he that doubteth is damned if he eat, because he eateth not of faith: for whatsoever is not of faith is sin.

 

Why this subject should worry or be of concern beats the imagination! Here is an Event that did not originate with or from the Bible! It is not a biblical creation but that of society. 

 

It did not originate from scripture but from society like all other non-biblical events that we see around it is a matter of choice to observe it or not. We are challenged as it were to think for ourselves in things that are not explicitly stated. Each has discretionary powers; use them;

 

1 Corinthians 6

KJV

12+ All things are lawful unto me, but all things are not expedient: all things are lawful for me, but I will not be brought under the power of any.

 

1 Corinthians 10

KJV

23+ All things are lawful for me, but all things are not expedient: all things are lawful for me, but all things edify not.

 

The question to ask is, is there anything biblically evil ( sinful) about it? If so this should be pointed out to help others know so they keep away from it. 

 

This is a subject matter that can not be settled by emotions, but by facts. If any has objections he should state them and cite the relevant scriptures! It is the Bible that settles every question, debate etc, and not emotions, not our likes dislikes or preferences! 

 

Keep in mind that where there is no law there is no sin. 

Romans 5

KJV

13+ (For until the law sin was in the world: but sin is not imputed when there is no law.

 

For a one-week observance to be a sin, the law prohibiting it must be quoted. Reference to any non-historical church precedents as reasons against it does not hold. It does not make an act sinful! Let the Bible speak! Let the Bible says so! 

 

Did the NT Churches observe a one-week event? We don‚Äôt know, it is not a religious event but social. It has nothing to do with salvation! Surely there will be a social arrangement regarding deaths or funerals just that they do not form part of matters concerning salvation! If they are a would have read it from the pages of Holy Scriptures 

 

There is simply none. Salvation has nothing to do with observing or not observing. It is a matter of conscience. If your conscience tells you it is a sin don‚Äôt attend. And if you don‚Äôt, do not criticize those who do for you have no biblical book chapter or verse to support your stand. 

 

Come to think of it! What is wrong if a secular family invites believers to come join them in mourning a deceased member of their family who incidentally happens to be a member of the Christian family? 

 

Don‚Äôt forget every member belongs to two families, the physical and the spiritual. 

 

A one-week observance is a family/friends affair, it is a loose social gathering anybody can attend if he/she is interested. 

 

Any invitation to the church as a body should be treated as voluntary and not a mandatory demand or request. As a church you can refuse to honor it if there is sufficient biblical evidence to show that it is sinful! 

 

The choice is yours. If you refuse to attend give biblical reasons why you can not join them as a Church You can choose not to attend as a church ( collective ) but as individuals! It may sound contradictory but such is the reality. 

 

If you are a leader and you do not want to attend, that is you ; remember that the church does not belong to you but to Christ. You are a caretaker look into His constitution ( Bible) and quote the relevant laws /rules etc that He has given which forbid your participation as a church. 

 

If you find any such law /rule politely and respectfully notify in writing or word the family why as a Church you are unable to participate! 

 

Let not your argument be, It has not been done before, there is always a first time for doing something! Instead, show by the Bible and not your congregation‚Äôs history that the event is sinful. Sin is not what man thinks but what God says. 

 

It is sin that displeases God and will take us to hell not our opinions, likes or dislikes. Stay away if an act is sinful according to the scriptures. 

 

A one-week observance is not scriptural, it is not mentioned in the Bible. It originated from society. The Bible is silent on both its origin and observance therefore to observe it or not is a matter of choice. It is one of the numerous daily decisions we make concerning things we do which are not written in the Bible. 

 

Every choice or decision has its consequences it is up to the individual to convince himself and be prepared for any backlash be it good or bad. 

 

Arguments in favour of participating are stronger than not participating. Ask these questions When a church attends what does she do? What role is she assigned? Is it not to pray and to preach? Are we not commanded to pray for all men? Are we not tasked to preach the Word to all men everywhere at anytime etc? 

 

1 Timothy 2

KJV

1 I exhort therefore, that, first of all, supplications, prayers, intercessions, and giving of thanks, be made for all men;

 

2 Timothy 4

KJV

2+ Preach the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine.

 

We are constantly looking for opportunities to preach and teach the Word, we program a house-to-house evangelism   Most of the doors we knock are closed to us, lo and behold here is an opportunity where many have voluntarily assembled at no effort or cost to you. A free time slot is given to you to speak. 

 

You are invited to come share the Word with them; and you are saying the arrangement is not biblical so you‚Äôll not go! Oh oh!!!  Please think again and think spiritually! 

 

Some have argued, oh they will play secular songs and drink alcohol etc. Is that your business? Will you be judged by what they do? Did they serve you with any and if they did; did you take it? Do you not know that your open rejection is a practical demonstration of your faith? Practical Christianity. 

 

Have you not heard before that at some of such gatherings the conduct of the church demonstrated through non-instrumental singing, the teaching of the truth etc won souls to Christ? Why can‚Äôt we for once think of the positive gains that can be made more than the negative ones? 

 

A proverb came to mind as I pen these words ‚Äú it says there are bones in every fish, yet we eat them without being choked !‚Äù we do this by being meticulous, sieving out the bones from the flesh. To the majority everything is evil and must be avoided, so a one-week observation is evil. 

 

I have more to write but this is enough to state my position! If you are not in favour, I urge you to write your own. It was Chinua Achebe who said ‚Äú if someone writes something you don‚Äôt agree with, write your own!‚Äù instead of complaining, calling or labelling him! 

 

My take

title: Guard Your Entrances !
text:
Guard Your Entrances!  

1 John 2

KJV

16+ For all that is in the world, the lust of the flesh, and the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, is not of the Father, but is of the world.

 

In recent times many buildings looked like fortresses, with high walls,  electric fences and cctv cameras etc at entrances visitors have to ring the entrance bell and identify themselves before being allowed to enter. 

 

The purpose is to ward off undesirables and social nuisances  Every man has become security-conscious and that is commendable! One would have wished the same to be extended to the person, our personal safety and security!

 

Unfortunately these we have neglected which have been a source and cause of many a problem that has engulfed us. 

 

Do you know that there are four (4) main entrances ( physically ) to every human being? These are the eyes, nose, mouth and ears. Yes! Three ( ears, eyes and nose ) are inward entrances one ( mouth, tongue, ) is outward bound, but occasionally can be an inward bound entrance. 

 

Every second these entrances received several knocks seeking permission to either enter or go out. 

 

Except for the mouth, the eyes see many things every second, all attractive, luring etc wanting to be part of ( visit ) us. If the mind allows, it proceeds The same happens with the ears, and the nose! 

 

Many things are being said true, false, gossip, rumour, lies, etc; and the ears pick all, how the mind processes them is the challenge! What guard /barrier we erect at the entrances determines the direction our lives go. 

 

All four (4) entrances to our mind are always under siege so guard these entrances. Many who have left them unattended to are in serious trouble with their lives. The evidence is there for all to see. 

 

Read a few recommendations and be guided; 

Proverbs 21

KJV

23+ Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.

 

Proverbs 13

KJV

3+ He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: but he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.

 

Proverbs 12

KJV

13+ The wicked is snared by the transgression of his lips: but the just shall come out of trouble.

 

Job 29

KJV

11 When the ear heard me, then it blessed me; and when the eye saw me, it gave witness to me:

 

Job 34

KJV

3+ For the ear trieth words, as the mouth tasteth meat.

 

Proverbs 15

KJV

31+ The ear that heareth the reproof of life abideth among the wise.

 

Set a guard over your mouth to regulate what goes out from it. 

 

Set a guard over your ears, to regulate what comes through them 

 

Set a guard over your eyes to regulate what it focuses on! 

 

Set a guard over your nose to regulate /discern the scent it breathes! 

 

These are not child‚Äôs play they require diligence and constant monitoring! Erect barriers to guard their entrances, this will guarantee you peaceful living, though occasionally you‚Äôll make mistakes ( lower guards ) it will not affect much.  

 

My observations as I went for a walk this morning! High walls, electric fences and entrance bells! All meant to keep away undesirables! Do something similar to yourself. Personal safety guard your eyes, mouth, ears and nose.

title: Which Path Have You Chosen?
text:
Which Path Have You Chosen? 

Proverbs 4:25-27 

NIV

[25] Let your eyes look straight ahead; fix your gaze directly before you. [26] Give careful thought to the paths for your feet and be steadfast in all your ways. [27] Do not turn to the right or the left; keep your foot from evil.

 

The above words form the bedrock of the life of any principled person! A conscientious person is focused, he does not look to the left or right. He fixes his gaze directly on what is at stake. 

 

He wants answers, he does not repeat questions he wants results he does not beat around the bush    He is a pragmatist, to him it is what works that matters. Solutions 

 

He knows how dangerous distractions and distractors can be so he will not look either way nor listen to what is nothing but mere ‚Äútheoretical noise‚Äù! 

 

What is  next is he weighs carefully the paths he trod, as the writer said ‚Äú Give careful thought to the paths for your feet and be steadfast in all your ways.‚Äù

 

The problem many have had is the failure to give careful thought or consideration to issues before concluding. Weigh the issues, convince yourself of what is true and right then take your stand. 

 

A principled person is not admired nor appreciated by many because he does not bend the rules, nor does he massage the truth. He is more often a loner. To choose this path in life you‚Äôll make more enemies than friends! Even Jesus. 

 

This is a price every principled person has to pay. Joseph paid it, Moses paid it, Jesus paid it. Any man who stands in the way to prevent wrongdoing will pay this price. 

 

Paul said it;

2 Timothy 3

KJV

12+ Yea, and all that will live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution.

 

To ‚Äúlive godly in Christ Jesus ‚Äú is to simply uphold the principles of truth and uprightness regardless! So what path have you chosen for your feet? 

 

There are the broad and narrow paths, and each one of us is walking on one! Always examine your ways to see which path you‚Äôve chosen for your feet. 

 

These thoughts came to mind when I found myself among a group that does not uphold principles, but delights rather in pleasing everyone! Good ‚Äúimage‚Äù at the expense of truth is what matters to them.  

 

A thought and an experience to share

title: Constancy And Consistency: A Must
text:
Constancy And Consistency: A Must 

Hebrews 3

KJV

13+ But exhort one another daily, while it is called To day; lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.

 

Some have asked why we preach and teach the Word at every assembling of the saints, why we encourage members to read portions of the scriptures privately every day, why we should include portions of the scriptures in letters, brochures ( funeral, weddings etc) etc to friends  

 

The reason is what you‚Äôve just read; reread it! 

Hebrews 3

KJV

12 Take heed, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief, in departing from the living God.

13+ But exhort one another daily, while it is called To day; lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.

 

Dear reader, you‚Äôll agree that it is easy to forget things we don‚Äôt use regularly. Just remember how you struggled to remember a name, a word, a dialect, etc things you knew off hand before. Yes, the effect of irregular use! 

 

For example in the 70s, when I lived and worked in Tamale I could speak and express myself in Dagbani, however after leaving the area for many years I  lost control and command of the dialect. Sad. 
 

Constancy and consistency are the keys to remembering everything we know. In our case, the Hebrew writer says our failure to  remind ourselves of the Word of God will lead us into a spiritual disaster 

 

The word of God therefore is the believer's vaccine we must take a dose each day to keep the disease called ‚Äúsin ‚Äú from attacking our souls. Failure to do this opens us up to sin to knock us down! 

 

Read how the Hebrew writer puts it ‚Äúexhort one another daily, while it is called To day; lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.‚Äù 

 

A dose a day of the Word does wonders spiritually! Every Sunday what we receive from the pulpit is a ‚Äúbooster dose‚Äù designed to keep our immune levels high throughout the week! 

 

Follow this recommended approach to get the most from the spiritual vaccine, the Word of God! 

 

To be ‚Äúsin-free‚Äù take a dose of the Word of God daily preferably before breakfast; the first thing after waking up from bed. Do it on an empty mind, when the mind is fresh and free from worry, stress etc

 

It is also recommended that for best results, after taking the vaccine you sit for a few minutes to let it settle in your mind! ( meditate) ! 

 

Do this at a time when there is no noise to cause distraction, pick no calls make no calls, read no text messages! These if done before taking the vaccine will render it ineffective as they distort the state of the mind. 

 

To help enrich the vaccine‚Äôs effect on the heart /mind, hum or sing a song /hymn this is a choice and not a rule. After which pause and simply say ‚Äú Thank You Lord for yet another Day !‚Äù Be constant and consistent and you‚Äôll never regret! Do it now! 

 

Thoughts to share hope it helps.

title: Turbulence In Life: A Personal Confession!
text:
Turbulence In Life: A Personal Confession! 

Luke 8

KJV

23 But as they sailed he fell asleep: and there came down a storm of wind on the lake; and they were filled with water, and were in jeopardy.

 

Every life is like a boat sailing on a turbulent sea. Depending on which part of the world you live in, the storms may be strong or mild, but they are storms. 

 

From the above scene, we need to understand that though we have the Lord with,  and on our side, we shall not be spared the effects of the storms of life! As Christians, we are not immune to the hardships and frustrations associated with life

 

The disciples we are told ‚Äú were in jeopardy ‚Äú the same we experience in the face of ‚Äústorms‚Äù But what does it mean to be in ‚Äú jeopardy?‚Äù It means ‚Äúto be at risk or threatened with serious harm, death, or damage‚Äù

 

It is a state or condition that creates anxiety, hopelessness and helplessness; have you not ever experienced this before? Oh, I have on many occasions! Read my confessions!!

 

Beloved, this brings to mind the question posed by the hymn writer ‚ÄúWill your anchor hold in the storms of life ?‚Äù  Hear Him; 

 

‚ÄúWill your anchor hold in the storms of life, when the clouds unfold their wings of strife?

When the strong tides lift, and the cables strain, will your anchor drift, or firm remain?‚Äù

 

Oh yes, there have been times when my ‚Äúanchor of faith‚Äù in friends failed me at the most critical moments! When the strong tides of disappointments and frustrations lifted and my emotions were low, I needed just a touch of Hope and a pat on the shoulder! There my ‚Äú anchors ‚Äú failed me. 

 

Anchor here can be anything you trust and believe can deliver you in times of distress. It could be friends, family,  church members, colleagues at work, children, husband or wife etc.. 

 

Yes, on many occasions my anchor of faith in friends has come under stress when the clouds of mistrust unfolded themselves and engulfed me. When lies and falsehood are peddled freely like toffee! Trusted friends ( anchors!)  deserted me! Yes! 

 

Hope was gone and I was nearly swept away. There was none to hold on to, the majority of my ‚Äúanchors‚Äù failed to hold me in check and balance. Yes, this is a reality in life so watch and pray. Re-examine your anchors from time to time to be sure they will hold in time of need. 

 

In my case, it was then that a small circle of trusted friends ( anchors) took me in, extended a rope to pull me in from the brink of woe and disaster, an act similar to how Jesus calmed and stilled the storm! 

 

Yes, beloved there will be storms in our lives, our anchors shall be stretched beyond limits; some will fail to drop into the ocean of pain; but on these turbulent waves always remember how Jesus spoke and it became quiet. 

 

Trust in Him fully and the storms will pass. He is the only genuine anchor you can trust. A tried and tested anchor. 

 

My confessions! A word to the wise.

title: Times, Moments And Men!: Disposable Or Indisposable?
text:
Times, Moments And Men!: Disposable Or Indisposable? 

Esther 4:14 

NIV

[14] For if you remain silent at this time, relief and deliverance for the Jews will arise from another place, but you and your father's family will perish. And who knows but that you have come to your royal position for such a time as this?‚Äù

 

‚Äú And who knows but that you have come to your royal position for such a time as this !‚Äù

 

Great words from Mordecai to Queen Esther to remind her why she, a foreigner, was made a Queen. This was at a critical time in the lives of the exiled Jews! 

 

When the news of the extreme suffering that the exiles were going through and the need to find solutions was made known to her she initially dragged her feet until her uncle made her understand what was probably unknown to her- God has placed you here for the redemption of His people! 

 

Mordecai did not stop there he further added ‚ÄúFor if you remain silent at this time, relief and deliverance for the Jews will arise from another place,‚Äù Esther, my dear you are not indispensable! 

 

How many people see their rise to influence as God‚Äôs divine arrangement for a purpose? How many understand that whatever they possess was bestowed by God for use in His service? 

 

Have we not read what Jesus said regarding privileges? Read it; 

Luke 12

KJV

48+ ‚Äî‚Äî-‚ÄúFor unto whomsoever much is given, of him shall be much required: and to whom men have committed much, of him they will ask the more.‚Äù

 

How easy it is to forget this and act as if what or who we are is the result of our efforts therefore we owe no one anything!  Who, what or wherever we find ourselves may it be known to us that God planted us there not only for the physical but also for a divine purpose. And should we fail Him, He can raise an alternative! 

 

We see these unfold every day but fail to recognize that God is involved. These manifest themselves as ‚Äú conflicts and rivalries‚Äù It happens when a person(s) in authority acts in a way to suggest he /she is indispensable! So a rival group emerges. 

 

Though on the surface ‚Äúconflicts and rivalries‚Äù present a group with a challenge physically, yet in the spiritual realm sometimes it is the doing of the Lord. 

 

I‚Äôve seen this phenomenon unfold in many congregations when either a song‚Äôs leader, teacher, preacher, leadership etc;  etc as a result of the admiration and praise showered on him/ her becomes arrogant and develops the feeling/sense of indispensability! These act as if without them a congregation cannot function! 

 

Have you not heard of some describing a group in the same congregation as ‚Äú rival/parallel etc leaders‚Äù who must be stopped? Yes, that is a sign that God is raising an alternative to do His work! When we fail God He will raise an alternative to replace us! Period. 

 

Beloved, ‚Äúrival leadership‚Äù emerges when existing leadership fails to deliver on their mandate, and sees themselves as ‚Äú indispensable ‚Äú. We see this in politics when voters vote opposition parties into office to replace a ruling government! 

 

Have you not seen this before in your group, when hitherto unknown replacements emerge spontaneously from among the audience, mostly persons no one has ever thought could perform the functions assigned? Oh, I have! 

 

A new song leader emerges, a new bible class teacher takes up a bible class, new leadership is installed and suddenly positive results are the order of the day. Nobody is indispensable as far as God is concerned. We are disposables when our use is over. 

 

Anytime and anywhere there is a ‚Äú rivalry ‚Äú anyone exercising authority must sit up and do their own self-examination! Have I become arrogant, have I developed the mindset of being indispensable? Though not all rivalry/conflict is the doing of God, some are out of selfish ambition yet some are His doings!  

 

May we in authority or influence remind ourselves at all times that ; 

Proverbs 16

KJV

18+ Pride goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.

Proverbs 11

KJV

2+ When pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.

 

Mordecai told Esther, ‚ÄúYou are not indispensable, if you fail to act as expected of you, God will find us an alternative! ‚ÄúHear him again; 

‚ÄúFor if you remain silent at this time, relief and deliverance for the Jews will arise from another place,‚Äù

 

God can replace me, you etc so let us serve with humility and not with the feeling/sense of indispensability! 

 

A word to the wise is enough!

title: Leave No Debt Unsettled Before You Exit This Life
text:
Leave No Debt Unsettled Before You Exit This Life

Romans 13

KJV

8+ Owe no man any thing, but to love one another: for he that loveth another hath fulfilled the law.

 

Romans 13:8 

NIV

[8] Let no debt remain outstanding, except the continuing debt to love one another, for whoever loves others has fulfilled the law.

 

A few days to my mum‚Äôs death I visited her in the village ( Atorkor) we had a mum and son conversation which was full of remembrances. As I left for my car to drive away she asked me to be called back. 

 

I came and sat by her, with rapt attention to hear what she had to say. She looked at me with a smile on her face and said ‚Äú viny√® m√® g√† vavag√® akpom aleke√† o! To wit ‚ÄúMy son you‚Äôll not come to see me like this again‚Äù. 

 

In effect, she told me she‚Äôll be gone and this is my last visit! , I felt sad and bad, so I sat long with her, held her legs to massage them as I did earlier before asking to leave, she was experiencing stiff joints. 

 

We then engaged in sharing jokes, fun and we both laughed loudly! It was very difficult for me to leave. And here is her final word that touched me she said ‚ÄúMy son if after my death someone comes to tell you I owe her a debt it is not true! ‚Äú. Truly a week after my visit she passed on! 

 

Beloved, what she said was true as no one ever came to tell us our mum owed him/her after she passed away. This was 25 years ago September 6th, 2000

 

She left no debt behind which was an amazing example to me. Beloved, settle any debt you owe before you breathe your last. 

 

You may ask what debt do I owe? Debts can be classified under various headings, Ie; economic debt, social debt, etc. The ‚Äúdebt of love‚Äù is a ‚Äúsocial debt‚Äù. 

 

All debts we can settle before we pass on but the debt of Love we can not, It is a ‚Äúcontinuing debt‚Äù  A continuing debt is an obligation that some may call a ‚Äú statutory ‚Äú payment A statutory payment is a binding debt we owe and must settle whether we like it or not; and this is the debt I owe you-to love you! 

 

Here is how we pay this debt as Paul wrote;;

Colossians 3:13-14 

NIV

[13] Bear with each other and forgive one another if any of you has a grievance against someone. Forgive as the Lord forgave you.

[14] And over all these virtues put on love, which binds them all together in perfect unity.

 

Romans 12:17-18 

NIV

[17] Do not repay anyone evil for evil. Be careful to do what is right in the eyes of everyone. [18] If it is possible, as far as it depends on you, live at peace with everyone.

 

Beloved, though I owe you a debt and I am desirous to pay, your conduct and attitudes towards me can make it difficult for me to pay. If your conduct and attitudes make it impossible for me to pay then you are the cause and not me

 

Scriptures say . ‚Äú if it is possible ‚Äú but here is the case your conduct and attitudes make it ‚Äú impossible ‚Äú. Such circumstances abrogate my indebtedness to you. All I can do is to continue to show you love by following these recommendations 

 

Romans 12:20-21 

NIV

[20] On the contrary: ‚ÄúIf your enemy is hungry, feed him; if he is thirsty, give him something to drink. In doing this, you will heap burning coals on his head.‚Äù [21] Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.

 

My dying mum‚Äôs last words to me have impacted and shaped my socio/economic life till today. 

 

Thoughts to share

title: A Visit To The Scrap Yard: An Experience
text:
A Visit To The Scrapyard An Experience 

Proverbs 8

KJV

33+ Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not. 34 Blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.

 

35+ For whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of the Lord. 36+ But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death.

 

What you‚Äôve just read is what we call ‚Äú wisdom personified ‚Äú wisdom speaking as if it were a person. Please read it again 

Proverbs 8:33-36 

NIV

[33] Listen to my instruction and be wise; do not disregard it. [34] Blessed are those who listen to me, watching daily at my doors, waiting at my doorway.

 

[35] For those who find me find life and receive favor from the Lord. [36] But those who fail to find me harm themselves; all who hate me love death.‚Äù

 

Like wisdom, many wise people are crying out and calling the unwise to listen to them but to no avail. All who spurn instructions and advice in the end crash their lives! . 

 

Many years ago I used to visit a large scrapyard located on the Tema-Kpone road. I go there to look for parts to repair my damaged car. What I often see there is what I‚Äôve likened to life! 

 

Beloved, Life has scrapyards, and many lives like accident cars are in the scrapyard of life! The major fault or accident that took them there is ‚Äúcharacter flaws‚Äù. Flaws that could have been corrected had those there listened to instructions and advice as the proverb writer noted. 

 

When you visit scrapyards you‚Äôll be surprised by the types of vehicles you‚Äôll find there, expensive, good-looking looking etc cars what is most disturbing is to be told the type of accident (fault) that brought them there! 

 

All the cars there have one fault in common; ‚Äúcharacter flaws‚Äù deficient in good character!  

 

Some are slightly dented ( damaged), and can be brought back to the road; whereas others are damaged beyond repair.  

 

The same applies to us humans, some refused to listen to instructions and advice no matter what, these are the damaged beyond repair cars in the scrapyard. 

 

The slightly dented and brought back to the road are those who recognized their folly in time and traced their way back by heeding instructions and advice. 

 

Most of us belonged to the second category, we were once damaged cars in the scrapyard but the Gospel of light shone on us. 

 

Read how Paul described us; he first listed the types (character flaws /weaknesses) of cars in the scrapyard ; 

1 Corinthians 6:9-10 

NIV

[9] Or do you not know that wrongdoers will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived: Neither the sexually immoral nor idolaters nor adulterers nor men who have sex with men [10] nor thieves nor the greedy nor drunkards nor slanderers nor swindlers will inherit the kingdom of God.

 

A tall list, definitely you and I are listed among the cars in the yard! . Read what he said regarding how we were brought out. 

 

1 Corinthians 6:11 

NIV

[11] And that is what some of you were. But you were washed, you were sanctified, you were justified in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and by the Spirit of our God.

 

Our ‚Äú washing, sanctification, and justification‚Äù came as a result of our listening to instructions and advice. If we can keep these instructions and advice we shall be worthy cars and will remain on the road to Heaven! 

 

Any time you drive past a scrapyard let it remind you that you were once there but grace brought you out. 

 

Maranatha

title: Salvation Is A Package: Not A Pick And Choose Bazaar!
text:
Salvation Is A Package: Not A Pick And Choose Bazaar! 

 

Matthew 25

KJV

44 Then shall they also answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, or athirst, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not minister unto thee?

 

In a conversation with a young sister, the issue of salvation came up, and this influenced this write-up. Some members believe that they are saved because they do or observe certain practices. 

 

Practices such as regular church attendance, observance of the Lord‚Äôs supper, free will giving as against tithing, singing without the accompaniment of instruments and the like. 

 

I was ‚Äú worried ‚Äú and disturbed in spirit by what I heard as the basis for our salvation! Beloved salvation is a package, it is like a soup. Its taste is the result of the inclusion of many ingredients! 

 

The activities that make our salvation complete are in two categories, the inner and outer activities. What the lady mentioned above is the inner activities, without the outer salvation is not complete. 

 

The inner activities are done regularly whether sincerely or otherwise, only God knows. Some attend church regularly, do take the Lord‚Äôs supper alright but are very wicked and evil in heart and mind. 

 

Some break the bread, drink of the cup but harbor evil in their hearts against the next person sitting by her/him on the pew! Sundays are occasions where hypocrisy is on display! 

 

Maybe it would be better to name Sunday, ‚ÄúHypocrisy Day‚Äù. But out of reverence for the Lord, such a name may not be proper! .  

 

We see it, we know it etc but we are unable to speak! And you are telling me that just by breaking the bread and drinking the wine one is saved? 

 

Beloved , we came to this understanding because we have ‚Äú overhyped ‚Äú and ‚Äúoversimplified‚Äù the following verses 

John 6

KJV

54+ Whoso eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, hath eternal life; and I will raise him up at the last day.

56 He that eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, dwelleth in me, and I in him.

 

Truth be told these passages or practices are part of the salvation package and not a stand-alone! It is like baptism, if you are baptized and you do not lead a Christlike life will baptism alone save you? 

 

You belong to the church with a biblical name yet your life/deeds etc do not reflect that of Christ! Will the church‚Äôs name alone save you? 

 

Many have been misled into believing that there are some essentials which when done or observed salvation is guaranteed to them. Beloved, salvation is a package made up is many parts none is a stand-alone. All must be observed 

 

Those who were questioned in the lesson text did you hear mention baptism or worship? They were questioned on the externals, benevolent acts! 

 

Those who were condemned because they never practiced benevolence will surely protest their condemnation, they are like some of us who think salvation is about ‚Äú true worship‚Äù True worship is part of the package! 

 

Listen to Paul concerning love as an example ; 

1 Corinthians 13:2-3 

NIV

[2] If I have the gift of prophecy and can fathom all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have a faith that can move mountains, but do not have love, I am nothing.

 

[3] If I give all I possess to the poor and give over my body to hardship that I may boast, but do not have love, I gain nothing.

 

It is our character outside the church building and that which we display in the building both put together make us acceptable in the Lord. 

 

If you don‚Äôt make the grade/mark to Heaven please don‚Äôt say you were not told. Salvation is not a pick-and-choose buffet dinner. It is a package, you accept all or leave it! 

 

Do not be deceived into believing that what is done on Sundays is all that is required. Now you know advise yourself!

title: Answers! Answers!
text:
Answers! Answers!

Proverbs 15

KJV

1+ A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.

 

Who will say he /she never received instructions from his/her parents concerning how to answer questions?  My generation paid attention to this very subject hence quarrels and misunderstandings among associates were minimal! Not so today. 

 

At school, teachers took us through the process of how to answer questions, they told us what to do, that we should first do our best to understand the question by asking ourselves ‚ÄúWhat is it about?‚Äù 

 

(An understood question ( problem ) is half solved! )

 

After which you proceed to map out the approach. We were taught to arrange thoughts in a sequential manner such as would be understood by the Examiner Etc. 

They told us, the Examiner will not be with us to ask us what we meant by this or that so our thoughts must be clearly expressed ‚Äì clarity in thought and expression! 

 

Like examination questions, so is life, we are asked many questions by all manner of people we come across daily. The first thing to do is to identify the question, what is it about, is it about something you know or don‚Äôt know? 

 

The process of hearing ( Listening ), thinking before answering takes time and this is what James meant when he wrote ; 

James 1

KJV

19+ Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:

 

Many a relationship has collapsed because of how a question was answered. Do not rush to answer a question! Slow to speak means giving thoughts to, and being measured in what answer you give especially the words you‚Äôll use. Also of concern is the tone in which they are expressed! 

 

The passage reads ‚Äú a soft answer‚Äù which suggests that there is a ‚Äú hard /harsh answer ‚Äú. 

 

Words are categorised, we have ‚Äú soft‚Äù and ‚Äúhard or harsh ‚Äú words  Every man unconsciously carries with him/her in his/her head a dictionary and a thesaurus! We build the contents of these as we grow! 

 

Their contents are heavily influenced by the environment- home, school, workplace, social/religious gatherings etc. words we use daily are from these sources. Grow up in a healthy environment and your dictionary /thesaurus will have good (words) entries! The opposite is the same. 

 

Proverbs 15:1-2 

NIV

[1] A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger. [2] The tongue of the wise adorns knowledge, but the mouth of the fool gushes folly.

 

It is not every question one must answer, silence is Golden we are told and it is true. Be silent, if you must stay to listen to the question or walk away if this  is possible 

 

Even the Apostle Paul warned ;

2 Timothy 2

KJV

23+ But foolish and unlearned questions avoid, knowing that they do gender strifes.

 

Be careful how you answer questions! Please! 

A thought to share with you

title: Be Wise: Mind Your Own Business!
text:
Be Wise: Mind Your Own Business! 

Proverbs 26:17 

NIV

[17] Like one who grabs a stray dog by the ears is someone who rushes into a quarrel not their own.

 

As believers, we often think we must involve ourselves in everything or in everybody‚Äôs business. We think it is a sin not to do so because we read, ‚ÄúBlessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called the children of God.‚Äù 

 

Well, you‚Äôve just read some advice ‚Äú do not rush into a quarrel that is not your own!‚Äù  How do we reconcile these seemly contradictions? Which quarrel is your own and which is not? And why must you not rush into it? 

 

The above is a caution that must guide the wise in how they conduct themselves when it comes to meddling in other people‚Äôs affairs. The passage conveys the thought that there are limits to how far we can get ourselves involved in other people‚Äôs affairs. 

 

We‚Äôve all read or at least heard of the death or injury sustained by some innocent persons who tried to stop a fight between two people. Or rush into ‚Äúquarrels that are not their own !‚Äù

 

The proverb writer said, If you grab the ears of a stray dog it will definitely bite you. I tried to think through what this means by comparing how my dog behaves when I grab his ears. In my case, he remains calm and is happy. 

 

So I asked why, Well it‚Äôs because it is a trained and domesticated dog. This behavior is contrary to that of ‚Äú a stray ‚Äú dog! A domesticated dog knows and respects its master something different from what a ‚Äústray‚Äù dog will do. And so are quarrels. 

 

A dog you don‚Äôt know will not listen let alone respect you, and the same is a quarrel involving persons you don‚Äôt know! A situation which is different from that between persons you know. Remember, in settling a quarrel one brings his image and influence to bear on the combatants which can only be effective if they know him/her..

 

This is what the proverb writer is drawing attention to, do not rush into a quarrel that is not ‚Äúyour own‚Äù which means a quarrel involving people you don‚Äôt know! The consequences as he said, are what a stray dog will do to you if you hold its ears. 

 

A quarrel that is ‚Äúyour own‚Äù is a quarrel involving people you know, they will listen and respect your intervention and peace will be restored. 

 

Well, after reading the above text as a meditational passage I felt I should share my thoughts with you! It is better to be ‚Äúinvited ‚Äú than to ‚Äúrush‚Äù into a quarrel that is not your own. I accept that some situations /circumstances are exempt, but in general, let this rule be a guide. 

 

‚ÄúEvery quarrel has its ‚Äúowners‚Äù. Rush (attend) to that which is your own!‚Äù Know how to mind your own business when it comes to quarrels.

title: The Trumpet Sound: An End Time View
text:
The Trumpet Sound: An End Time View

Joel 2

KJV

1+ Blow ye the trumpet in Zion, and sound an alarm in my holy mountain: let all the inhabitants of the land tremble: for the day of the Lord cometh, for it is nigh at hand;

 

The scriptures use trumpets for several purposes, such as rallying people for war, coronating a king, summoning worshipers, etc. 

 

Of note is the distinction of the sound that the trumpet makes. Not all sounds are the same, to understand what a sound means, one must be trained. 

 

The second coming of the Lord we are told shall be preceded by the sound of a trumpet. 

But before then it appears there will first be a trumpet sound which all those who hear will be resurrected and be transformed 

 

1 Corinthians 15

KJV

51 Behold, I shew you a mystery; We shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed,

52+ In a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.

 

In the case of the Lord‚Äôs descent here is how the event is described;

1 Thessalonians 4

KJV

16+ For the Lord himself shall descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trump of God: and the dead in Christ shall rise first:

 

It lists two occurrences; these are ‚Äúwith a shout‚Äù a shout is not a sound made by a trumpet but by a human (?) ‚Äú with the voice of the archangel ‚Äú it seems this is the person who will do the ‚Äúshouting‚Äù, then follows the sound ‚Äú and with the trump of God ‚Äú

 

The ‚Äúshout‚Äù is likely to be made by the archangel, the trump of God will then blow a message both of which the ‚Äú dead in Christ ‚Äú shall hear and rise.

 

What will be said by way of the shouting we are not told. The type of sound the trumpet will make we are also not told; these are mysteries!

 

I would like to believe that both the shout and the sound the trumpet will make will be understood by the Spirit in every believer. It will be a communication between the spirits, the Holy Spirit and that which He gave us! I am sure you know you have the spirit in you! 

 

1 John 3

KJV

24+ And he that keepeth his commandments dwelleth in him, and he in him. And hereby we know that he abideth in us, by the Spirit which he hath given us.

 

When these will take place has been the subject of debate and contention among many. A careful look seems to suggest that these events will take place simultaneously, first the shout summoning the ‚Äú dead in Christ ‚Äú to rise after which follows the rest, ‚Äúthe living in Christ(?)‚Äù 

 

This is because we the living shall not ‚Äú precede‚Äù the dead in Christ. We shall have to wait for them to rise first before we join them. 

 

1 Thessalonians 4:15 

NIV

[15] According to the Lord's word, we tell you that we who are still alive, who are left until the coming of the Lord, will certainly not precede those who have fallen asleep.

 

It is important to note that time will cease to be reckoned so there is nothing like Day or night, twenty-four hours etc. Because time will cease to operate as we know it these events will therefore follow sequentially. It will not be time-based.

 

These are my opinions regarding the end-time events as I read them! They are not doctrine but opinions. You may have your own! 

 

The Redeemed of the Earth shall be summoned by a ‚Äúshout‚Äù by an archangel and a ‚Äúsound‚Äù from a trumpet both of which shall be heard and understood only by those who have the Holy Spirit in them, believers. 

 

Remember anyone who does not have the spirit of Christ in him does not belong to Him; 

Romans 8

KJV

9+ But ye are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwell in you. Now if any man have not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his.

 

The end-time communication will be a spiritual communication between spirits. To make it easier for the spirit we are marked (sealed) by God for identification purposes. 

 

Read it,

Ephesians 1

KJV

13+ In whom ye also trusted, after that ye heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation: in whom also after that ye believed, ye were sealed with that holy Spirit of promise,

 

Also, remember that at baptism you received the Holy Spirit as a Gift;

Acts 2:38

NIV

Peter replied, "Repent and be baptised, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

 

All said and done, what is important is to remain true and faithful in Christ, and leave the rest to God. 

 

Opinions to share!

title: Celebrating Lifelong Fellowship With God
text:
Celebrating Lifelong Fellowship With God

Psalms 84

KJV

10+ For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.

 

This is a well-thought-out out memorable summary statement defining the psalmist‚Äôs commitment in life. He wrote this in the latter part of his life. 

 

How do I know he wrote in the latter part of his life? Read the verse that followed; 

 

11+ For the Lord God is a sun and shield: the Lord will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.

 

These are words of experience, that only someone who has walked with God can say! They are words recommending to us how good and wise it is to spend time in fellowship with God. 

 

The writer in his early days stated his commitment to fellowship with God in these words; 

Psalms 27

KJV

4+ One thing have I desired of the Lord, that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the Lord, and to enquire in his temple.

 

Recently I visited a congregation and was glad to meet some elderly people! These have been in the church since the beginning of that congregation. They began with dark hair but when I saw them their hair had greyed! 

 

I paused and gave each of them an embrace! , the scene brought tears of joy to our eyes, as we each recalled the days gone by. We shared memories of togetherness!

 

May we learn to celebrate these men and women, before they pass on to their rewards in Heaven! Great examples, encouragement and inspirations they are to us. May we not ignore them! 

 

A Yearly appreciation program dubbed ‚ÄúA Day for the Elderly‚Äù wouldn't be bad! How about that!  

 

How many Sunday fellowships with the saints have you missed since you gave your life to Christ? Can you remember? 

 

May we also make this choice and decision of the psalmist our prayer ; 

‚ÄúOne thing have I desired of the Lord, that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life,‚Äù

 

Beloved, begin with dark hair and end with grey one. Remain steadfast and be inspired by the faith of the older generation in your church. Let their grey hair challenge you. 

 

My take on walking with God throughout our lives! I dedicate this article to the aged in our churches.

title: The Final Bow!
text:
The Final Bow

Luke 23

KJV

46+ And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice, he said, Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit: and having said thus, he gave up the ghost.

 

I remember growing up I often took part in school plays, one I remember very well was to play the role of Potiphar in the play titled ‚Äú Joseph and his brethren‚Äù  I still remember the name of the girl who played the role of Potiphar‚Äôs wife!  (1963!!)

 

At the end of every drama or play we line upstage to introduce ourselves and at a sign from our teacher we all bow to the audience, who respond with a clap. 

 

That short session where we introduced ourselves and took a bow is what we were told is called the final bow. The curtain falls to end the play. 

 

With the above words, Jesus took his final bow signifying the end of His redemptive ministry. It was the end of the chapter. This was summed up by the hymn writer ‚ÄúIt is finished was his cry now in Heaven exalted high hallelujah what a Saviour ‚Äú

 

When you should take your ‚Äúfinal bow‚Äù what will you say? Jesus said ‚ÄúIt is finished ‚ÄúFather into thy hands I commend my spirit ‚Äú what will yours be? 

 

Beloved it would be a privilege and a blessing to be able to bow out with the strength to say a few words. Not many have been able to do that. Most, if not the majority never had the opportunity to say a final goodbye to dear ones. 

 

At many funerals that I‚Äôve attended, there is a phrase that runs through the tributes that are read, it goes like this ‚ÄúYour departure was so sudden, you did not say goodbye to us !‚Äù ‚ÄúHow we wish you did ‚Äú. 

 

Nothing is more painful than to lose a loved one who said nothing to you before they took his/her final bow! Beloved do not let the curtain of your life drop without first saying a word to loved ones! 

 

The son of my next-door neighbour told me he was at the bedside of his father before he passed. 

 

He said his father knowing that his time of departure had come beckoned him to come to the bedside; he said his father placed his hands on him, grabbed /held him tightly to himself and bade him farewell! 

 

In the process of holding him tightly to himself, he passed away! That was his final bow! He departed this life in such a manner. 

 

Who will surround you when you are about to take your final bow? Will your wife/husband/children etc be there? And what will be your Final Words? If you do not have any, then start composing one today! 

 

We shall all take our final bow one day, since we are presently on stage and are mere actors. We had our entry and so shall we have our exit when our part of the drama is over. 

 

Prepare your final words for soon you‚Äôll make your final bow! Mine will be ‚Äú peace I leave with you ‚Äú ! Jesus said, ‚ÄúFather into your hands I commend my spirit ‚Äú. 

 

My take on the ‚Äúfinal bow‚Äù that awaits us!

title: Death Levels !
text:
Death Levels! . 

Isaiah 53

KJV

9+ And he made his grave with the wicked, and with the rich in his death; because he had done no violence, neither was any deceit in his mouth.

 

Do you know that every cemetery is a city of its own with ‚Äú residents ‚Äú  from all walks of life? From presidents to messengers, CEO‚Äôs to cleaners, rich and poor, young and old, professors and jhs leavers, each has a plot and shelter over his/her body. None is lacking anything. 

 

What a wonderful city, it is also the richest city on earth for the total wealth of its residents is more than that of the living! It has the highest per capita income in every country. Yes, that‚Äôs the city called ‚Äú cemetery‚Äù. The residents there are worth trillions which are not recognised there. 

 

The unfortunate thing is there is no market, bank, theatre, salon, boutique, no music or TV; though there are streets yet there are no cars! There are trees but no one sits underneath them! There are flowers but no one smells or admires them. 

 

Solomon was right when he said ;

Ecclesiastes 9

KJV

10+ Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do, do it with thy might; for there is no work, nor device, nor knowledge, nor wisdom, in the grave, whither thou goest.

 

Therefore spend and enjoy your life and all that you‚Äôve been blessed with for there is no luxury or enjoyment in the city called cemetery where you‚Äôll take your residence! 

 

Whether you liked it or not your residence (grave)  will be constructed near the very person you despised and hated in life. You‚Äôll live side by side with people you hated, whose company you despised. 

 

If this is the case why not reconcile with them while you are alive, why not love them now? Each will indeed be confined to his ‚Äúresidence‚Äù but your spirits shall see and meet each other every midnight! Ask any Ewe person why they don't bury outside their village (üò≥ü§£ joke!) 

 

Listen to these words ;

Ecclesiastes 9

KJV

5+ For the living know that they shall die: but the dead know not any thing, neither have they any more a reward; for the memory of them is forgotten.

 

6 Also their love, and their hatred, and their envy, is now perished; neither have they any more a portion for ever in any thing that is done under the sun.

 

Here is an interesting observation, at your funeral both genuine and hypocritical friends will show up. The hypocrites will cry more than your relatives. Your funeral will be a ‚Äúwho‚Äôs who ‚Äú in Ghana show! A kind of ‚Äú meet me there‚Äù celebration.

 

Everyone would love to be seen as a friend meanwhile when you were alive they were your tormentors! O! death how you reveal and expose hypocrites. 

 

A few deaths that have occurred recently revealed how hypocritical we are as a people! Both friend and foe will unite at your funeral! However if in your death friend and foe are reconciled then so be it. 

 

Father, we thank you for Death as it helps us sieve the genuine from the fake. 

 

My thoughts to share as I watched many throng the home of a deceased national figure ( name withheld)

title: Know Your Way!
text:
Know Your Way! 

Proverbs 14

KJV

12+ There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

 

Nowhere is this warning relevant and true than when you are travelling! Anyone who has driven on a newly constructed road which has not yet been commissioned will tell you how true the above warning is. 

 

Here we are travelling to a town (I‚Äôll not mention) and wanting to get there early we took a road that seems less occupied only to get to a point where there was a deep valley. 

 

What was most worrying was that we had driven almost two hours from the main road so we had to turn round making a four-hour waste. 

 

So yes, 

Proverbs 14

KJV

12+ There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

 

In our case it was not only time that we wasted but also fuel which affected our budget thus making our trip unenjoyable. 

 

But how did we get to this stage? We ignored shouts from people along the way who were trying to warn us! Some we heard but thought they were admiring our car! Can you imagine! 

 

Is this not how we live our lives? We pay no attention to warnings, even when we are flagged down we think of alternative ways to do whatever we want to do. 

 

We pick, adopt and practice lifestyles that affect and impact us negatively but who will say and we will listen! 

Life is likened to a race how you start and how you end are very important! 

 

Mistakes are very common. We all make them so to avoid or minimise mistakes study/observe the life of those ahead of you. Some have ended up in the ‚Äú scrapyard ‚Äú others are still on the road. 

 

To avoid life‚Äôs ‚Äúscrapyard‚Äù learn how to undertake maintenance by taking stock regularly! If a lifestyle is not yielding positive returns you‚Äôll know, so you change it for another. Keep trying, asking, observing etc you‚Äôll find one that is better. 

 

For example, if you are in a group that is not adding any positive value to your life why stay in it? If you are eating a food that is impacting negatively on your health why continue eating it?

 

Just because it is cheap does but justify eating it. The same applies to groups that we are part of, the fact that they are friends/classmates etc does not justify staying in it if it is impacting negatively on you.

 

Proverbs 12

KJV

15+ The way of a fool is right in his own eyes: but he that hearkeneth unto counsel is wise.

 

Consult with people more knowledgeable than you on matters of importance to your progress in life. Not just anybody, be wise in your choice! 

 

It was my experience that brought back to mind the verse of scripture you‚Äôve read. Learn to listen to warnings and advices while on this journey. 

 

We thought the road we took was good and would lead us to our destination only to turn back to start all over again. Wasting both time and fuel! 

 

An experience to share
