title: Vindication Of Truth: It Takes Time, In Praise Of Acapella
text:
Vindication Of Truth: It Takes Time, In Praise Of Acapella 

Ephesians 5

KJV

19+ Speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in your heart to the Lord;

 

Lies and falsehood run faster than truth, bad news sells faster than the good, gossip,  rumours, toli etc gain supporters than truth. 

 

In every sphere of human activities be it secular or spiritual falsehoods are given better time and audience! It has always taken a longer time for Truth to gain support 

 

I‚Äôve said these to make the case of a cappella singing. Though we have taught/preached these to the public over the years it is now that the truth and beauty of it is being felt. 

 

On social media today, we see several congregations showcasing the beauty of this type/style of singing as they live-stream their worship services. 

 

There are also the various youth-dominated singing groups that are live-streaming their activities. These have made the church of Christ very attractive; confirming the truth of singing as taught in the NT scriptures 

 

You don‚Äôt have to sing with instruments to touch the heart, vocal verbal singing does it better   It helps reflect and ponder over the words one sings. It helps in silent meditation which is spiritual! 

 

Truly it will take time for the truth that we preach /teach to gain ground in Ghana! What is needed is how to design and package them. This calls for prayer and wisdom. 

 

We must explore ways to communicate these truths, which is a leadership challenge!

 

With deep knowledge and insight into the scriptures, we should be able to tell what is right and can   be done without violating any given passage of scripture 

 

Scripture ( Bible ) and not emotional attachment to tradition must be the rule. I‚Äôve said before that ‚Äú some traditions are hallowed mistakes. Time and practice have made them to be true, though they have no scriptural base‚Äù. 

 

My take on the positive impact a acapella singing is making on the religious space in Ghana today.

title: The Inner Circle Concept
text:
The Inner Circle Concept 

Matthew 17

KJV

1+ And after six days Jesus taketh Peter, James, and John his brother, and bringeth them up into an high mountain apart,

 

‚ÄúLove all, trust a few; do wrong to none ‚Äú is a quote attributed to William Shakespeare from his play ‚Äú All‚Äôs well that ends well‚Äù 

 

This suggests that even though we should love all men, we should limit our trust to a few ( inner circle) while ensuring that we do wrong to none. 

 

This pattern or thought of living can be found expressed practically on the pages of Holy Writ, by the Lord. He had twelve disciples but on a few occasions, he always resorted to three (3) of them, namely Peter, James and John. 

 

Some things are known only to these three one is what you‚Äôve just read, the event that took place on the Mount, popularly referred to as the ‚Äú Mount of Transfiguration‚Äù

 

There are a few others, read them! 

Mark 5

KJV

37+ And he suffered no man to follow him, save Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.

 

Mark 14

KJV

33+ And he taketh with him Peter and James and John, and began to be sore amazed, and to be very heavy;

 

Almost every leader both past and present has an ‚Äúinner circle‚Äù to share his inner thoughts, fears and joys; these serve as pillars that support him in critical times and moments.  

 

Because of the ‚Äúuncertainties‚Äù of life and the lack of trust in the majority, it is a wise decision to have an inner circle. 

 

Here is a caution to be observed when constituting an inner circle; it should not be a ‚Äú crowd ‚Äú but a ‚Äú company‚Äù there is a difference!   A ‚Äú company‚Äù  of people with refined thoughts, culture, manners, aspirations etc. Persons who have something to offer, value addition etc. to your life, not the other way round. 

 

An inner circle provides cover and shelter as they filter out fake friends. They provide comfort when it is most needed. They provide objective opinions that help shape direction in life. 

 

If and when all else fails, when you face rejection and ridicule etc, these are there to support and sustain you no matter what! 

 

Beloved, everyone needs someone, Jesus took Peter, James and John, who do you have? 

 

This is not an easy question nor a task it needs prayers, discernment and wisdom to answer. 

 

‚ÄúYes, love all, trust a few, do wrong to none ‚Äú there are fakes out there parading as genuine friends. Be careful and wise not to allow just anyone into your inner circle. 

 

Many a life is in ruins, dreams, aspirations, shattered because of the wrong people they allowed into their ‚Äúinner circle‚Äù, we all at a point in time made such mistakes before, but never again! 

 

Now that you know! Jesus had an inner circle, please get one! A word to the wise.  

 

Ps.

I am applying for a place in your inner circle, at the same time I am receiving applications from any interested in being part of mine!

title: He Sealed My Pardon With His Blood!
text:
He Sealed My Pardon With His Blood!

1 Corinthians 15:3 

NIV

[3] For what I received I passed on to you as of first importance: that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,

 

This morning at service I joined to sing the hymn ‚Äú Man of Sorrows‚Äù while singing I was struck by these words of the hymn-writer ‚Äú  he sealed my pardon with his blood‚Äù. I paused to think and reflect on these words, which meant a lot to me. I share this with you. 

 

From the Apostle Paul‚Äôs perspective, the most important thing we should remember in Christianity is ‚Äú he sealed our pardon with his blood‚Äù. This he expressed in these words;  

 

1 Corinthians 15:3 

NIV

[3] For what I received I passed on to you as of first importance: that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,

 

‚ÄúHe died for our sins‚Äù is the same as saying ‚Äú he sealed our pardon with his blood‚Äù. 

 

Which again is similar to another aspect of his life, he ( Paul) wrote about; 

2 Corinthians 8:9 

NIV

[9] For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though he was rich, yet for your sake he became poor, so that you through his poverty might become rich.

 

Not only did he seal our pardon with his blood but he also made himself poor to make us rich. This is love. 

 

Again we are told he made himself of ‚Äú no reputation‚Äù he gave up his honor so that we may be honoured. It is for these reasons that I owe Him my life and my everything! If it had not been for the sacrifices he made I would have been nothing. Paul knew this hence he said ;

 

Galatians 6:14 

NIV

[14] May I never boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world.

 

If any will boast, beloved let him boast in the One ‚Äú who sealed his pardon with his blood! ‚Äú. Who also became poor to make him rich!  

 

Yes, He took my sins and my sorrows, He made them His very own. Read how another hymn-writer expressed his feelings; 

 

I stand amazed in the presence

  Of Jesus the Nazarene,

And wonder how He could love me,

  A sinner condemned, unclean.

 

(How marvelous! How wonderful!

  And my song shall ever be:

How marvelous! How wonderful!

    Is my Savior‚Äôs love for me!)

 

2

For me, it was in the garden,

  He prayed: ‚ÄúNot my will, but Thine.‚Äù

He had no tears for His own griefs,

  But sweat-drops of blood for mine.

To strengthen Him in the sorrows

  He bore for my soul that night.

He took my sins and my sorrows,

  He made them His very own;

He bore the burden to Calv‚Äôry,

  And suffered, and died alone.

 

5

When with the ransomed in glory

  His face I at last shall see,

‚ÄôTwill be my joy through the ages

I owe everything to Him, my thoughts as I meditate on the phrase ‚ÄúHe sealed my pardon with His blood‚Äù.

title: Glorified Mortal As Against Glorified Immortal
text:
Glorified Mortal As Against Glorified Immortal 

Revelation 7

KJV

9+ After this I beheld, and, lo, a great multitude, which no man could number, of all nations, and kindreds, and people, and tongues, stood before the throne, and before the Lamb, clothed with white robes, and palms in their hands;

 

One popular hymn that touches the heart and gives hope of the brighter future that lies ahead of believers is the hymn titled ‚Äú There Is A Habitation‚Äù. Take a look at the words. 

 

There is a habitation,

Built by the living God,

For all of ev'ry nation,

Who seek that grand abode.

 

Chorus:

O Sion, Sion,

I long thy gates to see:

O Sion, Sion,

When shall I dwell in thee?

 

2 A city with foundations,

Firm as the eternal throne,

Nor wars, nor desolations

Shall ever move a stone. 

 

3 No night is there, no sorrow,

No death, and no decay;

No yesterday, no morrow,--

But one eternal day. 

 

4 Within its pearly portals,

Angelic armies sing,

With glorified immortals,

The praises of its King

 

My focus is on the words of the last stanza especially the line ‚Äú glorified immortals ‚Äú. The line suggests that if there are ‚Äúglorified immortals ‚Äú then there must also be ‚Äúglorified mortals‚Äù. 

 

The Question is who are these? 

 

‚ÄúGlorified mortals‚Äù are man-made. These are those who are exalted by men, men bestowed with worldly glories and honors. These are men who are known and highly admired here on  Earth. These are people who die and their glories die and are buried with them! 

 

‚ÄúGlorified immortals‚Äù are those glorified and exalted by God as described in our text verse above! These are those whose names are written in the Lamb‚Äôs Book of Life; their glories never fade or die because they live forever, and their glorification (exaltation) is by God and not man.  

 

Every Believer is a potential glorified immortal, whose glorification will take place on the Day of the Resurrection. 

 

Because flesh and blood ( mortal) can not inherit the kingdom, a transformation must first take place before the coronation (glorification )

 

Read how Paul described it, 

1 Corinthians 15:50-54 

NIV

[50] I declare to you, brothers and sisters, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, nor does the perishable inherit the imperishable.

 

[51] Listen, I tell you a mystery: We will not all sleep, but we will all be changed--- 

 

[52] in a flash, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. For the trumpet will sound, the dead will be raised imperishable, and we will be changed. 

 

[53] For the perishable must clothe itself with the imperishable, and the mortal with immortality.

 

[54] When the perishable has been clothed with the imperishable, and the mortal with immortality, then the saying that is written will come true: ‚ÄúDeath has been swallowed up in victory.‚Äù

 

This is what will precede the coronation that transforms us into ‚Äú immortals ‚Äú and crowns us with glory. Hence becoming ‚Äú glorified immortals ‚Äú. 

Beloved, make every effort to be counted worthy of this honor and title ‚Äú glorified immortal‚Äù. The world has its ‚Äú glorified mortals ‚Äú but you; aspire to be Heaven‚Äôs ‚Äúglorified immortal‚Äù. 

 

Seek therefore no glorification here, rather seek that which is above which never fades nor dies! 

 

Hebrews 13

KJV

14+ For here have we no continuing city, but we seek one to come.

 

Maranatha.

title: Is It An Act Of Cowardice?
text:
Is It An Act Of Cowardice?

2 Samuel 15:14

NIV

[14] Then David said to all his officials who were with him in Jerusalem, ‚ÄúCome! We must flee, or none of us will escape from Absalom. We must leave immediately, or he will move quickly to overtake us and bring ruin on us and put the city to the sword.‚Äù

 

There comes a time when our choices may be seen or described as cowardice; for example to beat a retreat in the face of danger. A danger one can easily overcome, a case in point is what you‚Äôve read!

 

For example, hearing of falsehoods being spread like wildfire just to destroy your name and image, lies you can disprove and yet you choose not to! Is it an act of cowardice?

 

David the king was compelled to flee when he received the news of an imminent attack by his own child. Was it cowardice or an act of wisdom?  

Of importance in taking this decision, David considered the long-term effects; the ‚Äúfallout ‚Äú or the  ‚Äú consequences ‚Äú!!

 

There are several instances when similar developments occurred in the lives of prominent personalities in the Bible. Read a few; 

John 3

KJV

1+ There was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews:

2+ The same came to Jesus by night, and said unto him, Rabbi, we know that thou art a teacher come from God: for no man can do these miracles that thou doest, except God be with him.

 

John 19

KJV

38+ And after this Joseph of Arimathaea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, besought Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus: and Pilate gave him leave. He came therefore, and took the body of Jesus.

 

John 7

KJV

50+ Nicodemus saith unto them, (he that came to Jesus by night, being one of them,)

51 Doth our law judge any man, before it hear him, and know what he doeth?

 

Acts 9

KJV

24 But their laying await was known of Saul. And they watched the gates day and night to kill him.

25+ Then the disciples took him by night, and let him down by the wall in a basket.

 

There comes a time when beating a retreat is not an act of cowardice, but is dictated by wisdom. It is not easy though but it is the right thing to do. 

 

Jesus did a similar thing when in the midst of provocations falsehoods and accusations he held his peace, which posture that amazed both the Chief Priest and Pilate 

 

Matthew 26

KJV

62 And the high priest arose, and said unto him, Answerest thou nothing? what is it which these witness against thee?

 

63 But Jesus held his peace. And the high priest answered and said unto him, I adjure thee by the living God, that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ, the Son of God.

 

Mark 15

KJV

4+ And Pilate asked him again, saying, Answerest thou nothing? Behold how many things they witness against thee.

 

5+ But Jesus yet answered nothing; so that Pilate marvelled.

 

In the midst of provocations and one holds his peace when in fact he can speak is not an act of cowardice, but an act of wisdom. 

 

When in the face of danger, a danger that one can easily overcome yet walks away, is not an act of cowardice but wisdom. As seen in the case of Paul being put in a basket! 

 

You may not be understood, yet this action will turn out to be your honor! It is about ruling one‚Äôs spirit. Many will accuse and say all manner of things falsely against you, but learn to rule your spirit. 

 

Proverbs 16

KJV

title: A Layman‚Äôs Guide To Heaven.
text:
A Layman‚Äôs Guide To Heaven. 

Acts 16

KJV

30+ And brought them out, and said, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?

 

Many have asked for a summary of what it will take to make it to Heaven., after obeying the Gospel through baptism. 

 

You‚Äôve heard, ‚ÄúWhat must I do to be saved ?‚Äù ‚ÄúWhat must I do to inherit eternal life‚Äù etc. Everyone would like to know expressed in a few words what is required of him/her to make it to Heaven after baptism! 

 

Whenever I am asked for a summary, I refer the questioner /inquirer to the psalm below üëá this is the best summary I recommend. A quickie! 

 

Psalm 15:1-5 

NIV

[1] Lord, who may dwell in your sacred tent? Who may live on your holy mountain?

 

[2] The one whose walk is blameless, who does what is righteous, who speaks the truth from their heart;

 

[3] whose tongue utters no slander, who does no wrong to a neighbor, and casts no slur on others; 

 

[4] who despises a vile person but honors those who fear the Lord; who keeps an oath even when it hurts, and does not change their mind; 

 

[5] who lends money to the poor without interest; who does not accept a bribe against the innocent. Whoever does these things will never be shaken.

 

The above psalm summarizes what it would take to make it by highlighting simply our lifestyle! It‚Äôs all about attitudes and behaviours. Everything has to do with how we live and how we relate to each other. If we can meet these requirements then we can assure ourselves of a place! 

 

These must be easy for anyone who is determined and focussed to make it to Heaven to do! Read it again please!  Ponder over it! 

 

Use this psalm to measure your life! Let it be the boundary, the limit to everything you do. Read it every morning and evening.

title: What I Feared Most In Life: A Personal Confession!
text:
What I Feared Most In Life: A Personal Confession! 

Genesis 4

KJV

8+ And Cain talked with Abel his brother: and it came to pass, when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him.

 

I don‚Äôt know about you, but any time I read this incident it makes me fear humans! That a brother from the same womb can slay his brother? 

 

In life, we all have our fears no one is exempt! There are many things that we fear but on a list of fears some are topmost. Not all put fears in us to the same degree. 

 

Among the many things I fear in life this is one of the topmost, a brother literally killing a brother !! What makes it difficult for me to understand is the fact that in the case of these two, God stepped in, to reconcile them. And Yet! 

 

God spoke in private with Cain yet Cain did what he had planned to do -to kill his brother. Not even God‚Äôs intervention could stop him. 

 

Here is where I fear humans, there are some of Cain‚Äôs great great, grandchildren living among us today. You may have seen them just that you did not recognize whose grandchildren they are. 

 

By their fruits you‚Äôll know them. These are those who harbour grudges, ill feelings, etc,  and have planned to take revenge at the least opportune time they get. 

 

Not even preachings, teachings, pleadings etc not even time can stop them just like how God‚Äôs intervention could not stop Cain. 

 

Cain killed Abel probably with a club, hoe, Stone etc. an object but his grandchildren of today do it with the tongue. Which is more dangerous than using an object. Dangerous because you can not see it coming! 

 

Abel likely saw the object Cain used just that he could not avoid it! In our case, the tongue is hidden, enclosed and covered by the teeth. All you see is the teeth that are bared and pretend to be smiling! 

 

I am sure Abel while dying may have uttered a few words. Words such as ‚Äú o my brother !‚Äù  O what have l done? O why do this to me?

Are we not brothers? 

 

Yes, the same we also say to his great great grandchildren today who slay us with their tongues! Just as Cain was driven by envy so are they today. Envy knows no appeasement. It burns like wildfire

 

If there is any person or group I feared most in life it is Cain‚Äôs ancestors. His ‚Äúspiritual assassination squad ‚Äúhas terrorized and continues to To do so to many! 

 

We solicit your prayers that God should grant us the strength and wisdom to live and endure the bruises and hurts inflicted on us. We are knocked down but not knocked out! 

 

This is my fear in life, not poverty not hunger, but the unconscious stabbing in the back by a brother/sister! Just like Cain did! 

 

My fear I confess!

title: When God‚Äôs Message Becomes A ‚ÄúBurden‚Äù.
text:
When God‚Äôs Message Becomes A ‚ÄúBurden‚Äù. 

Isaiah 13

KJV

1+ The burden of Babylon, which Isaiah the son of Amoz did see.

 

Do you know that in ancient times, messages from God were called ‚Äúburdens "? This was so-called because the messages were most often ‚Äúunpleasant ‚Äùto the recipients!! However, the usage was figurative. 

 

Read what Jeremiah was told to say in response to the people‚Äôs inquiries concerning God‚Äôs word to them. 

Jeremiah 23

KJV

33+ And when this people, or the prophet, or a priest, shall ask thee, saying, What is the burden of the Lord? thou shalt then say unto them, What burden? I will even forsake you, saith the Lord.

 

Also, it appears the term was ‚Äúcoined‚Äù   by the people and was so used by God to address them; it is important to note that God communicates or addresses us using words that we use or are familiar with. 

 

You‚Äôve read before the ‚Äúhand‚Äù of God! His ‚Äúears‚Äù are not deaf, the eyes etc. God is spirit and spirit does not have ears, hands ears etc. Yet He is described as having them! We called this ‚Äú anthropomorphism‚Äù! 

 

Don‚Äôt worry your head if you don‚Äôt know it or can‚Äôt pronounce it. You‚Äôll go to heaven or hell whether you know it or not! 

 

As stated earlier the word ‚Äú burden‚Äù was a terminology possibly ‚Äúcoined‚Äù by the people. Read this 

Jeremiah 23

KJV

38 But since ye say, The burden of the Lord; therefore thus saith the Lord; Because ye say this word, The burden of the Lord, and I have sent unto you, saying, Ye shall not say, The burden of the Lord;

 

Read a few examples ; 

(The Burden of Babylon ) message to Babylon 

Isaiah 13

KJV

19+ And Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of the Chaldees' excellency, shall be as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.

KJV

4+ That thou shalt take up this proverb against the king of Babylon, and say, How hath the oppressor ceased! the golden city ceased!

 

(The burden of Moab)

(The Burden Of Damascus) 

Isaiah 17

KJV

1+ The burden of Damascus. Behold, Damascus is taken away from being a city, and it shall be a ruinous heap.

2+ The cities of Aroer are forsaken: they shall be for flocks, which shall lie down, and none shall make them afraid

 

(The Burden Of Egypt) 

Isaiah 19

KJV

1+ The burden of Egypt. Behold, the Lord rideth upon a swift cloud, and shall come into Egypt: and the idols of Egypt shall be moved at his presence, and the heart of Egypt shall melt in the midst of it.

 

Joel 3

KJV

19+ Egypt shall be a desolation, and Edom shall be a desolate wilderness, for the violence against the children of Judah, because they have shed innocent blood in their land.

 

( Tyre And Tarshish) 

Isaiah 23

KJV

1+ The burden of Tyre. Howl, ye ships of Tarshish; for it is laid waste, so that there is no house, no entering in: from the land of Chittim it is revealed to them.

 

( Nineveh) 

Nahum 1

KJV

1+ The burden of Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.

 

(Israel)

Malachi 1

KJV

1 The burden of the word of the Lord to Israel by Malachi.

 

(Miscellaneous prophecies ‚Äúburdens‚Äù )

Isaiah 21

KJV

11+ The burden of Dumah. He calleth to me out of Seir, Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?

 

KJV

1+ The burden of the valley of vision. What aileth thee now, that thou art wholly gone up to the housetops?

6+ The burden of the beasts of the south: into the land of trouble and anguish, from whence come the young and old lion, the viper and fiery flying serpent, they will carry their riches upon the shoulders of young asses, and their treasures upon the bunches of camels, to a people that shall not profit them.

 

Very interesting, God‚Äôs messages of warning and correction are to the recipients a burden‚Äù. We are not different from them, many today see messages intended to warn, correct and help them as ‚Äú burdens‚Äù! As a result, they turn a deaf ear or delete them! 

 

Just like the prophets of old, who care if our messages are heard, read or deleted! A speaker, writer etc like the prophets of old is under divine obligation to speak /write etc, God‚Äôs message! Be it a ‚Äú burden ‚Äú or not! 

 

Read how Paul said it;

KJV

16+ For though I preach the gospel, I have nothing to glory of: for necessity is laid upon me; yea, woe is unto me, if I preach not the gospel!

 

Read how the term ‚Äúburden‚Äù probably began ; 

Jeremiah 23

KJV

33+ And when this people, or the prophet, or a priest, shall ask thee, saying, What is the burden of the Lord? thou shalt then say unto them, What burden? I will even forsake you, saith the Lord.

 

A thought to share. Is a ‚Äúmessage‚Äù from God a ‚Äúburden‚Äù to you?

title: Solitary Time: The Benefits
text:
Solitary Time: The Benefits 

Matthew 14

KJV

23+ And when he had sent the multitudes away, he went up into a mountain apart to pray: and when the evening was come, he was there alone.

 

Scriptures record times the Lord spent alone one of which you‚Äôve just read! He knew the enormity of the task and the burden he carried hence he often took time off to be alone. 

 

C.S. Lewis is credited with urging his readers to ‚Äú  set aside time for solitary thoughts ‚Äú ( in his book Christian Behaviour), which he learnt from studying the life of Christ. And beloved, this is true and wise advice. 

 

Contrary to what most think about being alone, as a child of God, you must set aside time to be alone to think through your life‚Äôs activities and challenges. This helps identify both problems and solutions! 

 

Indeed, several books were written by their authors when they were in solitary confinement! Paul is one, some of his epistles were written from solitary confinement. Solitary confinement inspires, creates and generates ideas and visions. 

 

The complex nature and the speed at which society is moving, demand that we undertake such a solitary exercise. 

 

The Lord did this very often and so must we if we must overcome the numerous complex challenges that confront us daily; and here is how to go about it. 

 

Find a place that is free from noise and distraction, switch off your phone and go offline. Lie down and play back events that have taken place in your life during a certain period of time. 

 

Do this with a pen and paper by your side so you can record thoughts, ideas etc that come to mind. Ask yourself hard questions, create or imagine scenarios list down how you‚Äôll tackle or answer such questions in real-life settings. 

 

Before you leave to join mainstream society, prepare a roadmap to guide you when you set out to implement your thoughts. 

 

Learn to spend time alone to develop and improve your thoughts about life and living; both spiritual and secular. 

 

Spontaneous thoughts are fine, but the refined are the best and these come through spending time alone. As CS Lewis said, ‚Äúset aside time for solitary thoughts‚Äù. Do not be afraid to be alone. 

 

A thought to share. A word to any seeking wisdom.

title: Repercussions: Do You Know?
text:
Repercussions: Do You Know? 

Luke 6

KJV

38+ Give, and it shall be given unto you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over, shall men give into your bosom. For with the same measure that ye mete withal it shall be measured to you again.

 

The above-cited verse is commonly read to make the point that when we give we get more, but do you know that the same principle applies to the evil we do? 

 

Yes, ‚Äúthe same measure that ye mete withal it shall be measured to you again.‚Äù Some call it ‚ÄúKhama‚Äù I don‚Äôt know who this ‚ÄúKhama ‚Äú is but I know that to every action there is a reaction! 

 

The Bible confirms this when it states ‚Äú whatsoever a man sows the same shall he reap‚Äù which is an eternal law, eternal truth and an eternal warning! Yes!

 

Good receives good, in the same spirit evil receives evil in return. If the evil we do to others ( unless we repent and ask for forgiveness) do not receive its equivalent then the scriptures are not true. God forbid this to be so! 

 

There are several examples in the Bible of individuals and nations receiving ‚Äú just payments ‚Äú for both the good and evil they did to others. 

 

What is of great importance to note is that payments for either good or evil done come from God and not man. It is not in us to take revenge or bless anyone for either the good or evil done to us. It is in the hands of God. It is He who initiates. 

 

Here is where we have the challenge, as we try to take the ‚Äú law‚Äù into our hands ;

Proverbs 20

KJV

22+ Say not thou, I will recompense evil; but wait on the Lord, and he shall save thee.

 

Proverbs 24

KJV

29+ Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me: I will render to the man according to his work.

 

There have been several painful instances where a recipient of good chooses to reward the benefactor with evil. Under the circumstances, the benefactor may feel justified to act, but there is this restraining order; read 

Romans 12

KJV

19+ Dearly beloved, avenge not yourselves, but rather give place unto wrath: for it is written, Vengeance is mine; I will repay, saith the Lord.

 

1 Thessalonians 5

KJV

15+ See that none render evil for evil unto any man; but ever follow that which is good, both among yourselves, and to all men.

 

1 Peter 3

KJV

9+ Not rendering evil for evil, or railing for railing: but contrariwise blessing; knowing that ye are thereunto called, that ye should inherit a blessing.

 

Despite these admonitions, the fellowship is bedevilled with ‚Äúhard nuts‚Äù unrepentant believers who are unwilling to let go! To them, it is an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth. They wait patiently till they get the chance or opportunity. 

 

Until they‚Äôve.‚Äù cursed and or spread false news, rumours etc, about you, thus destroying your name and reputation they‚Äôll never rest ‚Äú. Yes. 

 

The psalmist Of Old expressed his trust in God to act on his behalf; though it sounds like a frustrated cry! Hear him. 

Psalms 94

KJV

1+ O Lord God, to whom vengeance belongeth; O God, to whom vengeance belongeth, shew thyself.

 

Yes, it takes time but surely God will avenge! 

 

Finally a warning to those who rewardeth good done them with evil. Read it,  

Proverbs 17

KJV

13+ Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house. 

 

So, yes good or evil done receives equivalent payments, so watch your ways who knows perhaps what you are going through today may be payments for either. 

 

A thought to share

title: Memorials, Their Essence.
text:
Memorials, Their Essence. 

Luke 22

KJV

19+ And he took bread, and gave thanks, and brake it, and gave unto them, saying, This is my body which is given for you: this do in remembrance of me.

 

The question of how we would be remembered is a question about ‚Äú memorials ‚ÄúWhat is there to serve as your memorial?  It should not be your tombstone., it should be something beyond this! 

 

Truly, not many cared about this but beloved, we must pause and reflect on this important subject. Memorials. 

 

If memorials are not important, why would the Lord and several others we read about in the Bible take time to institute them? 

 

Beloved, how one would be remembered ( a memorial ) can be a conscious or an unconscious decision! 

 

You can decide how you should be remembered by being specific as is the case with the Lord   From the passage above, the Lord was specific in what should be done as a memorial 

 

Another example is that of Absalom the renegade son of David, in his case, he was interested in having his name remembered by an object. Read it; 

2 Samuel 18

KJV

18+ Now Absalom in his lifetime had taken and reared up for himself a pillar, which is in the king's dale: for he said, I have no son to keep my name in remembrance: and he called the pillar after his own name: and it is called unto this day, Absalom's place.

 

Joshua And Israel ; 

Joshua 4:6-7 

NIV

[6] to serve as a sign among you. In the future, when your children ask you, 'What do these stones mean?' 

[7] tell them that the flow of the Jordan was cut off before the ark of the covenant of the Lord. When it crossed the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan were cut off. These stones are to be a memorial to the people of Israel forever.‚Äù

 

Samuel and Israel ; 

1 Samuel 7

KJV

12+ Then Samuel took a stone, and set it between Mizpeh and Shen, and called the name of it Eben‚Äìezer, saying, Hitherto hath the Lord helped us.

 

We see similar examples around us, buildings with names inscribed on them. Statues and benevolent acts are another. These are conscious and deliberate decisions to immortalize or keep a person‚Äôs memory alive. 

 

What this means is you can institute, erect, construct etc in your lifetime an edifice or a practice as a memorial and instruct family members to keep and maintain it. 

 

Jesus left us with the Supper as a memorial and as often as we break the Bread and drink of the fruit of the Vine we are remembering Him ( his death); till He returns. 

 

On the other hand, there are acts of remembrance ( memorials) that come into existence unconsciously! One never instructed nor instituted them rather posterity brings them into being by way of remembering someone 

 

Biblically we see these from the following;

Dorcas, was associated with benevolent acts. 

Acts 9:39 

NIV

[39] Peter went with them, and when he arrived he was taken upstairs to the room. All the widows stood around him, crying and showing him the robes and other clothing that Dorcas had made while she was still with them.

 

The unnamed woman; also a benevolent act 

Mark 14:8-9 

NIV

[8] She did what she could. She poured perfume on my body beforehand to prepare for my burial. [9] Truly I tell you, wherever the gospel is preached throughout the world, what she has done will also be told, in memory of her.‚Äù

 

Scriptures abound in many such examples but time and space will not allow for a full presentation.

 

Now, what should be your memorial? It can be a conscious or an unconscious decision. You can initiate a benevolent act and instruct generations after you to continue as a memorial! 

 

A fund, a scholarship, a ‚Äú widows mite‚Äù project or program etc a specific one. Or build a KVIP, a classroom block, etc anything that seeks to promote the well-being of humanity. 

 

Here is what we should know about a memorial act. A memorial is not about ‚Äúself glorification‚Äù No! But as an example to be emulated; a practical lesson for all to learn! 

 

For example, Jesus did not institute the Supper to glorify Himself, he does not need self-glorification He is God! Instead, He did it to confirm in practice what He taught His followers  Read this ;

 

John 15

KJV

13+ Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.

 

This is what the Lord‚Äôs Supper was meant to confirm in practice; and what we should learn, practice etc as believers. He died that we may live. He gave that we may have. 

 

Unfortunately, we‚Äôve missed the essence of the memorial. We observe the Supper but live opposite lives. We miss the lessons it was meant to illustrate-laying down our lives for one another. 

 

Beloved, memorials ( remembrances) are not meant to glorify but to teach the virtues lived and pursued by the one whose memorial is being observed. 

 

A street name does not glorify the person whose name is on the plate but brings to mind what he lived and died for. It is meant to inspire, challenge etc. 

 

I know a Sister who on every birthday goes to offer free service to an elderly person, she sweeps, cleans, tidies up the home, buys and prepares soup /food etc and eats with the particular elderly person of choice. 

This is her memorial. 

 

I know of another who takes food items every birthday to the mental hospital! This is his memorial. 

 

After reading these what comes to mind? Yes, your memorial should inspire and be an example to others. Whatever you do is not ( should not) be meant to glorify or show how rich you are but rather to serve as an example of what should be done.

 

This is why Jesus indicated who we should invite to a celebration; 

 

Luke 14:12-14

NIV

[12] Then Jesus said to his host, ‚ÄúWhen you give a luncheon or dinner, do not invite your friends, your brothers or sisters, your relatives, or your rich neighbors; if you do, they may invite you back and so you will be repaid. 

 

[13] But when you give a banquet, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, the blind, [14] and you will be blessed. Although they cannot repay you, you will be repaid at the resurrection of the righteous.‚Äù

 

This may seem difficult, not at all He is saying ‚Äú blend the invited ‚Äú let the invited be made up of the rich and the poor ‚Äú. One will invite you to his party on another day, the other will not. 

 

To the one who will not, what you‚Äôve done will be your memorial! So you see what the Lord meant? 

 

Leave a Memorial. 

A thought to share

title: Making The Church Attractive: The Contribution Of Acapella Singers

16+ Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom; teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.

 

Beloved, any discerning mind and a close follower of developments on the Ghanaian religious landscape would testify that the church of Christ, Ghana has taken the centre stage of religious discussions. 

 

In other words, the church of Christ, Ghana is receiving as it were a front-page coverage! Many are citing us as references to what the scriptures say about the Church. 

 

Our stand on free will giving as against mainstream tithing, our stand on upholding the Bible as the rule, and lately the scriptural command that singing be a acapella (non-instrumental) has been making news lately 

 

As a ‚Äú tiktoker‚Äù, I have followed with great interest and admiration how some congregations have showcased the singing groups in their assemblies  

 

These groups have beautifully sung and demonstrated the beauty of non-instrumental singing thus affirming and confirming what the scriptures say! Many churchgoers have been made to believe that without instrumental singing church music is poor! 

 

We have preached and taught the doctrine of a acapella singing, these are seen as ‚Äútheoretical‚Äù but with these groups putting these teachings into practice many outside the fellowship are now beginning to see the real picture. The truth is now being established through these groups. 

 

It is like what John said ‚Äú the word became flesh ‚Äú theory becoming real through these singing groups among us. 

 

Remember the Holy Spirit gave gifts for the building up of the church, there are diversities of gifts. We must accept and encourage those gifted to use their voices to sing. These have a place in the ministry if we know how to tap and direct them. 

 

Some may argue the NT does not mention them, of course the NT does not mention several others but they find expression in today‚Äôs church arrangements. 

 

These are part of what we call the ‚Äú expediencies‚Äù! They are not mentioned explicitly, but they are needed to fulfil the work of the church. 

 

The ‚Äúmusic ministry‚Äù is attracting many a youth to the church, as they find meaning in the natural use of the voice. These practices ( singing) say nothing about anyone except Jesus and the Gospel. 

 

They are not a choir but gifted singers desirous of deploying their gifts to serve the God who bestowed them on them. Like a preacher, deacon, elders etc they shall all give account to God of their stewardship. So why should we exclude and stifle them?  

 

Today the Ghanaian religious landscape is waking up from the religious deception and spiritual stupor they‚Äôve been taught. 

 

Let any congregation that has singers encourage them. They are demonstrating what we have taught /preached for decades regarding non-instrumental music. 

 

It takes a humble study and the guidance of the Holy Spirit to appreciate what is unfolding.

 

Thoughts to share.

title: This¬† I Recall: A Personal Testimony.
text:
This  I Recall: A Personal Testimony.  

Hebrews 10

KJV

32+ But call to remembrance the former days, in which, after ye were illuminated, ye endured a great fight of afflictions;

 

There come moments in life when all seems to go haywire, every road leads to nowhere, hope is gone, joy has ceased, and frustration is the order of the day.  

 

That was exactly what befell the Hebrew Christians, hence the writer challenged them to draw inspiration from their past. He wanted them to remember what they went through when they first became believers!

 

Beloved, every battle or challenge we face today has been before, they are not new in principle but only in form. Satan recycles sin by redressing them to appear new. In reality, they are not. 

 

He uses different scenarios, different people, dressed in different attire but the same evil is unleashed. 

 

It was for this reason that Peter admonished believers to be vigilant ; 

1 Peter 5

KJV

8+ Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil, as a roaring lion, walketh about, seeking whom he may devour:

 

Just like you, many have come my way in the course of my ministry not to help but to frustrate and put stumbling blocks in my path. Why? Because I didn‚Äôt dance to their tune nor sing their version of songs! 

 

This is not new, when I transitioned from one Faith to the Christian Faith I encountered similar treatment! But I endured it, something similar to what the Hebrew Christians encountered. 

 

Read it again; 

Hebrews 10:32-33 

NIV

[32] Remember those earlier days after you had received the light, when you endured in a great conflict full of suffering. [33] Sometimes you were publicly exposed to insult and persecution; at other times you stood side by side with those who were so treated.

 

Beloved, to overcome your present challenges, try to recall your past experiences because as I stated earlier, problems are recycled events that have happened to you before. 

 

Ah, have you not been insulted before? Have you not been falsely accused before? Have you not been cheated, exploited etc before? Have you not had friends turn against you? Surely you have! So? 

 

Every problem, challenge etc you are experiencing today is a recycled event or phenomenon You‚Äôve experienced it before, overcome it before; so it is not a new phenomenon! Recall how you handled them.

 

Beloved, to ‚Äúcall to remembrance‚Äù, here is what you should do:- go through your mind‚Äôs archives, look into your pocket diaries! I have many in my bedroom that I go through to remind me of events and occurrences both the good and bad! 

 

These have helped me solve problems, overcome challenges,  and as such I recommend them to you. Yes, recall ‚Äú call to remembrance‚Äù so you can overcome the trials of today! Be wise.

 

A thought to share

title: He Said It, And He Did It !
text:
He Said It, And He Did It!
Luke 24
KJV
7+ Saying, The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.

 

Unlike political candidates who say many things but cannot fulfil them, all that Jesus said about himself,  what He will do or be done to Him were all fulfilled. He was an amazing Man of His Word who must be taken seriously.

 

One such prediction is what you‚Äôve read;  that He will be betrayed, condemned and crucified and on the third day shall rise again. When He first said these many were those who doubted Him, made mockery and ridiculed  Him, but it came to pass.

 

In the early hours of the First Day of the week, the city of Jerusalem woke up to a ‚Äú breaking news ! ‚Äù.

Three women on a fact-finding mission to the cemetery where He was buried met with an empty tomb. They hurried back to town to gossip their findings to a few. They gossiped because they were afraid. But as is normal with gossip no sooner had they whispered this to a few than it became news that went viral.

 

Reporters and stringers from the ‚ÄúJerusalem Chronicle‚Äù,  ‚ÄúJerusalem FM John 3:16, ‚Äú ‚ÄúPilate FM, Matthew 27:24 ‚Äú, and sister stations within and outside the city met with these women and interviewed them live on air.

 

They described vividly what they saw, the rolled stone, the empty tomb, and the man dressed in white who spoke to them. They even repeated word-for-word what the white-clothed man said ‚ÄúWhy seek ye the living among the dead? He has risen ‚ÄúYes, this is the Man Jesus. 

 

One newspaper headlined the morning‚Äôs publication with the words  ‚Äú He said it, and He did It!‚Äù The curious nature of the headline made the paper sold fast that by noon it had sold over several thousands.

 

Yes without a doubt, that Jesus died, was buried and on the third day rose again from the dead is an undeniable historical fact

 

We worship a risen Saviour. Upon the first day of the week as we assemble to break bread and drink of the cup let our voices and hearts rejoice   And may we do it from sincere, pure and honest hearts.

 

And., remember he who eats and drinks in an unworthy manner, ( wicked, evil, unrepentant heart) eats and drinks damnation unto himself.

 

Maranatha

title: Detergents; Have You Noticed?
text:
Detergents; Have You Noticed?

Hebrews 9

KJV

22+ And almost all things are by the law purged with blood; and without shedding of blood is no remission.

 

Hebrews 13

KJV

12+ Wherefore Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people with his own blood, suffered without the gate.

 

1 John 1

KJV

7+ But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of Jesus Christ his Son cleanseth us from all sin.

 

Revelation 1

KJV

5+ And from Jesus Christ, who is the faithful witness, and the first begotten of the dead, and the prince of the kings of the earth. Unto him that loved us, and washed us from our sins in his own blood,

 

The verses you‚Äôve read had one theme running through ‚Äú the blood of Jesus !‚Äù

 

I was compelled to relook at the subject regarding the blood of Jesus when I tried washing a stained shirt. I have tried using a detergent I bought but it did not have the desired effect. 

 

So I tried another and lo it worked! Beloved I‚Äôve been under the wrong illusion that laundry material producers in their bid to sell to us put out various detergents! 

 

To me all detergents are the same, so I‚Äôve always purchased one brand until this ‚Äú stubborn stain‚Äù proved me wrong. I bought a different brand and it worked. 

 

Beloved not every stain can be washed /removed by just any detergent, some can most can not!

 

While pondering over these the words of a hymn struck me‚Äù What can wash away my sin?‚Äù I rushed to open it so I could see what the writer said! Read it 

 

‚ÄúWhat can wash away my sin? 

Nothing but the blood of Jesus. 

What can make me whole again? 

Nothing but the blood of Jesus‚Äù

 

My experience with the washing powder as mentioned above made me believe wholeheartedly what the hymn writer expressed! 

 

Beloved there are several brands of detergents around but not every type can wash every stain. Remember stains are in degrees of light, mild, deep etc. In like manner, sin is a deep stain! Not every ‚Äúdeed‚Äù can cleanse it. 

 

Many think good works can cleanse sin, benevolence can cleanse sin, and living a good moral life without coming to Christ can cleanse sin. No! 

 

Sin‚Äôs stain is such that only a powerful ‚Äúdetergent‚Äù can remove it. And this is what the Blood of Jesus does to anyone who comes to Him. 

 

Beloved, dip or soak your sin-stained life in the blood of Jesus. The Blood is the only remedy for this stain, Nothing else can remove it. 

 

Have you not washed a shirt but still have the stain in it? Yes, it is because you used the wrong detergent. Such is a sin-stained life that has not touched the blood of Jesus! 

 

Hear how the hymn writer expresses his experience ;

 

‚ÄúNothing can for sin atone: 

Nothing but the blood of Jesus. 

Naught of good that I have done: 

Nothing but the blood of Jesus.‚Äù

 

Read his conclusion;

‚ÄúThis is all my hope and peace: 

Nothing but the blood of Jesus. 

This is all my righteousness: 

Nothing but the blood of Jesus.‚Äù

(Robert Lowry, 1876) 

 

Yes, just like how not every stain can be removed by any washing powder, except one made specifically for that type of stain the same is true in the spiritual realm. 

 

To be clothed in white and walk with God, one must first be washed, sin- sin-stained life must be washed with the spiritual detergent- the blood of Jesus! 

 

Let me conclude with the question asked by another hymn-writer ;

 

‚ÄúHave you been to Jesus 

for the cleansing pow‚Äôr?

Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?

Are you fully trusting in His grace this hour?

Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?‚Äù

 

Are you washed in the blood,

In the soul-cleansing blood of the Lamb?

Are your garments spotless? Are they white as snow?

  Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?

 

Lay aside the garments that are stained with sin,

And be washed in the blood of the Lamb;

There‚Äôs a fountain flowing for the soul unclean,

O be washed in the blood of the Lamb.

(Elisha Hoffman (1839-1929)

 

Beloved, as I stood by the washing- machine, looking at my deeply stained shirt which had been nicely washed by the new detergent I bought; these were the profound lessons I learnt and wish to share with you 

 

The blood of Jesus is the only potent antidote to any ‚Äúsin-stained life.‚Äù Dip your life in it today, if you haven‚Äôt! 

 

Maranatha.

title: Anticipation: The Blessings Of Sunday Gatherings
text:
Anticipation: The Blessings Of Sunday Gatherings 

Acts 20

KJV

7+ And upon the first day of the week, when the disciples came together to break bread, Paul preached unto them, ready to depart on the morrow; and continued his speech until midnight.

 

Since my ‚Äú retirement ‚Äú from active service I‚Äôve been visiting to worship with a few assemblies of the Lord‚Äôs church and it is refreshing to see how many attend the meetings with broad smiles on their faces as they meet and greet each other!

 

I‚Äôve observed this on several occasions, and it gladdens my heart. One thing it conveys to me is captured in one word‚Äîanticipation! The joy of seeing each other after a long break (Monday -Saturday) means a lot! 

 

One category of members to whom the Sunday assembly is of great importance from my observation is the elderly 

 

The majority of these members are confined to their homes, and no one visits them during the weekdays. Therefore, they look forward to the Sunday gathering with great anticipation! In most places, they were the first to be in the building before services began! 

 

They do so because that‚Äôs when and where they‚Äôll meet and chat with others. 

 

I‚Äôve often watched the broad smiles and joys that they display, the warm handshakes and the long ‚Äú tolis, stories ‚Äú they tell! If you are the impatient one you‚Äôll think they are ‚Äúwasting‚Äù your time. 

 

Brethren, let us practice what the scriptures say ( paraphrase )  ‚Äú we the stronger ones should bear with them for in so doing we‚Äôll be fulfilling the law of Christ, which says love and receive one another just as I loved and received you !‚Äù

 

  A time for and with the elderly is a blessing! 

We need to exercise patience with them, for the Sunday gathering is the only opportunity they have in a week of seven days to socialise, so put yourself in their shoes. 

 

The twi proverb says it, ‚Äú aw√®r√® ky√Æ ky√Æ y√® f√† (ny√†) n√¥ w√¥ nip√† h√ª! ( forgive me if I didn‚Äôt put it well!) The Sunday gathering is the only assurance that makes them feel that they are part of society! Let us not deny them this by ignoring them! 

 

Having said this may we give thoughts to how we can make the ‚ÄúDay ‚Äú pleasant, joyful and memorable to them. 

 

We can do this in many ways, 

  1. (1) 
  2. for instance we can let them stay a little longer after the service to chat and fellowship with each other. They do so over a little refreshment prepared for them! 

 

(2)

 Elsewhere tea and biscuits are served prepared from the church‚Äôs kitchen! In attendance are elders, deacons ( with their wives) men and women leaders of the assembly. 

 

Conversations during these meetings are more about social, community events, challenges they are facing and how they are coping. The intent is to get them to vent out their feelings and frustrations! 

 

  1. (3)
  2. Elsewhere days are set aside in the week where they assemble at the meeting house to pray and engage in fraternal tolis!  

 

  1. (4)
  2. Elsewhere the young people are encouraged to go visit and assist them in clean-ups on specific days. Women /men leaders visit them to share fellowship! 

 

Loneliness is a ‚Äú killer‚Äù as these elderly are deeply submerged in thoughts and challenges that they find no one to listen to and assist. 

 

These are a few observations and thoughts I gathered as I visited to worship with churches. I pray they ignite discussions about our elderly members. 

 

They anticipate and look forward to the Sunday gathering let us therefore make the ‚ÄúDay‚Äù one full of joy and memorable! It will take another seven days before they meet us again! .

title: What We Know, Is Less Than What We Don‚Äôt Know!
text:
What We Know, Is Less Than What We Don‚Äôt Know! 

1 Timothy 6

KJV

4+ He is proud, knowing nothing, but doting about questions and strifes of words, whereof cometh envy, strife, railings, evil surmisings,

5 Perverse disputings of men of corrupt minds, and destitute of the truth, supposing that gain is godliness: from such withdraw thyself.

 

Indeed wherever you go some people behave and act as Paul described ‚Äú knowing nothing, but doting about questions ‚Äú etc. these pretend as if they know everything!  There is this English proverb which aptly fits them ‚ÄúEmpty barrels make the most noise ‚Äú which is true! 

 

Some don‚Äôt know that what they know is less than what they don‚Äôt know. Beloved, out there abounds much that we don‚Äôt know so let us be humble. 

 

I‚Äôve said it before that the more I read the more I come to know that I know nothing, and that there is more to learn. Yes! 

 

Like Paul advised, many have turned away from people who refused to take advice simply because they think they know it all. 

 

Indeed the proverbs writer was right; when he gave this advice. 

Proverbs 9

KJV

9+ Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.

 

I also found this admonition timely and relevant; 

6 Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.

 

Choose and pick your circle (friends) if you want to make headway in life. Not every circle will add value to your life be it spiritual, social or economic. 

 

He further warned abd thus must be taken seriously; 

Proverbs 9:7 

NIV

[7] Whoever corrects a mocker invites insults; whoever rebukes the wicked incurs abuse.

So,

Proverbs 9:8 

NIV

[8] Do not rebuke mockers or they will hate you; rebuke the wise and they will love you.

 

Beloved, though I knew these verses, I wish I had paid closer attention to them by way of application when I was young! Unfortunately, I was na√Øve and thought everyone was wise and would appreciate wisdom. 

 

Beloved, most of the mistakes I‚Äôve made in life were as a result of my failure to discern, identify and differentiate between the wise and the wicked. I thought all men are wise and are desirous of learning! 

 

I remember spending much time instructing and guiding some I thought were wise and would appreciate knowledge and wisdom only to realize I made a grave mistake!  

 

Reflecting on these experiences many years later I found truth in what the Lord said 

Matthew 13

KJV

12+ For whosoever hath, to him shall be given, and he shall have more abundance: but whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken away even that he hath.

 

Which saying agrees with 

Proverbs 9:9 

NIV

[9] Instruct the wise and they will be wiser still; teach the righteous and they will add to their learning.

 

Anyone who knows that what he knows is less than what he doesn‚Äôt know, will open up to be taught! 

 

Were you taught this poem when you were in primary school? I was (1963) and still remember In later life I learnt it was a ‚ÄúPersian Proverb‚Äù. 

 

Read it; 

‚ÄúHe who knows not, and knows not that he knows not, is a fool; shun him‚Äù. 

 

‚ÄúHe who knows not, and knows that he knows not, can be taught; teach him‚Äù. 

 

‚ÄúHe who knows, and knows not that he knows, is asleep; wake him.‚Äù 

 

‚ÄúHe who knows, and knows that he knows, is a prophet; follow him.‚Äù

 

Wow!

 

Have you tried to advise those who think they know better? Leave them. The unfortunate thing is that there are many which explains why we can not get things done as a people. 

 

If you want to improve in life you must admit that there is much out there that you don‚Äôt know. Whatever you know is less than what you don‚Äôt know. So be humble, open-minded- etc; so you can be taught! 

 

I recommend someone to you, and should you find him, please follow him!  This is:- 

‚ÄúHe who knows, and knows that he knows, is a prophet; follow him.‚Äù

 

Thoughts to share

title: What Did We Bring, And What Can We Take With Us?
text:
What Did We Bring, And What Can We Take With Us? 

1 Timothy 6

KJV

7+ For we brought nothing into this world, and it is certain we can carry nothing out

 

What did we bring and what can we take with us; both have a simple answer! Nothing. If this is the case then what manner of persons should we be? Here is where we have the challenge and the difficulty. 

 

Read what one man who bore witness to this truth said;  

Job 1

KJV

21+ And said, Naked came I out of my mother's womb, and naked shall I return thither: the Lord gave, and the Lord hath taken away; blessed be the name of the Lord.

 

This is a profound admission of the futility of trying to act as if one can take something away. Furthermore, the reality of this truth comes to life when we attend the funerals of men and women of substance. 

 

No matter how elaborate and expensive everything done is, the fact remains the same; they take nothing along!  

 

Interestingly,  some have misinterpreted this to mean that poverty is a virtue, so they disdain riches. 

 

Well, like everything in life we must each make a choice, to be poor or rich is a choice. I admit that this statement is debatable! Some factors and preconditions decide which is which. 

 

Anyway, so we ask, of what use then are the riches we come by while we live? Does it mean we should not acquire anything just because we shall not take them with us? 

 

Admittedly there are some statements which if not studied carefully will seek to create the impression that it is useless to acquire anything in life. 

 

Read this 

Ecclesiastes 5

KJV

15+ As he came forth of his mother's womb, naked shall he return to go as he came, and shall take nothing of his labour, which he may carry away in his hand.

 

Psalms 49

KJV

17+ For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away: his glory shall not descend after him.

 

Is God therefore against our labor? Is He against enjoyment? Surely God is not against our enjoying whatever we have gained through our labor. 

 

Read what Paul wrote ;

1 Timothy 6

KJV

17+ Charge them that are rich in this world, that they be not highminded, nor trust in uncertain riches, but in the living God, who giveth us richly all things to enjoy;

 

18 That they do good, that they be rich in good works, ready to distribute, willing to communicate;

 

Simply put, God blesses us with riches to be enjoyed but not selfishly! So, yes we brought nothing and will take nothing out, but while here let us enjoy whatever we have acquired. Just that we ‚Äú should remember the poor‚Äù. 

 

So dress well, but remember to help clothe your neighbor who needs clothing. Yes eat good food, but remember to provide the disadvantage with some. Whatever you do let it trickle down to the man on the street. 

 

Solomon summed up the above in these words; He was satisfied with the returns ( investments) of his labor; these empowered him financially hence he denied himself of nothing! 

 

Please read the following to understand and not to judge; We see this in real life, people whose ‚Äúreturns on their investments‚Äù ( labor) are high enough do buy cars of their choice and build  houses etc,  üëá

 

Ecclesiastes 2

KJV

10+ And whatsoever mine eyes desired I kept not from them, I withheld not my heart from any joy; for my heart rejoiced in all my labour: and this was my portion of all my labour.

 

Ecclesiastes 3

KJV

22+ Wherefore I perceive that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?

 

Enjoy some of what you‚Äôve toiled for, ‚Äúfor who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?‚Äù 

 

Ecclesiastes 2

KJV

24+ There is nothing better for a man, than that he should eat and drink, and that he should make his soul enjoy good in his labour. This also I saw, that it was from the hand of God.

 

Pay attention to this ‚Äúthat he should make his soul enjoy good in his labour.‚Äù  (In his labor, His toil etc !) Key Word is ‚Äú labour‚Äù 

 

Ecclesiastes 3

KJV

12+ I know that there is no good in them, but for a man to rejoice, and to do good in his life.

13+ And also that every man should eat and drink, and enjoy the good of all his labour, it is the gift of God.

 

22+ Wherefore I perceive that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?

 

Ecclesiastes 8

KJV

15+ Then I commended mirth, because a man hath no better thing under the sun, than to eat, and to drink, and to be merry: for that shall abide with him of his labour the days of his life, which God giveth him under the sun.

 

Ecclesiastes 5

KJV

18+ Behold that which I have seen: it is good and comely for one to eat and to drink, and to enjoy the good of all his labour that he taketh under the sun all the days of his life, which God giveth him: for it is his portion.

 

Time and space will fail me, this is sufficient to establish the fact that we must labor and enjoy the fruits thereof! For we shall certainly not take anything with us. 

 

Whatever you do people will talk about you, if you are poor or rich they will talk about you, do not let this prevent you from enjoying whatever God has blessed you with through your labor.

title: A Generous Heart: What It Looks Like!
text:
A Generous Heart: What It Looks Like! 

2 Samuel 24:24 

NIV

[24] But the king replied to Araunah, ‚ÄúNo, I insist on paying you for it. I will not sacrifice to the Lord my God burnt offerings that cost me nothing.‚Äù So David bought the threshing floor and the oxen and paid fifty shekels of silver for them.

 

A generous heart is a heart that loves beyond measure, a heart that goes the extra mile and this is what David demonstrated as recorded above. 

 

Ordinarily, anyone in his shoes would accept Araunah‚Äôs offer or gift, but David knowing what He intended to use the property for, declined. 

 

Instead of accepting a gift he insisted on paying because the property was meant for the service of God. David wants to feel it deep down in his heart that he made a sacrifice. 

 

He wants to demonstrate to God his personal deep appreciation of whatever God has done for him! Such thoughts and acts come from people who remember where they are coming from, and who helped bring them to their present status. 

 

I‚Äôve seen, read or heard of people who in their bid to show their deep appreciation to someone who has been a source of great blessing to them either build a house, buy a car, sponsor a trip /holiday etc these they do from their toil and labor. 

 

But why, some may ask! Well, there is a feeling of inner joy, and satisfaction that one has done something. I remember on my return from studies abroad I looked out for the man whose nurturing, guidance etc facilitated my winning the scholarship that took me abroad.

 

It took me a long search and inquiry to find him because he had retired from public service and no one knew his whereabouts! I could have given up the search and excused my conscience since there was no clue to finding him. 

 

But I was determined to show my gratitude since whatever I‚Äôve become was a result of his coming into my life. The transformation my life went through I owe it to him. 

 

It is important to note,  it is God who does everything but He does them through humans! God answers prayers, yes he does it through the agency of Man so it is not a sin to thank anyone through whom God answered our prayers! 

 

The case of the Ten Lepers reminds us of the lesson of gratitude! 

 

Anyway, the key lesson from David‚Äôs example is we must show our appreciation to God in a way or manner that will make us feel we have done something! A memorial!

 

There was a time when a prophet told some who faced a similar situation;

Micah 6:6-8 

NIV

With what shall I come before the LORD and bow down before the exalted God? Shall I come before him with burnt offerings, with calves a year old? [7] Will the LORD be pleased with thousands of rams, with ten thousand rivers of olive oil? Shall I offer my firstborn for my transgression, the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?

 

Read what they were told and asked to do, ( obedience ) 

[8] He has shown you, O mortal, what is good. And what does the LORD require of you? To act justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly with your God.

 

Here are some examples of what we can do from David‚Äôs account as read above. He was buying the property to be developed as a place to house an altar for God! 

 

2 Samuel 24:25 

NIV

[25] David built an altar to the Lord there and sacrificed burnt offerings and fellowship offerings. Then the Lord answered his prayer in behalf of the land, and the plague on Israel was stopped.

 

We can do the same, by buying pews, chairs, Bibles, pulpits etc; artefacts for use by the church. Whatever one can think of as a show of one‚Äôs appreciation for what God has done 

 

Have you not read or heard of someone building a house for his parents as a show of gratitude? A thing of value that cost them a lot yet they did it. 

 

What have you done for God, or for someone who has greatly impacted and transformed your life? Something you did and felt satisfied in spirit. 

 

‚ÄúRemember your class one teacher‚Äù was an inscription I read written on a trotro many years ago! Another was ‚Äú Girl b√Æ Nt√Æ!‚Äù all meant to direct our thoughts and a debt of gratitude! 

 

Do you have a heart of gratitude, let it be seen through your deeds. A generous heart is a sacrificing heart!  A heart that appreciates and does not take things for granted. 

 

My Random thoughts!

title: Is It Possible: Demon In A Believer?
text:
Is It Possible: Demon In A Believer? 

Ephesians 6

KJV

12+ For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places.

 

I‚Äôve been asked on several occasions by many if there can be any in the church who dabble in spiritism? Or possessed? I must confess this is a difficult question to answer, even if answered many will not understand! As a result, I‚Äôve always shied away from answering. 

 

What makes it a difficult question is the fact that a believer has the Holy Spirit living in Him! And the Holy Spirit can not coexist with an Evil spirit. 

 

I admit this to be true. It is the ideal situation ordinarily that should be the case, however, the reality is far from the ideal. It is not every Believer who has fully yielded ( surrendered) his/her life to the control of the Holy Spirit!

 

We see this by observing the life/activities etc of professing members. I must admit surrendering fully to the Holy Spirit‚Äôs control and guidance is a ‚Äú battle ‚Äú! 

 

There is always an ongoing ‚Äú civil war ‚Äú in every Believer. It is a daily constant battle. Victory in this battle is not absolute as it is progressive, won little by little! 

 

Some have won their battle with the spirit of ‚Äú envy, hate, gossip, rumour, lying, anger, greed, etc etc   Do take stock of which battles you‚Äôve won, and which you are still battling. 

 

Regarding the question, here is my blunt answer! . My outright answer is yes! A believer can have the spirit of ‚Äúspiritism‚Äù though he/she is in the church.  

 

But what is ‚Äú spiritism?‚Äù The Word is an ‚Äúumbrella‚Äù word underneath which are every form of spiritual acts/practices/attitudes that are contrary to the recommended acts/practices/attitudes of the Holy Spirit. 

 

This is a simple layman‚Äôs definition for discussion purposes. Time and space will not allow me to list these acts but they are found on the pages of scriptures! 

 

‚ÄúSpiritism‚Äù is a negative word! Any anti-godly ( ungodly) behaviour initiated, guided and controlled by  Evil Spirits. 

 

To repeat, any spiritual practice/behaviour that is contrary to that initiated, influenced and directed by the Holy Spirit is ‚Äú spiritism‚Äù and is evil 

 

By this broad-based definition, it follows that any act/practice etc undertaken by a believer which is contrary to scripture is an act/practice initiated, influenced and guided by Satan -spiritism. 

 

So to the question ‚Äú can there be a church member who dabbles in spiritism? The answer is yes! 

There is this term ‚Äú works of the flesh‚Äù an umbrella word which covers acts/practices etc, that are contrary to ‚Äú works of the spirit‚Äù   

 

Paul in  Romans and Galatians identified and listed these ! Read them for yourself. Among the list you‚Äôll find these ‚Äúenvy idolatry witchcraft; hatred, discord, jealousy, fits of rage, selfish ambition, dissensions, factions‚Äù

 

Can we rule out ( deny) that we don‚Äôt see or feel the presence of these in our gatherings? We do. 

 

People with evil spirits ( the listed ) do frequent and worship with us! 

 

There is a similar occurrence in a Synagogue during Jesus‚Äô time. 

Mark 1:23-26

NIV

[23] Just then a man in their synagogue who was possessed by an impure spirit cried out, [24] ‚ÄúWhat do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are---the Holy One of God!‚Äù

 

[25] ‚ÄúBe quiet!‚Äù said Jesus sternly. ‚ÄúCome out of him!‚Äù [26] The impure spirit shook the man violently and came out of him with a shriek.

 

Did you notice where he was? In the Synagogue of all places. So do not underestimate the spiritual war we are fighting, the enemies are ‚Äúboth from within and without‚Äù. Of the two, the most subtle and dangerous is the one from within! This is because they have ‚Äú free and unlimited access to you‚Äù so they can strike you down at any time 

 

Pray for the spirit of enlightenment that your spiritual eyes will be illuminated! 

 

‚ÄúFor our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the powers of this dark world and against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms.‚Äù

 

These manifest themselves through human agents. Some of whom can be found among us! 

 

My take

title: What Shall Be!: My Random Thoughts.
text:
What Shall Be!: My Random Thoughts. 

Job 8

KJV

9+ (For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days upon earth are a shadow:)

 

Ecclesiastes 6

KJV

12+ For who knoweth what is good for man in this life, all the days of his vain life which he spendeth as a shadow? for who can tell a man what shall be after him under the sun?

 

Ecclesiastes 9

KJV

5+ For the living know that they shall die: but the dead know not any thing, neither have they any more a reward; for the memory of them is forgotten.

 

Growing up, I‚Äôve always wondered if the Dead see what takes place after they are gone. I‚Äôm not alone in thinking about this question. Opinions are divided; some say yes, while others say no. 

 

Admittedly, this is a question with diverse answers, those who answer yes, tell us they speak from experience! Those who answer in the negative also say they speak from experience, these make the point that if it‚Äôs true then why have things gone bad when the dead could have intervened? Hmmm, 

 

I took time to read, observe and study what happens when loved ones pass away, and from experience, the above verses sum up what transpires! ‚ÄúFor who can tell a man what shall be after him under the sun? ‚Äúfor the memory of them is forgotten.‚Äù ! 

 

Hard truths that the we must hear and let it guide the steps we take and the things we do! 

 

The Gas have a proverb which says ‚Äú ben√Æ af√ª Afuts√®, b√® Afuts√® k√¥ l√® h√ª enkwe√¥‚Äù to wit ‚Äú as a humpback is being buried, another humpback should watch and take note‚Äù. 

 

We the living are witnesses to what happens after the departed are buried, we know the quarrels, misunderstandings, the fights over property etc on one hand. 

 

On the other hand, we‚Äôve also seen the unity, love, strong bonding, peace etc that characterized the family of some deceased. Both scenarios are unknown to the deceased! 

 

The purpose of this article is to highlight the need to prepare ‚Äú our backs‚Äù before we exit. Prepare yourself every day since death is sudden and strikes without giving us notice! 

 

Make it a daily routine to always be at peace with all. Avoid contentions and quarrels; be willing to let go no matter what ‚Äúhurt‚Äù or  ‚Äúharm‚Äù has been done! In death there is no reconciliation, we reconcile while we live and breathe! 

 

So, yes see the offence, hear the lies told, let them shun you ( though they are not in any way better off than you !) in all these turn a blind eye and deaf ears. Always walk away with a smile on your face! Not because, but because! 

 

Always have a clear conscience, and keep your distance lest you contaminate your spirit! After all any meeting with such people is temporary and do not last long. 

 

Use every occasional meeting to demonstrate your peaceful heart /mind and contentment! Enjoy the moment as you focus on positive things that are taking place at the gathering! Laugh if you must, and can till you drop dead! 

 

The second lesson we learn is that we,  like the dead shall soon be forgotten! We see this a few minutes after the deceased is lowered into the grave and mourners return from the cemetery.  

 

The atmosphere changes and it would look like the mourners are saying to themselves ‚ÄúOh what a good riddance ‚Äú! Yes, from that very hour, your memory begins to fade! 

 

We see this after one year, ask yourself how many return to visit the departed at his ‚Äúnew residence‚Äù -the Cemetery? It is declared a ‚Äúno-go area‚Äù to the majority!

Compare the number of people who were at the funeral to that present at the one-year remembrance! 

 

This should tell the living that they are fading away from people‚Äôs memories! The number present at the yearly remembrances dwindles with time ; and so is your memory. 

 

So if you want to know what the state of things would be after you are gone here it is in a summary. If this is what will be, then know how you live. 

 

Enjoy the present, make the most out of every encounter. Avoid the vexations of life, which unfortunately are many. Let me conclude with these admonishments; 

 

Hebrews 12

KJV

14+ Follow peace with all men, and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord:

 

Romans 14

KJV

19+ Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another

 

Finally, in all things ; 

Hebrews 13

KJV

1+ Let brotherly love continue.

 

Random thoughts indeed!

title: The Power And Influence Of Music: In Praise Of Singers.
text:
The Power And Influence Of Music: In Praise Of Singers. 

Revelation 14

KJV

1+ And I looked, and, lo, a Lamb stood on the mount Sion, and with him an hundred forty and four thousand, having his Father's name written in their foreheads.

 

2 And I heard a voice from heaven, as the voice of many waters, and as the voice of a great thunder: and I heard the voice of harpers harping with their harps:

 

3+ And they sung as it were a new song before the throne, and before the four beasts, and the elders: and no man could learn that song but the hundred and forty and four thousand, which were redeemed from the earth.

 

What you‚Äôve read is a very impressive assembly and event that John was privileged to see! I have no time nor interest in the technical discourse or meaning but rather in the literal image and scene. 

 

Not that I can not explain these, any Bible student knows what these represent. I just want to literally enjoy and feel the scene! It is awesome to see.  

 

In any case here is why I quoted the passage. Yesterday we read of the death of a great icon whose music influenced and gave hope, joy and meaning to many a downhearted. Jimmy Cliff was his name. 

 

His songs covered many themes in life, from ‚Äú Vietnam‚Äù, to Suffering In The Land, To I Can See Clearly Now! Etc. Not forgetting ‚Äú you can get it if you really want ‚Äú and of course ‚Äú the harder they come, the harder the fall ‚Äú. Yes, this was arguably the best of the singers of his generation! The lyrics of his songs are unsurpassed!

 

Jimmy Cliff blessed our hearts with songs that resonate with human situations! I am reminded of the words in the hymn ‚ÄúNow Praise We Great And Famous Men‚Äù. Two verses read ;

 

2 Praise we the wise and brave and strong,

Who graced their generation;

Who helped the right, and fought the wrong,

And made our folk a nation.

The command to ‚Äú speak to one another through songs hymns ‚Äú etc cuts across and is not limited to the spiritual but equally to the social settings 

 

The scripture passages above present us with a pictorial view of a large number assembled to sing.  We are told they sang a song that no man knows   This probably is a large group of singers and their voices alone can shake a foundation! How I‚Äôll love to hear them sing.  

 

Read it,

NIV

[3] And they sang a new song before the throne and before the four living creatures and the elders. No one could learn the song except the 144,000 who had been redeemed from the earth.

 

As stated I  am not concerned with the ‚Äúnumber‚Äù who sang but the fact that they sang a song that no one could learn! What could this song be? We are told. What were the words? We are not told.!

 

We are told of another gathering where they sang the song of Moses and the Lamb! At least it seems here we were given the words of this song

Revelation 15:3-4

‚ÄúGreat and marvelous are your deeds, Lord God Almighty. Just and true are your ways, King of the nations.[4] Who will not fear you, Lord, and bring glory to your name? For you alone are holy. All nations will come and worship before you, for your righteous acts have been revealed.‚Äù

 

Definitely, He who sits on the throne will enjoy it. 

 

I have cause to believe that my opening scriptures inspired the popular hymn; On Glorious Summit Stood! 

 

On Zion‚Äôs glorious summit stood

I heard the song, and strove to join,

I heard the song, and strove to join.
