title: Sightseeing: Be Careful, A Testimony
text:
Matthew 4
KJV
5+ Then the devil taketh him up into the holy city, and setteth him on a pinnacle of the temple,


Scriptures record a time in Jesus‚Äô life when the Devil organised a sightseeing tour for Him! It was a memorable tour, as it was well-planned, and the sights and sounds of the places and items on display were attractive.

 

Sightseeing tours are well-organised trips by event planners with the intention to selling or promoting goods, which are often vanity products. Unfortunately, most people fall for them because of the way they are packaged.

 

This was the same approach the Devil used on Jesus. Read how it went; he packaged evil in a manner as to look good, attractive and desirable. 
Matthew 4:3 
NIV
[3] The tempter came to him and said, ‚ÄúIf you are the Son of God, tell these stones to become bread.‚Äù

 

Matthew 4:5 
NIV
[5] Then the devil took him to the holy city and had him stand on the highest point of the temple

.

Matthew 4:8 
NIV
[8] Again, the devil took him to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their splendour.

 

A very impressive sightseeing tour full of grandiose sights and sounds which any man would love to see and experience!

 

All that glitters is not gold we are told by the Sages, yet most fall for lack of discernment, vigilance and scrutiny.

 

What can we learn from these, a lot; not all that we see is genuine! Not all that you hear is true! Not all who follow us are sincere! Not all who pledge their loyalty to you are genuine! Not every invitation is an honour. Not every gift comes from a sincere heart!  
 

A tall list of lessons but these suffice to help us identify the dangers inherent in the sightseeing tour we‚Äôve embarked on while here on Earth.

 

For failure to discern many are living with regrets, the common expression on their lips is ‚Äú if only I  had known, if only I had listened and taken the advice given; if only!  If only! If only! ‚Äú

It is not everything that organisers and operators present to us that is genuine !!!

 

On a serious note, we are here on a ‚Äú sightseeing tour‚Äù not every item/agenda etc presented to us is genuine or helpful. Not every account or story we are told is true or accurate, most are embellished exaggerations! Others are outright lies

 

We have to examine everything carefully so we do not live to regret later. To recap; not every friend is sincere, not every gift is from a genuine heart, not every invitation is an honour. Not every smile is genuine. Not every handshake or embrace is genuine.

 

Just as the Lord discerned and rejected what was presented to Him by the devil even so must we. Do not be misled by the applause if in doubt ask the baby mosquito what her mum told her when she returned from her maiden sightseeing tour.

 

The baby mosquito misread, mistook etc the effort to kill her when her killers clapped their hands when she passed by them! She thought it was admiration and honour. Not until her mum told her what it meant.

 

Is she alone in this? No! Many living today mistake the applause of their disguised enemies to mean endorsements, only to regret it later.   It was Wilson Pickett (late) who sang a song titled ‚Äú Don‚Äôt Let the green grass fool you, don‚Äôt let it change your mind ‚Äú

 

Beloved when you read the account of the temptation of Jesus as recorded, see it as a ‚Äú sightseeing tour‚Äù the Devil gave Jesus. The same way he is taking many today on sightseeing!

 

Beware not to be deceived by the niceties of life, nor the admirations of insincere people. They are concealed traps waiting to snap you.

 

A word to the wise

title: Could This Be True Of Our Time?
text:
Could This Be True Of Our Time?

Jeremiah 31

KJV

29+ In those days they shall say no more, The fathers have eaten a sour grape, and the children's teeth are set on edge.

 

The context of this statement has to do with suffering for the sins of another, a thought that was dominant in Israel at the time. It was a ‚Äúblame game‚Äù statement where succeeding generations blame their predecessors. 

 

Though God told the Israelites not to repeat this ‚Äú proverb ‚Äú anymore but instead focus on how they live since each shall bear the consequences of his wrongs, it can not be denied that the ‚Äúproverb‚Äù originated from the Realities they were experiencing. 

 

The opportunities that were missed by previous generations, which imposed untold misery and suffering on them gave birth to what became a ‚Äú proverb‚Äù 

 

We do or say the same today. Have we not as a church blamed past generations for the sufferings we are experiencing today? 

 

For example, we are finding it difficult to get land to construct meeting places in the cities. Even when we get it, we are unable to buy because of the high cost! 

 

At the time when the work began, Land was available and lowly priced in areas which have now developed into cities. Many have accused our forebears of not being proactive, which is the same as saying ‚Äú the fathers have eaten sour grapes and the children‚Äôs teeth are set on edge. ‚Äú. 

 

Look at the difficulties the majority are going through to purchase land let alone build meeting places. Look at the appeals and the responses. Etc. Are we not repeating the same mistakes we accuse our predecessors of making? We are! 

 

A sad and very disappointing picture we are painting. Surely generations after us will say the same about us, as we see opportunities passing by and we are unable to seize them. 

 

But what is our hindrance? Is it the lack of funds? Not at all, it is our lack of unity! It is a leadership failure. It is organisational failure!. It is fear! It is a lack of understanding of what we can do as a collective; without violating any biblical principles. The list of what is holding us back is a tall one. 

 

During my active duty, several meetings have been held with the view to finding solutions to this challenge. Agreements, proposals, plans etc were discussed and agreed. What was lacking was implementation! 

 

In the secular world this would be described as lacking the ‚Äú political will‚Äù whereas in the religious,   it is the lack of ‚Äú spiritual will‚Äù. To lack the ‚Äú political will‚Äù is to be vision-deficient. To lack the ‚Äúspiritual will‚Äù is to lack love for God‚Äôs mission/business on Earth. Love-deficient!

 

Remember Jesus‚Äô answer to his parents when they came looking for him when he was declared and reported as missing! 

 

Read it 

Luke 2

KJV

49+ And he said unto them, How is it that ye sought me? wist ye not that I must be about my Father's business?

 

Interestingly his parents, just like us did not understand what he meant by ‚Äú my Father‚Äôs business!‚Äù  

Read it ;

50 And they understood not the saying which he spake unto them.

 

Are we missing something here? Why could He not use any other word than ‚Äú business ‚Äú to describe what He was engaged in? And why did He describe it as ‚Äú Father‚Äôs Business?‚Äù 

Could it be that we‚Äôve not fully studied let alone understood what the Church of God is on Earth? I think we haven‚Äôt fully grasped the meaning and purpose. If we do then our approach will not be as it is. 

 

Just look at how we approach our personal businesses and compare them with that of the church! Here is where the leadership failure mentioned earlier comes to the fore. If leaders understood the church as the  ‚Äú Father‚Äôs business ‚Äú their approach would not be as we see today. 

 

So yes, as we say about our predecessors, the same shall be said of us. , 'The parents have eaten sour grapes, and the children's teeth are set on edge.'

 

To avoid this indictment the solutions lie in collective decision,  collective action! A few will have to set the pace ; since we can not get all to see and feel the humiliation that we‚Äôve found ourselves in. 

 

There was, is and will always be the ‚Äú anti-collectivist‚Äù group as was the case in the time of Nehemiah; no matter what we must start from somewhere. 

 

A thought to share. Lamentations of a veteran soldier.

title: What I‚Äôve Learnt As I Grow Older!
text:
What I‚Äôve Learnt As I Grow Older! 

Proverbs 1

KJV

8+ My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

 

In life, only a few were privileged to sit at the feet of their parents to be told (taught) what life is about. The majority were compelled to learn the hard way, some deliberately, while others did so through circumstances beyond their control. 

 

Growing up, I heard a proverb that stuck with me. It says ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt have a father and by chance you happen to be walking behind a window and hear a father admonishing his son, stop and listen! ‚Äú 

 

‚ÄúEavesdropping‚Äù is what this is called, and it is highly recommended for good purposes; the unfortunate thing is majority eavesdrop on bad stories ( toli) instead of the good. I hereby share with you some ‚Äúeavesdropping‚Äù lessons and personal life experiences I gathered! 

 

That things will ‚Äúfall apart‚Äù in life is a certainty, so prepare for it. All will not be rosy in life is an undeniable fact, for every life must of necessity go through turbulences! 

 

Develop and nurture a strong character and mindset that will carry you through the ups and downs. You‚Äôll need these to go through this journey called life. A strong and resilient mindset and spirit. 

 

There will be moments of joy and moments of sorrow, moments of pain and moments of pleasure, cries and laughter! In short, none is immune to the ups and downs associated with life! Just like how not every visitor is welcomed into our lives even so are some encounters we experience in life! 

 

There will be a time when you‚Äôll be relevant and another when you‚Äôll not, know this and learn to live with it when that time comes. 

 

If you‚Äôre left out of plans, programs and invitations do not complain. Adopt the policy ‚Äú if not invited, don‚Äôt go‚Äù   If not told, don‚Äôt ask! Here is how you‚Äôll maintain your sanity and peace. It is not every place you must desire to be, and not every thing you should hear or know! Do not attempt to play God! ! 

 

There will be a time when you‚Äôll be loved, and there will be a time when you‚Äôll be despised and hated! The very people who today lay their garments down for you to walk on, are the same people who will pull the same garments from under your feet in the next few years. ! So learn to walk on either red, green or bare floor! Be content in and with whatever situation /circumstance you‚Äôll find yourself in.

 

( On my occasional morning walks I see some co-walkers, walk barefoot!) 

 

There will be a time when you‚Äôll be surrounded by many, and a time when only a few or none will be with you. So learn and practice how to be lonely! After all, you came alone and will go alone! 

 

Learn not to play to the gallery, for the same gallery that enjoyed your play is the same that will condemn it when they find another player! So, do not trust or relish the applause of the gallery! Loyalty is a prostitute product which is sold and bought!  

 

Even scriptures speak to this ; 

Psalms 118

KJV

8 It is better to trust in the Lord than to put confidence in man.9+ It is better to trust in the Lord than to put confidence in princes.

 

Jeremiah 17:5 

NIV

[5] This is what the Lord says: ‚ÄúCursed is the one who trusts in man, who draws strength from mere flesh and whose heart turns away from the Lord.

 

Overly dependence on man is what is meant , this the wise must take to heart when dealing with Man! Do not be pessimistic but be optimistic in life. It is not all about ‚Äú pessimism ‚Äú but also ‚Äú optimism ‚Äú. Balance. 

 

These I wished I had known earlier! And like the proverb writer said ; the same I say to you who read this article; 

 

Proverbs 4

KJV

10+ Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.

 

A word to the wise! 

 

 

.

title: For The Elect‚Äôs Sake!
text:
For The Elect‚Äôs Sake! 

Mark 13

KJV

20+ And except that the Lord had shortened those days, no flesh should be saved: but for the elect's sake, whom he hath chosen, he hath shortened the days.

 

That God is aware of whatever we go through is an undeniable fact, a truth confirmed by the above passage. In trials and temptations, He intervenes by shortening the duration and impact these have on His chosen ones. 

 

Also, it is a fact that when He pours out His wrath, we, His chosen ones, are not immune; we are equally affected. Take the case of Elijah, when he declared that there would be no rain, this also affected Him! 

 

But true to His Word, He made a way of escape for Elijah   Read it; 

1 Kings 17:1-4 

NIV

[1] Now Elijah the Tishbite, from Tishbe in Gilead, said to Ahab, ‚ÄúAs the Lord, the God of Israel, lives, whom I serve, there will be neither dew nor rain in the next few years except at my word.‚Äù

 

[2] Then the word of the Lord came to Elijah: [3] ‚ÄúLeave here, turn eastward and hide in the Kerith Ravine, east of the Jordan

 

. [4] You will drink from the brook, and I have directed the ravens to supply you with food there.‚Äù

 

The lesson is summed up in the words of Paul ; 

Philippians 4

KJV

12+ I know both how to be abased, and I know how to abound: everywhere and in all things I am instructed both to be full and to be hungry, both to abound and to suffer need.

 

Beloved, there will be times of ‚Äú abundance ‚Äú and times of ‚Äú need‚Äù   This was what Elijah learnt through experience and so did the Apostle Paul. 

 

When calamity befalls a nation or a people it affects God‚Äôs children also; the only difference is  He cushions them! He made birds with little beaks feed Elijah, the question is how much food can they carry with their beaks? But as the saying goes, half a loaf is better than none! 

 

What is more, He made Elijah live on ‚Äúcharity‚Äù , none but a widow with little resources was his source of support and sustenance. A situation any once well-to-do person will reject, but not Elijah!  The Apostle Paul also lived on charity as he recounted in the following scriptures ;

 

2 Corinthians 11:9 

NIV

[9] And when I was with you and needed something, I was not a burden to anyone, for the brothers who came from Macedonia supplied what I needed. I have kept myself from being a burden to you in any way and will continue to do so.

 

Beloved, the lesson is clear as a child of God learn to live a humble life so that if it comes to eating garri you‚Äôll eat it joyfully! If it came to receiving help from the ordinary, you‚Äôll do so cheerfully and thankfully. 

 

As was the case with Elijah, the duration of suffering was shortened, yes for the elect‚Äôs sake God will do the same for us. Suffering will not be long nor will it last forever! What we need to do is to wait patiently on the Lord! 

 

We are not immune to suffering just like the rest of mankind, as Isaiah said we shall walk through fire, rivers and waters just like others; the only difference is He has His Hand on the thermostat 

 

Isaiah 43

KJV

2+ When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee; and through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame kindle upon thee.

 

Yes for the sake of the Elect, God will make a way for us where there is none! There will be lights off in the Land, but He will let the Moon shine brighter to lighten our homes! 

 

He did to Israel when they were in Egypt ;

Exodus 10

KJV

22 And Moses stretched forth his hand toward heaven; and there was a thick darkness in all the land of Egypt three days:

23 They saw not one another, neither rose any from his place for three days: but all the children of Israel had light in their dwellings.

 

Yes, the taps may not flow for a time but He will make sure the little we have will take us far if we use it wisely. He will let water come to us from sources we least expect! As He did to Israel in the wilderness and to Elijah the same He will do to us.!  

 

When we least expect that‚Äôs when He acts so we trust and glorify His Name. What are you going through, it will not last long for the sake of the Elect He will shorten the duration! 

 

This is a true testimony confirmed by many; beloved your redemption is nearer than you think. Just keep faith in God. Yes after the rain comes the sun. 

 

As was sung by Johnny Nash ‚Äú I can see clearly now, the rain is gone ... I can see all obstacles in my way ... Gone are the dark clouds that had me blind ... It's gonna be a bright (bright), sun shiny day! 

 

Endure. Endure. Endure! Hold on! 

 

A faith to share.

title: Generational Signs To Watch: How We Got To Where We Are Today!
text:
Generational Signs To Watch: How We Got To Where We Are Today! 

 

Proverbs 30

Kjv

11 There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.

12 There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, and yet is not washed from their filthiness.

13+ There is a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.

 

Historians have identified and taught us the causes of the decline and fall of civilisations! They‚Äôve made us understand that it is not external forces (attacks) that bring down societies and, by extension, civilisations, but instead internal rot and decay, especially moral decadence. 

 

What you‚Äôve read above is a description of three types of generations, one of which lays the foundation for the other two to build upon. 

 

In one word an Indiscipline generation; A generation that cared less for or about anything! A self-centred generation you may call it and you are right. 

 

Read how it is described ‚ÄúThere is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, and yet is not washed from their filthiness‚Äù 

 

As stated above the first signs of how societies decay and fall are from the home, it starts from the home. A generation that shows no respect to the elderly,( father /mother) speaks and talks anyhow, a lawless generation is what you see painted by these words. 

 

A generation that sees and regards the elderly as their co-equals. When there is a breakdown of law and order in the home it seeps into society, and gradually like a cancer works it‚Äôs way through the fabric of society only to become the norm. 

 

It is a fact that , society‚Äôs moral value is the total of individual moralities put together! So, how the home goes so goes society! 

 

The next stage of societal decay and collapse is brought about by a stubborn generation; one that would not take no for an answer, wise in their own eyes, thinking and understanding therefore needs no guidance! 

 

A generation that disrespects and disregards established norms, structures and time-tested virtues that hold society together; both morally and spiritually! 

 

Our society is at a moral crossroads, and the signs mentioned above are evident, it‚Äôs been there for all to see. In every sphere of life, we see these manifesting themselves. In the name of ‚Äú liberal democracy‚Äù, the foundations have been laid for the destruction of the moral, cultural and spiritual values that once held us together as a people

 

People have praised and upheld the country of Singapore as a well-disciplined society, but how they came to be that is unknown to most people! Singaporeans themselves attribute this state of affairs to their founding President Lee Kuan Yew!  A strict disciplinarian par excellence! 

 

In short, the value of leadership is what this teaches. Leadership at home, workplace, church etc are key to upholding principles and values! Lead by example is the rule. 

 

Proverbs 22:6 

NIV

Start children off on the way they should go, and even when they are old they will not turn from it.

 

This is a bottom-up and not top-down approach; the earlier the training in rightness is started the better and brighter the future looks. This is why we must lay emphasis on early childhood training! As the saying goes ‚Äú you can not teach an old dog a new trick‚Äù. 

 

Also, a bent-down tree can not be straightened! If you want straighten am Igo Welenga, or sangula ( Rokafil  jazz!) 

 

Ecclesiastes 1:15 

NIV

‚ÄúWhat is crooked cannot be straightened; ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äú

If you are now beginning to build a home then take note of these! Lay a strong uncompromising foundation for the next generation you have before you today. You‚Äôll reap what you sow! 

 

These are the Lamentations of an older man as he looks back!

title: Which Of Us Will Make It?
text:
Which Of Us Will Make It?

Matthew 24:40-42 

NIV

[40] Two men will be in the field; one will be taken and the other left. [41] Two women will be grinding with a hand mill; one will be taken and the other left.

 

[42] ‚ÄúTherefore keep watch, because you do not know on what day your Lord will come.

 

From time to time some scriptures do ‚Äútrouble‚Äù my mind one of them is what you‚Äôve read. Two men working in a field, one taken the other left! 

 

Two women engaged in a household chore, only for one to be taken, while the other was left behind. This is what we are told it shall be the Day the Lord returns. 

 

The question is why is it so? Though we are not told what the reason(s) were we can speculate freely. In my opinion, it has to do simply with ‚Äúincompatibility! ‚Äú

 

The listed persons though engaged in similar activities yet they were not on good terms with each other. A situation similar to what Paul mentioned in a church! 

Philippians 4

KJV

2+ I beseech Euodias, and beseech Syntyche, that they be of the same mind in the Lord.

 

These two sisters of great repute in the local assembly were ‚Äú incompatible ‚Äú with each other. The Apostle Paul knowing that one Day ‚Äú one shall be taken and the other left‚Äù asked that they should be assisted to iron out their differences so as to be ‚Äú compatible ‚Äú!  

 

They were incompatible on earth which Incompatibility is unacceptable in Heaven! Here are two persons who never lived or strived to be at peace with themselves yet how can they live together peaceably in Heaven? Paul knew what would befall them. 

 

Heaven is a place for the ‚Äúcompatibles‚Äù so if here on Earth we are ‚Äúincompatible‚Äù with each other such a state of things will not be allowed in Heaven. One of us shall be disqualified!   

 

This explains why one was taken and the other left behind! If I am not on speaking terms with you, how will that change should we be admitted into Heaven? 

 

If we don‚Äôt get along with each other here on Earth, will that change when we enter Heaven? Will we not continue with it there? In Heaven of all places? 

 

O please let‚Äôs face the facts and be truthful to ourselves! We can not pretend not to know that these exist! Let us help the ‚ÄúEuodias‚Äô‚Äù and Syntyches‚Äô  in our local assemblies to be compatible with each other. Else the Day comes when one will be taken and the other left! 

 

Between the two mentioned in the above opening scriptures, God knows the guilty and the innocent. He will therefore take the innocent and leave the guilty. This is what the verses indicate. 

 

May we remind ourselves of the warning and caution left to us by the Holy Spirit speaking through the Hebrew writer ; 

Hebrews 12

KJV

14+ Follow peace with all men, and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord:

 

You may ask but how was this possible? Well, the Judge knew which of the two was innocent! The Judge knew the secrets of our hearts hence the decision to take one and leave the other 

 

Read it; 

1 Corinthians 4:5 

NIV

[5] Therefore judge nothing before the appointed time; wait until the Lord comes. He will bring to light what is hidden in darkness and will expose the motives of the heart. At that time each will receive their praise from God.

 

Romans 2

KJV

16+ In the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel.

 

The truth of a matter may not be known to men ( even if known they may be biased ) so they may ignorantly ( or biased) judge and pronounce in your favor ; but not so with God. Men may judge in your favor, but not God. 

 

This is what makes many believe that ‚Äú there will be surprises in Heaven!‚Äù  The innocent here on Earth shall be pronounced guilty and the guilty, innocent on that Day! 

 

For now, some may think they are ‚Äúinnocent‚Äù because men said so, but wait to the end! 

 

Are you falsely accused, condemned, etc? Painful as it is, wait patiently; as Paul recommended to the brethren; 

 

2 Thessalonians 1

KJV

7+ And to you who are troubled rest with us, when the Lord Jesus shall be revealed from heaven with his mighty angels,

 

Yes, two shall be in one congregation, but one shall be taken the other left! Indeed many are called but few shall make it. It is not enough to cry, lord! Lord! 

 

Beloved, do not be misled, deceived etc, by the applause and pronouncements of fallible men! Examine your own conscience and be your own judge. Repent and seek reconciliation before that Day comes suddenly on you‚Äú when one shall be taken and the other left ‚Äú. 

 

Do all that is possible while you live and breathe so you‚Äôll be the one to be taken! How sad it would be to be the one to be left after all these years in the church! 

 

Read these ; 

1 Peter 3:10-12 

NIV

[10] For, ‚ÄúWhoever would love life and see good days must keep their tongue from evil and their lips from deceitful speech. [11] They must turn from evil and do good; they must seek peace and pursue it. 

 

[12] For the eyes of the Lord are on the righteous and his ears are attentive to their prayer, but the face of the Lord is against those who do evil.‚Äù

 

Romans 12

KJV

18+ If it be possible, as much as lieth in you, live peaceably with all men.

 

Romans 14

KJV

19+ Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another.

 

2 John 1:8 

NIV

[8] Watch out that you do not lose what we have worked for, but that you may be rewarded fully.

 

Truths to share with you! A word to the wise!

title: Celebrate Life And Not Death!
text:
Celebrate Life And Not Death! 

Isaiah 38

KJV

18+ For the grave cannot praise thee, death can not celebrate thee: they that go down into the pit cannot hope for thy truth.

 

It is now a fact that each Saturday is a Funeral Day, a day set aside to finally bid farewell to the dead. Such is the acceptance and practice of the day and event that facilities are inadequate, leading to a long queue for booking. 

 

Event planning is now a lucrative business as organisers are reaping a huge harvest every weekend! 

 

That our labour and our journey here will cease one day is a fact. That one day our lips will close and refuse to open to utter a word is a fact. 

 

No one knows what his /her last words would be before he/she takes his/her bow! That no one knows who his/her last visitors would be before he/she makes his/her exit is a fact. 

 

These are mysteries that we can not fathom, and it is for this reason that at the close of each day we make checks and contacts with loved ones before going to bed, for it may be our last encounter. 

 

And also, it is for this reason that we should speak kind and encouraging words to one another before we part company anytime we meet.  

 

On Saturday I joined a sizable crowd of mourners at a remembrance service for a cousin who passed away last year. It was brief and very solemn! 

 

Interestingly I was with her a few weeks before she passed. I visited and sat with her and had a long chat full of fun and laughter! She was eighty.  

 

I‚Äôve always tried to recall the last words a deceased friend/brother /relative etc , said to me before exiting this life. I‚Äôve always tried to recall my last encounter, conversation etc these always make a profound impact on me! 

 

There is no praise, no celebration 

Etc in the grave where we would lie alone. Mourners and sympathisers would walk away when the last prayer is said and the earth is heaped over our coffin; and we are left in thick darkness with none to comfort or console! 

 

The cemetery then becomes our new place of ‚Äú residence ‚Äú till the trumpet shall sound to open the doors of our tombs, and we see the daylight once again though in a different form! 

 

As I walked away from the remembrance event her words, fun, jokes etc; kept reverberating and I could hear her loud and clear as if she was in my presence!  

 

We indeed celebrated her life as we recall her words, advices, jokes etc. How would we remember you? With what will we reconstruct your life among us? With me, some of my write-ups will be read, and some of my favourite sayings such as ‚Äú in the midst of fools it is foolishness to be wise!‚Äù will be mentioned. Ha ha ha! 

 

A thought to share

title: The Menace and Havoc Of Human Error.
text:
The Menace and Havoc Of Human Error. 

Genesis 16:1-2 

NIV

[1] Now Sarai, Abram's wife, had borne him no children. But she had an Egyptian slave named Hagar; [2] so she said to Abram, ‚ÄúThe Lord has kept me from having children. Go, sleep with my slave; perhaps I can build a family through her.‚Äù Abram agreed to what Sarai said.

 

The expression ‚Äú human error ‚Äú is a ‚Äúpregnant‚Äù expression or an umbrella term that covers almost every mistake made by man. What is of great worry and concern is the consequences that emanate from them 

 

The Middle East conflict that has raged throughout the centuries with no end in sight is one such consequence of ‚Äú human error ‚Äú.

 

At the root of every challenge we face in life is ‚Äúhuman error.‚Äù Many road accidents, leading to deaths and injuries, have human error as their root cause, expressed in various forms. 

 

But what is human error?  It can only be defined by these words: misjudgment, miscalculation, haste, impatience, indiscipline, disobedience, anger, envy, jealousy, greed, selfishness, etc. A tall list that time would not allow. 

 

Almost Everyman born of a woman has had his/her share of ‚Äú human error ‚Äú! Almost everything that has gone wrong with Man is a result of human error!

 

For example, Death entered the world as a result of ‚Äú human error ‚Äú. Grandpa Adam made a mistake when he ate the forbidden fruit. Grandma Eve made the mistake when she gave Audience to the devil something she should not have done. 

 

In the case of Abraham and Sarai, it was impatience, which is a human error! What about Moses , He could not enter the Promised Land but saw it only from afar because of human error -anger! 

 

What about Cain-and Abel?Human error of envy What about David and Bathsheba? Human error of lack of self-control! What about Paul and Barnabas, what led to their split? Human errors of unforgiveness, anger, nepotism etc. 

 

The list of ‚Äú what about ‚Äú is a tall one; you can add yours to it. What is it that has brought suffering to you, is it not misjudgment, impatience, envy, hidden jealousy etc? 

 

Yes, we are all one way or the other victims of human error! No one is exempt not even men of God, both past or present, each has his share of the consequences emanating from human error. Do a critical study of the lives of the men listed (except Jesus ) in the scriptures and you‚Äôll be surprised at the human errors you‚Äôll find.  

 

But can this ‚Äúdeadly disease‚Äù called ‚Äú human error ‚Äú be eradicated? The answer is simply no; it can only be ‚Äútamed‚Äù! Yes, this is true. Read the confession of one of the most gifted of God‚Äôs men, Solomon 

 

1 Kings 8

KJV

title: The Law Of Reciprocity
text:
The Law Of Reciprocity

2 Corinthians 1:3-4 

NIV

[3] Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of compassion and the God of all comfort, [4] who comforts us in all our troubles, so that we can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort we ourselves receive from God.

 

That the Universe operates on laws is an undeniable fact, a closer look at events and developments confirms this belief. 

 

You‚Äôve either seen, heard or experienced the law ‚Äú action and reaction are equal and opposite. What a man sows, the same he reaps, trees produce after their kind, What we do to others shall be done to us etc etc what goes around, comes around! These are just a few 

 

The same law of reciprocity applies concerning our spiritual lives, that we are blessed to bless, comforted to comfort, saved to save, and delivered to deliver.  

 

Regardless of what status or position we hold in life we are duty-bound to reciprocate! For example, God blesses us and we in return bless Him. The Mighty blesses the Lesser and the Lesser also blesses the Mighty   This Law applies to all and sundry. 

 

Take the example of blessing, most are ignorant of the fact that this law applies to blessings also , we‚Äôve always held the belief that only God can bless forgetting that we can and must also bless Him   Read these few verses ; 

 

Psalms 103

KJV

1+ Bless the Lord, O my soul: and all that is within me, bless his holy name.

2+ Bless the Lord, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:

 

Psalms 103

KJV

22+ Bless the Lord, all his works in all places of his dominion: bless the Lord, O my soul.

 

When we give back to God what He gave us, we are blessing Him. When we return to Him the praises He heaped on us, we are blessing Him   When we return to Him whatever He gave or do for us, we are fulfilling the Law of reciprocity

 

This is how we are kept in sync and in fellowship with God. The law of reciprocity if kept helps retain both spiritual and human relationships and makes the two bonds stronger. 

 

1 John 1

KJV

7+ But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of Jesus Christ his Son cleanseth us from all sin.

 

Ask yourself why my friendship with you is strong,  weak or nonexistent at all? It‚Äôs because we either keep and apply the Law of reciprocity or not at all! 

 

When I was down you lifted me, when you were down I lifted you. When you needed a shoulder to lean on mine was there for you! You did the same to me! 

 

In my bereavement, you were there to comfort and console me, in like manner I did the same to you in your hour of distress and discomfort. 

 

Relationships are born, nurtured, maintained and sustained to the degree that the law of reciprocity is obeyed and applied. Take it or leave this is the principle be it spiritual or physical 

 

The prophet Amos expressed the law of reciprocity in these words

Amos 3

KJV

3 Can two walk together, except they be agreed?

 

If a relationship is weak or does not exist at all, the root cause is not far check how you are applying the law of reciprocity! 

 

The greatest enemies to the law of reciprocity are selfishness, greed, envy, and hate not forgetting jealousy; where these abound this law can not work. These are toxic elements that pollute the soul and the mind.  

 

In case you‚Äôve still not grasped the meaning of the word ‚Äú reciprocity ‚Äú here it is ;  

 

‚ÄúThe definition of ‚Äúreciprocity‚Äù is a mutual exchange between at least two participants in which each party receives an immediate or future benefit‚Äù.

‚ÄúReciprocity is the exchange of favors or assistance between two or more individuals or groups with the expectation of all parties benefiting from the exchange.‚Äù 

(Source Web Dictionary)  

 

A word to the wise is enough, a phrase to a fool is meaningless!

title: The Cost Of Naivety: A Personal Confession
text:
The Cost Of Naivety: A Personal Confession 

( Part 1) 

Psalms 5

KJV

9+ For there is no faithfulness in their mouth; their inward part is very wickedness; their throat is an open sepulchre; they flatter with their tongue. 

 

For some time now I‚Äôve had some close encounters with friends who kept asking me similar questions! I don‚Äôt know why. 

 

I ask myself, is it because they think I look like someone who doesn‚Äôt have a problem, or that I was born with a silver spoon in my mouth? Surely the external evidence is there to show to the contrary. 

 

Today, there are several spoons to choose from: gold, silver, copper, bronze, and wooden. Growing up the latter ( wooden ) is used to serve salad dishes. I was not born with any of these in my mouth 

 

Is it not written,

1 Corinthians 1

KJV

27+ But God hath chosen the foolish things of the world to confound the wise; and God hath chosen the weak things of the world to confound the things which are mighty;

 

28 And base things of the world, and things which are despised, hath God chosen, yea, and things which are not, to bring to nought things that are:

29+ That no flesh should glory in his presence.

 

Such was what unfolded before the eye of Solomon that he penned his observations for posterity to take note.  Read it 

Ecclesiastes 9

KJV

11+ I returned, and saw under the sun, that the race is not to the swift, nor the battle to the strong, neither yet bread to the wise, nor yet riches to men of understanding, nor yet favour to men of skill; but time and chance happeneth to them all.

 

Yes, ‚Äú time and chance ‚Äú which translates into being ‚Äú the right person ( regardless of your birth /status) at the right place and at the right time ‚ÄúThis is all that there is when it comes to anyone God intend to bless!  Place yoursrif where the beam of light will shine on you. 

 

The world is full of evidence to confirm, support and substantiate the truth expressed by Solomon! Time and chance. ! Even you are a perfect example, time and chance lifted you to where you stand today. ! It is not your birth, lineage, status, family name, etc but ‚Äú time and chance ‚Äú. 

 

But what is the question that many have asked of me? Simple, Do I have any regrets in life? You heard it? Let me repeat it! Do I have any regrets?

 

Question number two ‚Äú If you were to start all over again are there things you‚Äôll not do? Or even if you will will you do them differently? ‚ÄúEtc. 

 

Beloved who will not admit that he/she has no regrets? To say you don‚Äôt have any is to say ‚Äú I am a cork floating on a river, directionless and clueless wherever the wind blows me that is where I go ‚Äú.  Yes there are many in this category in life. 

 

A wise man once put it like this ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt know where you are going, any road you take will lead you there ‚Äú. Which statement is true as reflected in the lives of millions of people? 

 

A clueless, purposeless and directionless person has no regrets! Does this describe you? Well, personally you may not know so ask a friend to candidly examine and evaluate your life. 

 

Before I conclude this first part let me acknowledge that whatever we call regrets are part of the Divine training process! They were meant to divinely test our resolve and state of maturity. 

 

Paul made this clear when he said ;

Romans 8

KJV

28+ And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose.

 

And ‚Äú all things ‚Äú mean all things ‚Äúbut being human some of these ‚Äú all things ‚Äú do cause or at most lead to regrets and we can not pretend that there are none!

 

Flesh and blood have regrets. Do not deceive yourself.

title: Must We Answer Every Question?: My Views
text:
Must We Answer Every Question?: My Views 

Isaiah 53

KJV

7+ He was oppressed, and he was afflicted, yet he opened not his mouth: he is brought as a lamb to the slaughter, and as a sheep before her shearers is dumb, so he openeth not his mouth.

 

With age comes maturity, which is a truth hidden from the unwise. With age comes wisdom. With age comes refinement! These are profound observations that most treat with disbelief and contempt. 

 

When I was young many who knew me will attest that I was a ‚Äú revolutionary ‚Äú ( and still am!) par excellence   I always have ready-made answers to every/any question and they are the right answers! 

 

(We call this ‚Äú the ability to think on one's feet‚Äù and it‚Äô's a gift perfected through studies and practice! )

 

I am not blowing my ‚Äúhorns‚Äù, nor ‚Äútrumpets‚Äù or ‚Äúxylophones‚Äù ( whichever ) a fact is a fact. Yes, scriptures say let someone ‚Äú blow your horn ‚Äú yet the lizard nods his head in appreciation of himself after landing safely from a fall from a height. Is he wrong? Not all. 

 

(Understand my ‚Äú horn and trumpet ‚Äú in the context of what you are about to read!)

 

There is nothing wrong or sinful in answering questions as I did then, what was lacking then was ‚Äúdiscernment‚Äù! Some questions are better left unanswered than answered.

 

From hindsight, I made many mistakes the consequences I am living with today. I made more enemies than friends because where I should have kept quiet I spoke. Questions I should have ignored I answered. I thought then that all men love to be told the truth. How na√Øve I was! The passage of years and experience has taught me that I was wrong. 

 

I ignored and disobeyed the ‚Äú law of seasons‚Äù with damning consequences. Read this law; 

Ecclesiastes 3

KJV

7+ A time to rend, and a time to sew; a time to keep silence, and a time to speak;

 

This is called ‚Äú the law of seasons ‚Äú learn and obey it else! 

 

Life has taught me much, which led me to understand and adopt the philosophy; ‚ÄúIn the midst of fools it is foolishness to be wise !‚Äù  Something Jesus exemplified when he appeared before the Sanhedrin Read it, 

 

Matthew 26

KJV

61+ And said, This fellow said, I am able to destroy the temple of God, and to build it in three days

.

62 And the high priest arose, and said unto him, Answerest thou nothing? What is it which these witness against thee?

 

63+ But Jesus held his peace. And the high priest answered and said unto him, I adjure thee by the living God, that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ, the Son of God.

 

The only time He opened His mouth was when Pilate acted ignorantly, as a show of power/authority Read it 

John 19

KJV

8 When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he was the more afraid;

9+ And went again into the judgment hall, and saith unto Jesus, Whence art thou? But Jesus gave him no answer.

 

10 Then saith Pilate unto him, Speakest thou not unto me? knowest thou not that I have power to crucify thee, and have power to release thee?

 

11+ Jesus answered, Thou couldest have no power at all against me, except it were given thee from above: therefore he that delivered me unto thee hath the greater sin.

 

Yes, this tells you that not every question deserves to be answered. Sometimes it is better to leave an ignorant person in his ignorance than to try to teach him! 

Proverbs 26

KJV

4+ Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.

 

Jesus held His quiet because when he assessed the audience it would be foolhardy to try to answer them. Please learn to do the same! 

 

Did Paul not give similar advice? Read it ;

2 Timothy 2

KJV

23+ But foolish and unlearned questions avoid, knowing that they do gender strifes.

 

Yes, questions fall into two categories, ‚Äúfoolish and unlearned.‚Äù  Know these, identify and categorise questions to decide whether to answer or not. 

 

‚ÄúFoolish questions‚Äù are mostly emotional in content, context and presentation! Know this.

 

‚ÄúUnlearned questions ‚Äú are mostly questions lacking in facts, coming from a ‚Äúhalf-baked‚Äù egoistic, playing to the gallery type of persons. Know this also 

 

Jesus refused to answer non-factual questions ( lies)! To Him, it would be a waste of time. 

 

Matthew 26:60-61,63 

NIV

[60] But they did not find any, though many false witnesses came forward. Finally, two came forward [61] and declared, ‚ÄúThis fellow said, 'I am able to destroy the temple of God and rebuild it in three days.' ‚Äù 

 

[63] But Jesus remained silent. The high priest said to him, ‚ÄúI charge you under oath by the living God: Tell us if you are the Messiah, the Son of God.‚Äù

 

Dearly beloved it is not every question you need to or must answer! Even in examinations we are told ‚Äú do not answer all questions ‚Äú. Answer two or three, so even though you could answer all five or six you are told to answer three. 

 

So you hear but you haven‚Äôt heard, you see but you haven‚Äôt seen; this is wisdom at its best. This is maturity. A wise man does not seek to justify himself by answering every question , his silence justifies and answers. 

 

Oh, a word to the wise!

title: Get Your House Wiring Right!
text:
Get Your House Wiring Right!  

Psalms 24

KJV

3 Who shall ascend into the hill of the Lord? or who shall stand in his holy place?

4+ He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart; who hath not lifted up his soul unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully.

 

As we ‚Äú ascend into the hill of the Lord‚Äù this morning to offer our worship and sacrifices may we meditate on these words. 

 

The psalmist asked a very simple but powerful soul-searching question, which everyone ‚Äúascending the hill of the Lord‚Äù ( Church) today must ask him/herself. 

 

He also provided the answer ‚Äú

He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart; who hath not lifted up his soul unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully.‚Äù

 

Clearly, these are ‚Äúspiritual measurements‚Äù that we are expected to use in calibrating our lives if our presence at ‚Äú the hill of the Lord‚Äù today will be of benefit to us. 

 

Read the rewards that go with the request to calibrate our lives

 

5 He shall receive the blessing from the Lord, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.

 

‚ÄúClean hands, pure heart, not lifted up his soul unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully‚Äù; all summed up is simply how we live. 

 

Our thoughts /deeds towards one another. , which is called the ‚Äúhorizontal relationship‚Äù with each other.  

 

The Apostle John clarified it when he said 

1 John 4

KJV

20+ If a man say, I love God, and hateth his brother, he is a liar: for he that loveth not his brother whom he hath seen, how can he love God whom he hath not seen?

 

Beloved we can not connect to God if the contact we have with ourselves is disconnected. . Power will not flow and we shall remain in darkness! Until our horizontal connections are okay, the vertical will not work and the power supply will be zero. 

 

ECG will not supply power to any house if the internal wiring is not well done. In the same manner, God will not link up to us when we are divided, bickering hating etc each other. Poor internal wiring. 

 

So if you are not receiving power from on-high, check your internal wiring! It may be off, loose and not tightened properly! 

 

As you ‚Äúascend to the hill of the Lord‚Äù this morning make sure your internal wiring ( mindset towards your neighbour) is good. 

This is how today‚Äôs assembly will benefit you. Pure heart and clean hands, it‚Äôs all about your mindset towards your fellow worshipper. 

 

A thought to share!

title: Only Let Me Walk With Thee!
text:
Only Let Me Walk With Thee!  

Exodus 23

Kjv

20 Behold, I send an Angel before thee, to keep thee in the way, and to bring thee into the place which I have prepared.

 

Exodus 13

KJV

21+ And the Lord went before them by day in a pillar of a cloud, to lead them the way; and by night in a pillar of fire, to give them light; to go by day and night:

 

That when God sends He provides is a common trait that runs through the scriptures! He provides whatever is required to anyone He sends as to accomplish His assignments!

 

When He called Noah, He gave him the guidelines to build the Ark that was to save mankind

 

When Hw called Abraham, He signed ‚Äúa contract‚Äù with Him that was to result in the establishment of a nation, Israel out of which the Messiah was to come. 

 

When He called Nehemiah, He touched the King, Artaxerxes‚Äô heart to fund the rebuilding of the Walls of Jerusalem from the Consolidated Fund! 

 

In many and in diverse ways He provided guidance, direction and protection to all and sundry that He called and chose; in the same way, He has guided and provided us support and sustenance through the year  

 

Today, here we stand at the threshold of crossing the ‚Äú Jordan ‚Äú to enter the promised year 2026! As we stand at the banks and cast our wishful eyes across the horizon, may we all prepare both spiritually and physically to cross over. 

 

May we examine and make amends to anything that may hinder us from crossing over. Joshua told Israel to perform a similar exercise ;

NIV

[10] So Joshua ordered the officers of the people:

 

[11] ‚ÄúGo through the camp and tell the people, 'Get your provisions ready. Three days from now you will cross the Jordan here to go in and take possession of the land the Lord your God is giving you for your own.' ‚Äù

 

Beloved, ‚Äú put your house in order ‚Äúfor in a few days we shall cross over. ! 

 

The times call for a pause to reflect. 

 

The times call for preparation, pause to prepare a road map for 2026,

 

The times call for correction, pause to identify mistakes, errors, wrongs and act to correct them. 

 

The times call for praise and thanksgiving both spiritual and physical, give to ‚ÄúCaesar‚Äù ( all who have helped you one way or the other ) his praise and thanksgiving! Then do the same to Jehovah!

 

Trust His promise 

‚ÄúBehold, I send an Angel before thee, to keep thee in the way, and to bring thee into the place which I have prepared.‚Äù 

 

And trust in His ever presence with you ; 

‚Äú And the Lord went before them by day in a pillar of a cloud, to lead them the way; and by night in a pillar of fire, to give them light; to go by day and night:‚Äù 

 

Yes, Lord let your fiery, cloudy pillar lead me all the remaining days of my life!  

 

A thought to share!

title: Let This Cup Pass From Me!
text:
Let This Cup Pass From Me! 

Matthew 26

KJV

39+ And he went a little further, and fell on his face, and prayed, saying, O my Father, if it be possible, let this cup pass from me: nevertheless not as I will, but as thou wilt.

 

This is the title of one of my favorite songs I believe was composed by the Sekyere Odumasi Gospel Singers (I may be wrong and stand to be corrected!)   

 

I feel greatly touched when it is sung before partaking of the Lord‚Äôs Supper. I‚Äôve always taught and advocated that songs /hymns /readings etc must match events! Hmmmm

 

It would seem the word ‚Äú Cup‚Äù was commonly used in the time of Jesus to represent ‚Äúsuffering, inconvenience ‚Äú and is understood by all. This was not the first time He used it.

 

Read it 

Matthew 20

KJV

22+ But Jesus answered and said, Ye know not what ye ask. Are ye able to drink of the cup that I shall drink of, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with? They say unto him, We are able.

 

Beloved, life presents us with many and diverse ‚Äú cups‚Äù to drink from; some large, medium others small sizes   Whatever size it is, it is a ‚Äú cup‚Äù that can not be avoided 

 

Some of these ‚Äú cups‚Äù are emotional distress, illnesses, business challenges, financial difficulties, home and marital, relational incompatibilities, betrayals, disloyalties etc. 

 

None of these ‚Äúcups‚Äù tastes sweet but bitter, like Jesus we all pray either audibly or silently ‚Äú let this cup pass from me ‚Äú.   As we read he concluded by saying ‚Äú

nevertheless not as I will, but as thou wilt.‚Äù 

 

Beloved, some ‚Äú cups‚Äù we can drink, others we can not. There are some difficulties and challenges we can either overcome or endure others we can not. 

 

It gets to a point in life where you just have to resign your will and accept the inevitable. by preparing the mind to live with it. 

 

Jesus prayed 3 times for the ‚Äú cup‚Äù to pass from Him but it was not to be, so he gave up to accept the inevitable   There comes a time when you must also resign and give in. 

 

It is easier said than done , here is where the difficulty lies. How do we know we have come to the end of the road? How do we know it is time to give in?

 

Beloved there is no easy formula except to discern through prayer and observation, the signs of the times   For example Jesus gave in when he observed the attitude of those He thought he could rely on. Please pay attention to these as I trace from the events in the garden 

 

Read the developments 

Matthew 26:38 

NIV

[38] Then he said to them, ‚ÄúMy soul is overwhelmed with sorrow to the point of death. Stay here and keep watch with me.‚Äù

 

He took with Him trusted , and loyal friends to the garden. He had earlier told them about the ‚Äú Cup‚Äù.and for which reason He brought them to the garden. So they knew why they were there with him. To lend support. 

 

He then asked them to ‚Äú Stay here and keep watch with me.‚Äù! Unfortunately, this was not to be. Read the next discouraging experience, the first sign, you should watch ; 

 

Matthew 26:40 

NIV

[40] Then he returned to his disciples and found them sleeping. ‚ÄúCouldn't you men keep watch with me for one hour?‚Äù he asked Peter.

 

This was a rhetorical question of disappointment! As if this was the end to the disappointment; it occurred again ;

Matthew 26:43

NIV

[43] When he came back, he again found them sleeping, because their eyes were heavy.

 

Yes, when those you thought you could rely on become occupied with their own interests, as  indicated above by these words ‚Äú their eyes were heavy ‚Äú then know the ‚Äúcup‚Äù was meant for you 

 

He left them went and came back again hoping to find them on their knees only to be sadly disappointed again   Read it 

 

Matthew 26:45 

NIV

[45] Then he returned to the disciples and said to them, ‚ÄúAre you still sleeping and resting? Look, the hour has come, and the Son of Man is delivered into the hands of sinners.

 

Yes, they were not only ‚Äú sleeping‚Äù but also ‚Äú resting ‚Äú which words paint pictures of different scenarios! To sleep is one thing to rest is another. 

 

They were simply chatting discussing probably their own affairs which had nothing to do with Jesus and why they were in the garden. 

 

Yes, when you see these attitudes among those you think will rally behind you, then know it is a ‚Äú cup‚Äù that you must drink! Resign your will and accept the inevitable. This is exactly what Jesus did! 

 

So, yes while you may pray ‚Äú let this cup pass from me ‚Äú also add ‚Äú nevertheless not as I will, but as thou wilt.‚Äù  and preiare your spirit and mind to endure the discomfort. 

 

You‚Äôll know it is His will that you drink of the ‚Äú cup‚Äù when friends and family desert you! 

 

An experience to share with you! A word to the wise!

title: Change Lesson Please!
text:
Change Lesson Please! 

(Written/posted 12th February 2020) 

2 Corinthians 5

KJV

17+ Therefore if any man be in Christ, he is a new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new.

 

Oh, how I miss the cry of the Bell boy at school who rings the bell and shouts the words ‚Äú change lesson please!‚Äù  The post of school bell boy was in our school days enviable. I contested once but lost! 

 

The way the girls admire you ( just bell boyoo!) and the style with which you shout the announcements, the show you make with the khaki khaki uniform ( up and down) well starched and ironed with a small hankie dangling from your back pocket! Oh oh oh. Hum! Time O time how I wished you would never move forward! 

 

Anyway, we changed the lesson as soon as we heard the bell. We took another book and new topics were taught new ideas were learned eventually we passed out with flying colors. 

 

Let‚Äôs turn our attention to the life we lead as Christians, we are expected to ‚Äúchange lessons‚Äù the very moment we were baptized but unfortunately, this is not the case with many. 

 

In Jerusalem ( AD 33) after Peter and the rest proclaimed the Gospel message the audience asked; 

 

Acts 2

37 Now when they heard this, they were pricked in their heart, and said unto Peter and to the rest of the apostles, Men, and brethren, what shall we do?

 

Peter‚Äôs answer to them was simple ‚ÄúChange lesson please !‚Äù Reas how he said it, 

 

Acts 2

38 Then Peter said unto them, Repent, and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins, and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.

 

Today all we do as preachers can be summed up in the words of the School Bell Boy ‚ÄúChange lesson please !‚Äù  We are calling all men to change their lessons, both believers and unbelievers. 

 

Here is how Paul also put in one such call to change the lesson!  

 

Colossians 3:5-10 NIV

[5] Put to death, therefore, whatever belongs to your earthly nature: sexual immorality, impurity, lust, evil desires, and greed, which is idolatry. 

 

[6] Because of these, the wrath of God  [7] You used to walk in these ways, in the life you once lived. 

 

[8] But now you must also rid yourselves of all such things as these: anger, rage, malice, slander, and filthy language from your lips.

 

[9] Do not lie to each other, since you have taken off your old self with its practices

[10] and have put on the new self, which is being renewed in knowledge in the image of its Creator.

 

Many are still not heeding the Bell Boy‚Äôs call to ‚Äú change lesson‚Äù. Be the new creature you are supposed to be. 

 

Beloved, It is time to change from the following lessons, envy, jealousy, wrath, lies, malice, greed, selfishness, hypocrisy 

 

Take your new book and write the following new life lessons. Joy, peace, long-suffering, brotherly love and kindness, truth, gratitude, etc. 

 

It is time to ‚Äúchange lessons, please! ‚Äú 

 

Many have been promoted to upper classes ( age, statuses, duration in the church)  but are still clinging on to the old lesson notes from the primary department! 

 

Brother/Sister Change lesson please!  

 

Remember your old school days let the bell ring in your ears again. 

 

Be reminded that you are in a new school with new syllabi ( a Christian and not a worldly one) so put off to put on a new outlook. Change your old clothing and put on a new one.! 

 

Change the lesson, please! 

 

May God help us as we strive to ‚Äúchange lesson please! ‚Äú

 

My thoughts went to my school days and I remembered the bell boy how he shouts ‚ÄúChange lesson please !‚Äù Then I looked at how spiritually this is true to our living the Christian life! If the cap fits, please wear it. 

 

Written/posted 12th February 2020) )

title: Closing Please!
text:
Closing Please!

Ecclesiastes 3:4 (NIrV)

There is a time to weep. And there's a time to laugh. There is a time to be sad. And there's a time to dance.

 

After reading my post titled ‚Äù change lesson please!‚Äù someone asked if I could write on the last announcement ‚Äù closing please!‚Äù I said, why not! Here is what ‚Äùclosing please‚Äù reminded me of my School days! 

 

We normally close school with lots of homework assigned to us; the last period was used for copying them.

 

Because we had to join buses at the main Accra Central Bus Terminus, opposite the Opera Cinema (1964), some hurriedly copied without paying attention to what they were copying. 

 

The next day many get caned for mistakes made simply because they did not pay attention to what they were copying.

title: Fear Is Natural, Know How To Live With It.
text:
Fear Is Natural, Know How To Live With It. 

Proverbs 30

KJV

8+ Remove far from me vanity and lies: give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me with food convenient for me:

 

The most often ignored subject but real among men is the subject of Fear, it is assumed but not expressed! 

 

Fear is ‚Äúfeared‚Äù so much so that we are afraid to talk about ‚Äúhim‚Äù! Fear is a despot and a tyrant that has ruled mankind since the Creation. 

 

It has been the major cause of the failure of many a life. It shattered dreams, dimmed hopes, and rendered lives clueless and unenjoyable

 

It is a hidden spirit that lives in every man from Adam to John Tamakloe, it will continue to live till the last trumpet shall sound and time shall be no more. 

 

As long as time and Man exist, fear also lives. Fear therefore is a natural phenomenon that we can not do without   Almost every man listed in the Bible experienced its effect.  

 

Cain feared losing face so he killed his brother. Abraham feared death, so he told Abimelech that Sara was his sister. The list of men of God who feared ‚Äúfear‚Äù (!?) is a tall one. None is exempt!  

 

So don‚Äôt be afraid to ‚Äúfear‚Äù, you are not the first nor the last, everyone has something he/she fears. What you‚Äôve read as the verse for discussion is David‚Äôs expression of his fears Both great and small, all do have fears. 

 

In life there are three main situations or circumstances that we all fear, these are Death, Poverty and Sickness; all others are subservient and minor. 

 

Death, poverty and sickness stood out in a ‚Äúuniversal opinion poll‚Äù as the topmost that humanity fears. If in doubt conduct your own, ask yourself privately and in the quiet what do I fear? You‚Äôll be surprised that these three will emerge as the topmost. 

 

David had his fears as expressed in the verse you‚Äôve read. ‚ÄúDo not make me rich or poor else there will be dire consequences that I cannot stand.‚Äù By these words, he is saying ‚ÄúI am afraid of extremities!‚Äù

 

It was in my first year in College, that I was introduced to Jeremy Bentham the ‚Äúfather‚Äù of the philosophy known as ‚Äú utilitarianism ‚Äú

( John Locke, John Stuart Mills, etc also wrote on this subject )  

 

One of his famous quotes that has remained etched on my mind over the years reads; 

 

‚ÄúNature has placed mankind under the governance of two sovereign masters, pain and pleasure. It is for them alone to point out what we ought to do, as well as to determine what we shall do. 

 

On the one hand the standard of right and wrong, on the other the chain of causes and effects, are fastened to their throne‚Äù

( Unquote) .

 

Oh mine! What a truth! Two ‚Äúsovereign masters‚Äù rule our lives they are called ‚Äú pain and ‚Äú pleasure ‚Äú. These two are the determinants, they decide what we do and or do not do. 

 

Indeed everything we do in life is to avoid or minimise ‚Äúpain‚Äù and increase ‚Äúpleasure‚Äù. 

 

For example, to avoid the pain associated with walking long distances we ride in a car. To avoid the stress associated with fanning a coal pot fire we buy and use gas or electric-powered stoves. 

 

Yes, the Fear of ‚Äú pain‚Äù drives us to work and buy items of comfort and pleasure. 

 

Death, poverty and sickness are what we feared most! Of the three Death is inevitable but still we can do something about it humanly speaking! 

 

Yes, I am sure you are surprised to read this! Remember I said ‚Äú humanly ‚Äú speaking. What then can we do will be your next question! 

 

If you care to know we can ‚Äú postpone ‚Äúits arrival date! Oh yes! The majority including you does it almost every day just that you don‚Äôt realise it! 

 

When we are sick don‚Äôt we visit hospitals? What do we go there to do? Why not stay at home to submit or succumb to the disease and die? 

 

Remember sicknesses are indications that the body has deviated from its normal natural ranges or parameters and needs ‚Äú resetting‚Äù. 

 

Something is out of setting and until it is reseted death will follow. Any time you attend a hospital, take a tablet etc ; you are postponing death‚Äôs arrival time. You are attempting to reset the body. 

 

Medicines,  medications, surgeries etc are deployed to reset the human parts that have gone out of their natural or original state. . All these efforts are meant to ‚Äú postpone ‚Äú or ‚Äú delay ‚Äú death. 

 

In the spiritual realm, intercessory prayers are made, seeking divine ‚Äú postponement ‚Äú the certainty of which is beyond human control. 

 

This belief and approach is based on the fact that God ‚Äúpostponed‚Äù someone‚Äôs death at His will and wish. If he did it to someone, then He can do it again. Here the reference is to King Hezekiah. (2 Kings 20) 

 

Death and sickness are ‚Äúdistant cousins‚Äù , if sickness is well handled/managed ‚Äúhe‚Äù keeps ‚Äúhis‚Äù distant cousin, death away for a while. Know this so you can prolong your life.

 

The paracetamols we take are all temporary ‚Äú  death and sickness postponing ‚Äú measures ! If you fail to take them sickness will visit, take and hand you over to Death. Now you know. 

 

Finally what about ‚Äú poverty ‚Äú? The fear of poverty is equally universal just like death and sickness. 

 

However, we can live with it if we know its secrets and how it operates. Read it. 

 

Poverty has many ‚Äúfriends‚Äù one of its best friends is called ‚Äúlazy‚Äù but because they afflict many it is called ‚Äú laziness ‚Äúü§£

 

If you unknowingly take him as a friend he will introduce you automatically to ‚ÄúPoverty‚Äù and his other friends; namely ‚Äúcomfort‚Äù and ‚Äúprocrastination‚Äù

 

Read the observation of one man! 

Proverbs 24:30-31,33-34 

NIV

[30] I went past the field of a sluggard, past the vineyard of someone who has no sense; [31] thorns had come up everywhere, the ground was covered with weeds, and the stone wall was in ruins

 

. [33] A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest--- [34] and poverty will come on you like a thief and scarcity like an armed man.

 

So, yes though poverty is one of the three most feared yet like the other two, it can be managed or contained. If we can identify and avoid ‚Äúhis‚Äù friends as listed above so be it. 

 

Yes, death, sickness and poverty are most feared yet we can live with them if we know how. Read over what you‚Äôve just read to remember how to live with them. 

 

Though they are inevitable do not let them overcome you, overcome them. 

 

A thought to share! A word to a right-thinking person is both an investment and a seed! 

 

Proverbs 9:9 

NIV

Instruct the wise and they will be wiser still; teach the righteous and they will add to their learning.

text:
