title: Concerning Rents And Rentals!
text:
Concerning Rents And Rentals!  

2 Corinthians 5

KJV

1+ For we know that if our earthly house of this tabernacle were dissolved, we have a building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.

 

During my usual morning walk, I came across various groups dismantling and removing canopies and other paraphernalia used to celebrate the recently concluded festivity. It struck me that we‚Äôve also rented ‚Äú canopies ‚Äú which will one day be dismantled! 

 

Our bodies are ‚Äú canopies ‚Äú we‚Äôve rented for use, the Owner will soon send His dismantling squad to take them away. Our rental agreements contain expiry dates so enjoy the duration you have the ‚Äú canopy‚Äù

 

Who the Dismantling squads are I‚Äôve identified and mentioned to the majority when I preached at funerals; so I need not repeat! Death itself is one! 

 

Just remember no matter how you decorate it, no matter how much time and money you spend on it when the expiry date comes your canopy will be dismantled! Pray that the ‚Äú squad‚Äù will do the dismantling gradually and gently not violently! 

 

Joe Atiso, a very popular singer with the Ramblers International Dance Band (1960s-1970s) sang a song in Ewe ‚Äú al√¥ m√® man√¥ ku nav√† wum ‚Äú ( I‚Äôll die in my sleep )   My generation will remember those days !!! Yes, when boys were boys! Where were you !! Hmm! 

 

I noticed how nice and beautiful some of the canopies looked but were dismantled! Some of the items that made them beautiful were pulled apart;  destroying them completely! I recognised that the same shall be done to our ‚Äú canopies ‚Äú when we die.

 

The dust shall return dust, ashes to Ashes. The canopy was made from the earth and to the earth it shall return! The occupant which is a spirit shall return to where it came to be assessed ( judge) and relocated.

 

Beloved, this does not mean you shouldn‚Äôt maintain ( dress and decorate ) your canopy, no please do, keep it up to date so it can serve you for a long time. 

 

When our ‚Äúfestive season‚Äù here on Earth is over, the earthly Canopy shall be dismantled , interestingly and thankfully there is a promise of another canopy elsewhere. 

 

Just that this new canopy will be made available to those who used the first earthly one properly and profitably. Those who obeyed and followed the rental rules attached to it by the Owner. 

 

Many we are told looked up to that new canopy so they conducted and comported themselves very well, as a result they received high commendations from the Rental Company owner. 

 

Matthew 10

KJV

32+ Whosoever therefore shall confess me before men, him will I confess also before my Father which is in heaven.

 

Revelation 3

KJV

5+ He that overcometh, the same shall be clothed in white raiment; and I will not blot out his name out of the book of life, but I will confess his name before my Father, and before his angels.

 

Oh, how we look forward to that day when upon the commendation of Jesus we shall be given new canopies! Canopies that can not be dismantled, they are eternal. 

 

Resolve to take good care of the present canopy you‚Äôve rented. It is temporal expect a   better one. 

 

My thoughts as I watched the dismantling of festive canopies and paraphernalia. 

 

2 Corinthians 5:1 

NIV

[1] For we know that if the earthly tent we live in is destroyed, we have a building from God, an eternal house in heaven, not built by human hands.

title: The Adventures Of One Man!
text:
The Adventures Of One Man!

Romans 5

KJV

12+ Wherefore, as by one man sin entered into the world, and death by sin; and so death passed upon all men, for that all have sinned:

 

This verse has been subjected to many interpretations with to proving that modern man is not responsible for his sins! That Adams should be blamed because it was his action /sin that spilt over. 

 

Tje Truth Of The matter is, yes we did not sin so we are not guilty but the consequences of Adam‚Äôs sin, which is death is what we have inherited. 

 

And it was this very reason that one man also came into the world to deliver us from this very consequence. 

Read

 

Romans 5:15,17-19 

NIV

[15] But the gift is not like the trespass. For if the many died by the trespass of the one man, how much more did God's grace and the gift that came by the grace of the one man, Jesus Christ, overflow to the many! 

 

[17] For if, by the trespass of the one man, death reigned through that one man, how much more will those who receive God's abundant provision of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one man, Jesus Christ!

 

[18] Consequently, just as one trespass resulted in condemnation for all people, so also one righteous act resulted in justification and life for all people. 

 

[19] For just as through the disobedience of the one man the many were made sinners, so also through the obedience of the one man the many will be made righteous.

 

So you see, one man through disobedience brought death, another through obedience brought life, it‚Äôs always a matter of choice.  

 

We see this in history either as a nation, family, church or community. One man‚Äôs adventure can result in a good or bad outcome, which can influence future generations 

 

Europe came into contact with Africa not as an official policy but through the adventures of individuals. 

 

Portugal came into contact with the Gold Coast through the adventures of an individual ‚Äú Don Diego de Azambuja‚Äù. A name I nearly adopted as a ‚Äúnickname ‚Äúwhen I was in primary school just because it sounded nice in my ears! Hmmm. 

 

British interest and influence in the Gold Coast was not through official channels but through the adventures of an individual Captain George Maclean. 

 

Trace the history of all the external contacts Africa has with Europe and you‚Äôll be amazed at how these came through the adventures of individuals   

 

Names like Mungo Park, David Livingstone, Vasco Da Gama, Christopher Columbus etc all point to the role individuals played in linking civilisations together. 

 

But you may be wondering why all these ‚Äú discourse ?‚Äù

 

It is to make the point that history is about individuals and not a collective. Collectives don‚Äôt make history it is individuals. 

 

Committees/commissions etc; don‚Äôt make history it is individuals, they only help or assist an individual whose name at the end of the day is attached to the Report. 

 

You‚Äôve heard of the 1948 Watson Commission Report. The justice Ollenu Commission Report, Justice Archer Commission Report, justice VCRAC Crabbe Report, Emile Short Report etc 

 

When it comes to the church of Christ Ghana, one individual stands tall as the one whose singular effort to know and practice the truth has resulted in the thousands of churches of Christ we see in Ghana today! 

 

John Gaido is the name. So when you lift your hands in praise of God, if you beat your chest because you know the truth, do not forget the individual through whom God made this possible. 

 

Whether we like it or not we cannot deny the role and place of John Gaido in the history of the churches of Christ, Ghana. His singular effort is what has brought us this far. 

 

Yes, history is not made by a collective but by an individual! What is there to be credited to your name? 

 

In political discourse and governance ; you hear more of the ‚Äú Nkrumah administration ‚Äú the Busia Administration, Limann, Rawlings, Mills, Mahama, Akkufo Addo administrations. Very little almost forgotten collective administrations such as the NLC, SMC, PNDC! 

 

History is made by individuals and not a collective. Individuals are remembered not a collective. 

 

As I watch the growth and spread of the churches of Christ these thoughts flowed through my mind. 

 

Those of us who are drinking from Wells we never dug, should not forget those who dug them. 

 

If today you are leading a nation, group, family, congregation etc that you were never a part of it‚Äôs established, do not forget those who laid down their lives, time, talent, resources etc to bring it into existence 

 

Church of Christ, Ghana owes a lot to an individual-John Gaido!

 

My thoughts as usual to share. From one man‚Äôs spiritual adventure has resulted the salvation of the many!

title: My Prayer And Hearts Desire!
text:
My Prayer And Hearts Desire! 

Deuteronomy 33

KJV

25 Thy shoes shall be iron and brass; and as thy days, so shall thy strength be.

 

27+ The eternal God is thy refuge, and underneath are the everlasting arms: and he shall thrust out the enemy from before thee; and shall say, Destroy them.

 

Standing on the promises of God, Israel was secure in the desert years. Even so, we who stand on the same promises today shall never be moved or disappointed. 

 

No matter what the times will bring, He will make a way for us to go through successfully! Panic and anxiety shall be a thing of the past if only we keep faith and focus on Him. 

 

If and when our boats shall be full of water, when the storms shall gather to blow us off course ; we can smile because we have in the boat He who spoke and the storms ceased and calm was restored. Even so shall it be with our lives 

 

Mark 4

KJV

39+ And he arose, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace, be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

 

‚Äú And as thy days, so shall thy strength be.‚Äù Here is a promise of ‚Äú undiminished strength ‚Äú Divine strength shall be supplied to charge and uplift us each day of our lives. Never shall we operate on ‚Äú low battery!‚Äù  

 

You‚Äôll be old in age but young in heart, spirit, strength, and happiness! Many will see and marvel at the unchanging nature of your outlook. Yes, it is the doing of the Lord, because He loves you! 

 

He will fill your mouth with much that you will chew every day , Only be careful with your walk with Him.

 

Psalm 81:10 

NIV

[10] I am the Lord your God, who brought you up out of Egypt. Open wide your mouth and I will fill it.

 

As we enter the new year may these promises sustain our faith , and guide us in all we do. 

 

Maranatha

title: Celebrations: Rejoice Openly In Your Accomplishments
text:
Celebrations: Rejoice Openly In Your Accomplishments! 

Galatians 6:4-5 

NIV

[4] Each one should test their own actions. Then they can take pride in themselves alone, without comparing themselves to someone else, [5] for each one should carry their own load.

 

Ecclesiastes 6:12 

NIV

[12] For who knows what is good for a person in life, during the few and meaningless days they pass through like a shadow? Who can tell them what will happen under the sun after they are gone?

 

Celebrations in general have posed numerous questions to many. Some hold the view that celebrations should be a no-go event so they celebrate nothing. 

 

Wedding anniversaries, birthdays, achievements, successes, promotions etc are not to be celebrated. To them, it is simply ‚Äúgo to church, give thanks verbally to God, ask for prayers and that ends it.‚Äù 

 

To these people, celebrations lead to evil and they have ready a verse of scripture to cite in support. 

 

Read the scriptures they put forth ;

Mark 6:21-25 

NIV

[21] Finally the opportune time came. On his birthday Herod gave a banquet for his high officials and military commanders and the leading men of Galilee. 

 

[22] When the daughter of Herodias came in and danced, she pleased Herod and his dinner guests. The king said to the girl, ‚ÄúAsk me for anything you want, and I'll give it to you.‚Äù 

 

[23] And he promised her with an oath, ‚ÄúWhatever you ask I will give you, up to half my kingdom.‚Äù 

 

[24] She went out and said to her mother, ‚ÄúWhat shall I ask for?‚Äù ‚ÄúThe head of John the Baptist,‚Äù she answered. 

 

[25] At once the girl hurried in to the king with the request: ‚ÄúI want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptist on a platter.‚Äù

 

Oh oh oh! Their conclusion here is that celebrations lead to evil! So to celebrate is wrong! Instead of learning a lesson from the narrative, ‚Äú they throw both the baby and the water away ‚Äú. Yes! 

 

Meanwhile, the Apostle is teaching/encouraging us to celebrate our accomplishments! Independent evaluation, thought and rejoicing are encouraged as per the above verses! 

 

As the year draws to a close each must evaluate his works and if there is anything that he must celebrate he has every right to do so. 

 

Many have often wondered why some should organise celebrations where they invite friends and neighbors to join them in celebrating their achievements, and not only go to church, give thanks to God and leave it there! 

 

This is an option there are several options, one is what the Apostle recommended 

 

You‚Äôve read what he said ; 

‚ÄúEach one should test their own actions. Then they can take pride in themselves alone,‚Äù To ‚Äú take pride in oneself ‚Äô‚Äù is to be satisfied with what one has achieved! 

 

And when one is satisfied with what he has achieved what does he do if not to celebrate! 

 

It is important to note that he is not doing this to spite somebody, or make a show; again this is stated there ‚Äúwithout comparing themselves to someone else,‚Äù 

 

Beloved, Celebrate your life‚Äôs accomplishments, it‚Äôs a gift that God gave you. Solomon said the same;  

 

Ecclesiastes 3:22 

NIV

[22] So I saw that there is nothing better for a person than to enjoy their work, because that is their lot. For who can bring them to see what will happen after them?

 

‚ÄúTo enjoy their work‚Äù means to celebrate! Because you only live once you are better off rejoicing and enjoying the rewards of your toil and labor however great or small it is! 

 

The uninitiated sees celebrations as evil and contrary to what pleases God! To celebrate personal accomplishments or not is a matter of opinion and not of faith, so there is no right or wrong about it scripturally! 

 

So, when God blesses you celebrate it, when and how is your choice only balance those invited else you‚Äôll be guilty of discriminating! 

 

Read it;

Luke 14:12-14 

NIV

[12] Then Jesus said to his host, ‚ÄúWhen you give a luncheon or dinner, do not invite your friends, your brothers or sisters, your relatives, or your rich neighbours; if you do, they may invite you back and so you will be repaid. 

 

[13] But when you give a banquet, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, the blind,

 

[14] and you will be blessed. Although they cannot repay you, you will be repaid at the resurrection of the righteous.‚Äù

 

The lesson is ‚Äú balance the invitation list ‚Äú it should be 50/50, 60/40 or 70/30   It should not be 100% elites. 

 

My thoughts to share as I watch the tendency among professing believers to hide from public view their celebrations! If and whenever God blesses you, celebrate.

title: Almost At The Crossing!
text:
Almost At The Crossing! 

Joshua 4

KJV

22 Then ye shall let your children know, saying, Israel came over this Jordan on dry land.

 

23+ For the Lord your God dried up the waters of Jordan from before you, until ye were passed over, as the Lord your God did to the Red sea, which he dried up from before us, until we were gone over:

 

At every road crossing, we were taught as children to look to our right, then left and then right again before we move. We were told it was for our safety when we asked why we had to look to the right twice. 

 

Today, we stand at a crossing. We have come a long way, and within a few hours, we shall set foot on an unknown, uncharted path. How we travel is of great importance hence the need to look ‚Äú right, left, right again! 

 

We began the year with many but when we look to our ‚Äúright, left and right‚Äù again ; some have fallen! We pay tribute to their gallantry and the joys and blessings they brought us. 

 

Two rivers were crossed before Israel possessed her possession, this is what the above scriptures highlighted. The first was the Red Sea, the second was the Jordan! 

 

Today being the last day of the journey that has taken us three hundred and sixty-five days we need to reflect on what has been our lot   How far have we come! Our ‚Äúwilderness journey‚Äù just like that of Israel has not been the best as many will attest.  

 

There have been painful and sorrowful occasions just as there have been a few joyful moments! There have been many hurts just as there have been few healings. There have been great losses as there have been few gains! 

 

Through all these ‚Äúups‚Äù and ‚Äúdowns‚Äù both His fiery and cloudy pillars have seen us through successfully! Where there is a will, there will always be a way! 

 

Beloved, as we stand today at the banks of our ‚ÄúJordan‚Äù ready to cross, let us resolve to put away all that pollutes and contaminates both the mind and the spirit. 

 

2 Corinthians 7

KJV

1+ Having therefore these promises, dearly beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.

 

A new beginning is about to dawn on us, unworthy as we are yet His Grace is sufficient for us. Let us acknowledge that ‚Äúwe are who we are because of who He is! ‚ÄúLet us therefore live to reflect His image through us. 

 

He is the Light that shines through us so those in darkness can see. This is a charge He gave us!

 

Matthew 5:16 

NIV

[16] In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.

 

Let the coming year be a year of good deeds! Let it be a year of service to humanity! Let it be a year of reconciliation among factions. Let it be a year of teamwork/spirit   Let it be a year of goodwill towards all men! 

 

. Hebrews 12:14

NIV

[14] Make every effort to live in peace with everyone and to be holy; without holiness no one will see the Lord. .

 

Identify and avoid relationships that will provoke and be vexations to your spirit! Remember, to owe no man anything except the debt of love. Do not attempt to please all men , this is an impossible task! 

 

Do what you can, with what you have, at where you are Nothing more nothing less; it is for these you‚Äôll give an account. 

 

Spend today in the quietness of your heart to reflect on the past. The countdown has begun, and soon we shall by His Grace enter into the promised year. 

 

Do not panic or be anxious, just standstill to see the salvation of the Lord! 

 

Thoughts to share

title: Time!
text:
Time can be a Friend 

Or a Foe, depending 

On who, when, and how

And where it is deployed

Time is neutral. 

 

Time is ‚Äúeffective ‚Äú

And useful Blind, it blends with 

Any environment 

In a lazy environment 

It goes slowly! In a Productive 

Environment, it runs fast. 

 

Time, will bring 

Memories of sorrow, 

joy, pain, Hurt or

Sadness, depending 

On the situation and circumstance! 

Time is neutral 

 

Time can make 

Or break you, depending 

On how you handle it. 

It will give back to

You what use you 

Put it to! 

Time Is neutral 

 

Time, to a Fool

Is a luxury to be wasted, 

But To the Wise an asset 

To be managed ; what you‚Äôll 

Become tomorrow depends on its use today 

Time Is neutral! 

 

Time is. A free

Gift, you paid 

Nothing for it 

But you‚Äôll account 

For its usage 

So use it wisely 

Time is neutral 

 

Time Is a commodity 

That can be 

Sold and bought 

At a price! So

Price your time wisely  

Time is neutral 

 

Time is the future 

The future is time 

Time is an everyday 

Occurrence, therefore 

Every day is the Future I  

Time is neutral 

 

Time is a Currency 

Everything is priced 

In it, its denominations 

Are seconds, minutes

Days, weeks, months 

And years! So spend wisely 

Time is neutral!

 

(Think deeply to unearth 

The truth hidden in

What you‚Äôve read)

title: Trust Not!
text:
Trust not is

A cautionary advice 

From the Wise, that

Many have ignored 

To their destruction!  

 

Trust not is

An alert which if 

Heeded to would have 

Kept many from A 

Perpetual Pain And Regret

 

Trust Not

Can only be said 

By the Aged 

Who has experienced 

The consequences 

Of disobeying the advice. 

 

Trust not 

Is incomplete 

If one does not 

Know whom not 

To Trust. So ; 

 

Trust not

The sycophant, the 

Hypocrite, the Traitor, 

Betrayer and The opportunist. 

Not all who smile  With You Is sincere 

Judas walked with Jesus ; 

Yet! 

 

Trust not 

The double-face, the 

Double tongue, who 

For a pittance, Will

Sell You. When the 

Price is Right 

 

Thoughts to share. A word to the Wise

title: It‚Äôs All A Matter Of How You Run!
text:
It‚Äôs All A Matter Of How You Run! 

Hebrews 12

KJV

1+ Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which doth so easily beset us, and let us run with patience the race that is set before us,

 

Athletes will tell you how tense and anxious they feel in the few moments before a race begins! 

 

Students entering the examination hall to write their final decisive papers will tell you how tense and anxious they feel 

 

Almost everyone feels the same in any given situation where he/she is uncertain of the outcome. 

 

The same state and situation we‚Äôve found ourselves in as we enter the new year. Uncertainties galore is how someone described it! 

 

How we start a race is equally important as how we end it. With tact and planning a race may not pose a challenge that can not be overcome if proper planning precedes it. So these few ‚Äú hours ‚Äú of the year are the time to do exactly that. Spend time to think through, pray, consult, talk to the spiritually minded , tap into their wisdom etc 

 

I sat at home throughout yesterday thinking and praying seeking ‚Äúguidance‚Äù and ‚Äúdirection‚Äù. Some called to ask what my thoughts and plans are for the year. I told them ‚Äú I am waiting for direction, it has not yet come!‚Äù They asked ‚ÄúFrom whom?‚Äù I said ‚Äú from above !‚Äù

 

The Hebrew writer says ‚ÄúLet us run with patience the race that is set before us,‚Äù In like manner let us begin the year with patience, and not be in a hurry. 

 

Let us ‚Äú walk ‚Äú in the first few days of the month feeling and fashioning our ways and plans! Let us hasten, yes but ‚Äúhasten slowly‚Äù! Run, yes but ‚Äú run with patience‚Äú

 

Use the few days to ‚Äú walk ‚Äú around and make sure you are certain, before you begin the race!  

 

A ‚Äúrace‚Äù of 365 days, which translates into 8,760 hours surely must be undertaken with proper planning. A well-thought-out strategy is required else one will give up midway. 

 

So the advice and admonition is ‚Äú run with patience‚Äù the race that lies ahead of you. Pay attention to details, exercise extreme caution when dealing with people. Physical and spiritual scammers will display their ‚Äúwares‚Äù  so be careful and vigilant   You‚Äôve heard of the expression ‚Äú buyer beware‚Äù!  Yes. 

 

Even as I write some ‚Äúscammers‚Äù are at work trying to ‚Äúscam‚Äù me by creating the impression that a fault I have is difficult and can not be resolved quickly and easily. 

 

I grant them their ignorance, they don‚Äôt know that they are talking to an engineer, who knows what the problem is but has called them out because the State required that he does so. 

 

Be vigilant and wise both physically and spiritually , the race has just begun! 

 

My thoughts to share

title: The Waiting Time !
text:
The Waiting Time!  

Luke 24

KJV

49+ And, behold, I send the promise of my Father upon you: but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem, until ye be endued with power from on high

 

Acts 1:7-8 

NIV

[7] He said to them: ‚ÄúIt is not for you to know the times or dates the Father has set by his own authority. 

 

[8] But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you; and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.‚Äù

 

Before God does anything with anybody at anytime and anywhere, there is always a ‚Äúwaiting time.‚Äù 

 

This waiting time is the time of preparation, during which time He takes the person through a series of courses, some spiritual others physical 

 

Take the call and deployment of Moses as an example. He had to go to the wilderness, to observe and encounter the Divine through the ‚Äú burning bush‚Äù incident. His preparation began there. 

 

Take the case of Joseph, he has to go through the course of how to manage rejection, by being thrown into a well, then brought out only to be sold into slavery by no stranger but his own brothers. Yes! 

 

What about Paul  read his own account of his ‚Äú waiting and preparation time ‚Äú 

 

Galatians 1:15-18 

NIV

[15] But when God, who set me apart from my mother's womb and called me by his grace, was pleased [16] to reveal his Son in me so that I might preach him among the Gentiles, my immediate response was not to consult any human being. 

 

[17] I did not go up to Jerusalem to see those who were apostles before I was, but I went into Arabia. Later I returned to Damascus. 

 

[18] Then after three years, I went up to Jerusalem to get acquainted with Cephas and stayed with him fifteen days.

 

Have you ever asked why he went into Arabia, ? What was he there for? As he said, he could have gone to see the apostles to receive  ‚Äúapp√¥, instructions and guidance ‚Äú but he said no I didn‚Äôt! 

 

We can only surmise that he was in Arabia, where he underwent preparation and orientation after which he returned to Damascus!  

 

You‚Äôll recall he was on his way to Damascus when he was converted   Read it; 

 

Acts 22:5-6,11

NIV

[5] as the high priest and all the Council can themselves testify. I even obtained letters from them to their associates in Damascus, and went there to bring these people as prisoners to Jerusalem to be punished.

 

[6] ‚ÄúAbout noon as I came near Damascus, suddenly a bright light from heaven flashed around me. 

 

[11] My companions led me by the hand into Damascus, because the brilliance of the light had blinded me.

 

So you now know the meaning of what he said ‚Äú later I returned to Damascus ‚Äú

 

‚ÄúI did not go up to Jerusalem to see those who were apostles before I was, but I went into Arabia. Later I returned to Damascus. 

 

I can cite many examples of how many began their walk with God. Even Jesus had to go to the wilderness! What He went through that we label ‚Äú temptation by the devil‚Äù was actually part of the course He must take. It was part of His level 101 course. 

 

I‚Äôve said all these things to make the case that the first few months of the year will be our ‚Äúpreparation time‚Äù. God intend to do great things for and with you! He must first prepare you so whatever befalls or comes your way, know that it is part of the ‚Äúwaiting‚Äù course. 

 

There will be your ‚Äú burning bush‚Äù, betrayals, trials and temptations, etc period and experience; in all these know that you are being prepared for a greater assignment 

 

Just as Moses, Joseph, Paul etc graduated and became who they are, even so you‚Äôll be if you remain steadfast! Remember none of what they went through lasted forever!

 

Just know that there will be periods of inconvenience which is what they experienced. Always repeat ;

Romans 8

KJV

31+ What shall we then say to these things? If God be for us, who can be against us?

 

And do remember His promise and assurance,

Isaiah 43:2 

NIV

[2] When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and when you pass through the rivers, they will not sweep over you. When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned; the flames will not set you ablaze.

 

Don‚Äôt say I never told you. Thoughts to share!
